Reviews.Title: “Quiet inside but - Step out the door into the action!”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Eds_Threads
Reviews.Content: Great stay here in Amsterdam in a room away from the street - so lovely and quiet (room 2208) Clean, smart and business like room - didnt get to try the breakfast as so many places to eat around. Right in the centre - able to walk to/from central station in 5 minutes Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tagon13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! For us anyway. We just wanted to get away from home for a night with our dog. No problem. Rooms are modern and clean, bed was so comfortable! Location is in the centre of Amsterdam. The breakfast was great and well worth the â‚¬â‚¬! Next time we go back to Amsterdam we will DEFINITELY stay here. The parking was a little expensive, but the hotel offers a discount. Next time we will probably take the train, only a 10 minute walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Julie Y
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel after reading other reviews. I was planning to travel on my own but ended up visiting with my teenage son. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was clean and I would recommend it to any female travelling alone. Breakfast was very expensive but there were plenty of places close by where we could buy a meal for 5 euros. If you turn left when exiting the hotel and then left onto the main street there is an excellent supermarket about 100 metres along this road. I would certainly consider booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KBH70
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in the center of Amsterdam. Excellent rooms equipped with all necessary equipment. It is a pity that there was no Russian TV channel. Very friendly staff always ready to help even with my bad English. Nearby are many cafes and restaurants from fast food restaurants to Latin American cuisine. The only thing that did not like the high price.

Reviews.Title: “My Bad Experience.”
Reviews.Author: CorynneC
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on the location. I was visiting over Easter weekend and while the price for my 3 night stay was ludicrously high (200 per night), I let my desire for a nice, safe location make the price seem fair. While the location did live up to expectation and the hotel was relatively nice. 600 was far too steep for what I got in return. The room itself was find. A standard hotel room really. Albeit with a very expensive minibar. The beds were comfortable enough. I didn't partake in any meals during my stay but the staff were very kind on check in and out. The real dampner to my stay here happened after I left Amsterdam and returned home. I checked my bank account online a few days later to see that I had been left penniless. I called my bank straight away and they told me there was more than one transaction by Inntel Hotels Amsterdam Centre. After much correspondence with the hotel, they admitted to authorizing my card for 240 euro and then also 416.36 and also charging the 600 for my actual stay. At first the claimed to only have put 240 on authorization but my bank was able to confirm for me that this was not the case. I'm still waiting to get my money back from them even though they've claimed to have cancelled the authorisations. This could take 10 working days for the bank to process. I've been forced to alter plans and my life based on the fact that the hotel robbed me. Yes, robbed. While their staff have been relatively helpful in trying to return the stolen money to me, it's not good enough. I was not offered any compensation nor any sincere apology (nothing above "sorry for the inconvenience" - inconvenience being the understatement of the century here). This sort of occurrence shouldn't have happened in the first place. To be honest, the whole drama has left me with nothing but bad feelings about this hotel and my trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, easy stay”
Reviews.Author: Fionamaryadvises
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location within walking distance of Central Station. Very clean and friendly staff who are well versed in English. Great wireless service throughout the hotel and free one hour PC access in the lounge. Great sized rooms for stays longer than one night, excellent range of breakfast foods with plenty of seating.

Reviews.Title: “great location...clean and stylish!”
Reviews.Author: aysegulbarber
Reviews.Content: Â This medium sized Â hotel is in a fantastic location in Amsterdam. It was within walking distance to the main train station, canals and the touristic shopping and leisure district, with a tram stop just outside. The rooms were a generous size, modern and clean with interesting artwork. I loved the cosy bar area downstairs with an open fireplace...the breakfast room was very light looking out into the atrium and breakfast was very good, if a little expensive. I also liked the idea of the security card operated lift in the hotel. The staff were friendly and polite. This hotel definitely Â will be my first choice if I return to Amsterdam again...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for quick stop over”
Reviews.Author: A_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Perfect, central location with convenient parking under the hotel. Friendly staff. Spacious room. Perfect, fast wifi with no password. Comfy beds with two great pillows each! (Never underestimate the power of good pillows.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast34
Reviews.Content: Regularly stop here as a stop over hotel. In the centre of Amsterdam, which means a quick walk to Centraal Station for train back to airport. Hotel decor is modern. Only thing is, i keep getting small amounts of Euros being charged to my CC either for mini bar, or swipe guarantees. Not sure why!?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay after an evening at the Stopera, Concertgebouw”
Reviews.Author: Nicole D
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, grat location, friendly staff. Since many years we stay here for one night when we attend to go to the Stopera or Concertgebouw.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyF1
Reviews.Content: Having previously visited Amsterdam we were travelling this time with two young adults but still found the location central to all the desired amenties - coffee shops, pubs, shops and eateries. We booked through Expedia who phoned through to the hotel to specifically book a double and twin room of which i had an emal confirmation. Upon arrival the receptionist was adamant this was not the case. I pulled out my confirmation at which time she changed the rooms, an unnecessary negative to the beginning of the hotel. The rooms were small but suffcient. They were clean, comfortable but not the quietest. Church bells rang every hour in the early morning and you can hear the neighbours through the night!!!! Also, shower pressure in the bathrrom was poor, i expected better from a four star hotel. The best customer facing element of this hotel was the concierge. These were the only staff to positively interact with us and go the extra ile, all other staff seemed quite impersonal. If you are going to stay here, do go to Betty Boop's Coffee Shop opposite the hotel but take care of the stairs and do try the vaporiser! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurotripper05
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2012. A great hotel, with a fantastic location. Everything seemed to be a five minute walk away. Lovely restaurants and pubs on the door step and right beside a tram stop. Very clean and friendly. The breakfast was top class and the rooms well insulated so heard no noise from the street or from other rooms. Would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Femke H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully designed, very light and fresh. The beds very comfortable, good air conditioning and possiblility of opening a window. Friendly staff. Location very central.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: ko-zu10
Reviews.Content: comfortable, nicely decorated, perfect location. breakfast can be better. staying in the connected building is a bit tiring because you need to change the elevator :S

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: Great stay, and ace hotel. Stayed here with my other half, by UK standards definitely not 4*, but given European standards and the location it was great. Brill location, really close to major attractions, and excellent restaurants and bars around. I highly recommend the Italian restaurant a couple of doors down. Really friendly staff, brilliant bathroom and shower. Stayed in a superior room, very small but had a very large and really comfy bed. Would surely stay there again, really great time and for the price (we paid Â£230 for two nights) was a great location, you would struggle to find better. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Short business trip”
Reviews.Author: 893Nicole
Reviews.Content: Good reception, walking distance from public transport, clean rooms, good service and friendly and helpful staff. Parking and access by car is bit of a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to the best.”
Reviews.Author: RhondaMackay
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in Amsterdam, this hotel is in a great location close to the railway station, close to the Pier where we were to board our ship and right in the city centre. We arrived at the hotel and were offered a free upgrade to a wonderful room, clean & quiet room.The breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 stars....”
Reviews.Author: Majed_S
Reviews.Content: when I made my booking to this hotel the information that I got was "4 Stars hotel with a contemporary furniture". However, the hotel is way below the 4 stars category and can be classified as 3 stars only "my personal opinion". The paid price per room was 106 EUR per day per room for 3 nights (2 rooms). Which was overpriced for a similar hotels. The room was a bit small but tidy. The bed is comfort and the room temperature is good. Even though we have not used it, the room has air condition which will be a must if traveling during summer. Hotel location is within a walking distance from central and Dam Sq. (around 10 minutes). Frankly, I have felt cheated by being told that it is a 4 stars hotel. And If we know during booking that this is 3 stars we would definitely look for alternative within the same price range. I will not recommend this hotel and do not be deceived by some of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “not 4, but 2 and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: roman k
Reviews.Content: hotel is located very close to amsterdam railway station, very close to the centre of the centre of amsterdam. i dont know the details of how the hotels get their stars, but reception, small evening bar and quite small rooms should not be enough to get 4 stars i think. forget about almost any service which you would not get in 3 stars hotel, vice versa - the plastic bed sheet are a sign that the hotel has the same attitude as cheap US motels (which use it as well) - expecting dirty guests, preventing their low-quality mattresses from guest stink (usual cover/blanket is also smartly replaced by feather quilt so the stink of sweating guests is guaranteed in combination with the plastic bottom). as far as mattresses are concerned - ba careful when turning from one side to another on this very bouncy thing reminding trampolin, as you can be easily lanched outside the "bed" (wooden desk with mattress on it)... also - dont expect too much from breakfast for 15 euros. one kind of hard cheese and one brie represent (for example) the cheese-offer of a breakfast buffet. it is compensated with fresh orange juice for those, who want to start their day by paying for squeezing the oranges... so - location is excellent, the rest oscillates between 2 and 3 stars, just the price is 4 stars...

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: scubadiver5
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at this hotel for a weekend break in March. Short walk from the station, well located for shops, cafes, sights etc. Good value for money for a city centre hotel - tip-book room only and eat breakfast in a choice of local cafes serving cooked breakfast for around half the hotel price. Staff were really helpful, the rooms were clean and adequate in size- would be happy to stay here again. Try the next door restaurant (Humphries) for an excellent three course meal for the set price of 23.95 Euros - bargain of the weekend! Can also recommend the bar "in de Wildeman" which is a few doors along from the hotel - 18 taps and 260 bottled beers- great atmosphere and mixed clientele, not too touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Inntel!”
Reviews.Author: clo04x
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel for one night as we were doing the ferry trip and decided to spend one night over in the city. I would recommend this to anyone as it gives you more time to explore the great city of Amsterdam! The hotel is in a great location close to the main shopping areas and short walks to everything around! The hotel was lovely inside and was very clean it is great value for money and would definately use this hotel again! We arrived before the check in time of 12pm and the room was already ready for us which was a bonus!The rooms are spacious and clean and the bed was super comfy I booked a superior room which the bed is a king size! . Would recommed this to anyone! great location, great hotel and a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - stayed on several occasions.”
Reviews.Author: MilzyG
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff, rooms and location to everything. Have stayed several times and never a need to moan or complain. Great attitude by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel in Amsterdam's city centre”
Reviews.Author: MikeB92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really at the heart of everything what Amsterdam is famous for. It offers good value for money taken into consideration the location of this hotel. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom is not very special but it is clean and it will offer everything you need. Breakfast was good, a nice choice of products at a reasonable price. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business.”
Reviews.Author: SmiFre
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight for a business meeting - perfect location, right near the train station and close to downtown (where my meeting was). Excellent internet and very helpful front desk staff - they helped me order takeout and even hand delivered the utensils when the delivery guy didn't bring me any (also brought a bottle opener, very helpful!) The breakfast was great and quick - buffet style. If you're in Amsterdam for business, highly recommend. I will stay here again on my next trip, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with perfect central position.”
Reviews.Author: George1133
Reviews.Content: I spent only 1 night in this hotel. Rooms are clean, rather small, but good enough if you travel for business. For reasonable price you get what you need and they add free wi-fi. All major things to see are not far away. The parking is a problem... Public parking is close, but will cost you 50 EUR for a night and if you get discount still almost 40. Yet again... Hotel is Ok and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: WKTham
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in end January 2012. The staff are friendly and helpful. Very good location, walking distance to Dam Square. If you prefer to have breakfast outside of the hotel, there are many restaurants and cafes nearby. Bike rental is just 2 doors away. Room is clean and bright with coffee and tea making facilities, which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: edward b
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2 nights very close to the heart of amsterdam friendly helpful staff clean room

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: BigTuna3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inntel for 6 days. The hotel is in a great spot, the city center, a 5 min walk from Centraal Station. The staff was friendly and the room was clean (and kept clean throughout my stay). No real complaints. The only negatives were that the view was terrible and the window was a little drafty. Overall I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Football Trip”
Reviews.Author: Steve D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff. Great experience from checking in to checking out. Had a small issue which was handled perfectly and promptly. Definitely recommend. Very close to station and Damm Square and other interesting venues.

Reviews.Title: “Our winter visit”
Reviews.Author: DIANE P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would gladly come again. Staff were friendly and available if we needed them. There were only a few small things that could have made the trip better. Firstly, there was little written information about the hotel i.e. menu with costs etc. in the room, I know it is on the TV but the screens changed quickly and we did not always have it on. Secondly, we did not have an iron in the room which I thought was standard. Finally, breakfast is overpriced, why not consider a two tier offer? I would have been happy to have coffee and toast at a reasonable price rather than wander around the town to find breakfast elsewhere especially in the winter when the morning are quite dark..

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Smart-Aleck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 3 or 4 days, we had an ordinary room with 2 twin beds and a view of a brick wall. The room was a decent size but could have been a bit bigger, however the bathroom was nice. There was also the standard kettle with free tea and coffee which we made sure to utilise everyday. The entire hotel seemed to be pretty clean, definitely a rarity in Amsterdam. The location was probably the best part about this hotel, it was very close to the Centraal Station and many restraunts, bars, cafes and coffeeshops. Though Amsterdam can be pretty crazy I always felt safe in this hotel even when standing outside for a smoke in the middle of the night. Inntel Rotterdam beats Inntel Amsterdam hands down but this is not a bad hotel, it just doesn't have anything special like a canal view to make it stand out.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Lots of restaurants, bars and shops in the neighbourhood, one step from the hotel. Tram to museums district is across the street. The rail central station 5 is a minutes walk. Room was clean Expensive as other similar category hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikem28
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a city break in Amsterdam. The location is fantastic being within easy walking distance from the station, the central shopping area and all the main attractions. Within less than a minute are tram links to most places if you prefer not to walk. The rooms are spacious and clean with good bathrooms and better than you might expect from a three star hotel. The breakfast is very good (especially with the strong pound at the moment) with a wide choice of hot and cold and excellent fresh breads and pastries. There are plenty of good eating places nearby at a wide variety of prices. For a good steak try Gauchos only a couple of minutes walk. The reception and concierge staff are friendly and have lots of advice and information to help make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes it worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: mat_in_london
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night while on a weekend trp. I booked it because the location is good, and it was close to the action and to friends who were staying at a hostel nearby. Hotel was nice enough and staff helpful. Quick rundown of the room: tv with BBC1 & 2 plus Dutch channels. Shower strength was terrible, water temperature fluctuated but the bed was comfy and there was a fridge. But the location is what sells it. Located close to the shopping heart of the city with plenty of bars and "coffee shops" in the vicinity. I recommend visiting 'Amnesia' and going for the 'real Amnesia' -it's simply mind blowing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elad_Koren
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with acceptable value for money. Location was good, with some interest points around (mostly for shopping).

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend 10-12 February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: My husband and friends surprised me with a trip to Amsterdam for my birthday. The whole trip was amazing. The country and the people were all lovely. I have said I will come back again but I have to stop at this wonderful hotel, from the moment we checked in to the time we left the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. All the receptionists we spoke to were very friendly and helpful and the guy who worked on the information desk just inside the door is fun, be careful going in the revolving door as he may try and trap you inside! The hotel is spotlessly clean, the beds are to die for the most comfortable bed I have slept in in a hotel. The receptionist even noticed from my passport that it was my birthday the following day and on the morning of my birthday knocked at our door with a gift from the hotel which was a lovely touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: mackay843
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel that is only a 5 minute walk from the train station and is surrounded by shops, bars and restaurants. We stayed for 4 nights with breakfast included (make sure you look for this rate as it is well worth it) and it was lovely. Our room was spotless and the bed with its fresh linen was very comfortable. The breakfast is excellent and there is so much to choose from - fill up here and you won't need lunch! Free wi-fi and after check-out the hotel staff will store your luggage until you need to pick it up. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, very good breakfast, rooms need renovation”
Reviews.Author: dleliot
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel was well located, with nice facilities, nice lobby with bar and fireplace. The breakfast room and the quality of the breakfast were almost perfect. The rooms were clean but in need of renovation. It was a good choice but a bit expensive (150euros per room per night I think was too much).

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: batispa
Reviews.Content: Conveniently well-located, this newish hotel differs from most hotels in the same price range for the outstanding location, accessibility (public parking beneath the hotel, with special rates for hotel clients), pet-friendliness, service and cleanliness. The breakfast is very good and thye staff is really friendly. It will become my new address in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Maria Eduarda M
Reviews.Content: Clean, good location, modern. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vonireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally 4 minutes walk from Central Station which means it is perfectly placed to enjoy Amsterdam. The rooms are clean and a good size (well mine was). There is an excellent fitness centre next door for those of that persuasion. I did not eat at the hotel but my colleagues did and I did not hear any complaints. The staff were ALL excellent, front desk, concierge, cleaners were polite and helpful. It wasn't cheap but given the location and service what do you expect in an important city like Amsterdam?

Reviews.Title: “Central location - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBNielsen
Reviews.Content: Inntel hotel is located dowtown Amsterdam near shopping areas and turist attractions. Only 5 minutes walk form the main station. Modern, stylish hotel with clean og cosy rooms. Very good breakfast. Expensive parking - 50 EUROs. Good variety of restaurants and bars just around the corner. Free WiFi at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: meki76
Reviews.Content: No complaints....excellent location, very clean, friendly helpful staff and free wifi which worked well in our room. One suggestion.....becareful with the hot water in the rooms. Ours was extremely hot. Enough to cause serious burns. Maybe was just our room set too high???? #5555

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sarahlew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for business, it's central, clean and comfortable but does lack character and is not very interesting. There is no room service but it is close to bars, restaurants and coffee shops so plenty of places to eat. It has free wifi which is a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGirlMayo
Reviews.Content: Great location, near everything!! Loads of lovely restaurants near the hotel. Great place for shopping to... Staff were so helpful. The bed was so comfy and big... ONLY fault would be the shower, it was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cycling7477
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastically located near to the central station and the Dam. There are 4 tram stops a short walk away. Reception were very helpful as this was our first trip to Amsterdam and gave us some hints and tips. We checked in ahead of 3pm, our room is very comfortable, clean and quiet. The bar area is great , good service, open fire and relax atmosphere. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, Very Good is a fair evaluation”
Reviews.Author: cho10
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights. No where near as expensive as the Marriott or the Hilton. The room was very quiet and confortably warm (winter 2012 has been cold in Holland). I avoided the 15 Euro per person breakfast because I generally find that hotels overcharge for breakfast. Free wifi for internet (very very fast) was a pleasant surprise. Two safes in our room and cleanliness was top rate. If you expect the amenities of a 400 Euro per night room from a 120 Euro per night room you will be disappointed. For its price, its location and the way it is organized I rate the Inntel as a place I would return to gladly. Most sites are within walking distance including the Central Train Station. The tram stop is right outside the main entrance. There are an enormous number of coffee shops, bars, discos and so forth in this area. Whatever your age you'll find something to do in the neighborhood. Bike riding in Amsterdam is the national sport. Be careful the first time you try it though. Mistakes as well as going slow are not easily forgiven by other bike riders or by pedestrians or drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as made out!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra C
Reviews.Content: I visited the inntel hotel in December 2011 for my 21st birthday with my boyfriend and another couple. Although we weren't entirely bothered about how nice the hotel would be, I must say we were ripped off. My boyfriend purposefully upgraded our room to a superior deluxe and found that there was no difference to a double room apart from a larger bed. Im not naive and know not to be fooled by the photographs but they seriously looked like a different bedroom! This was our first city break together and decided to push the boat out a little with a posh room, disappointed to say the least especially since we could hear the lift beeping from our bedroom!! We also thought 30 euros was a bit steep for a less than average breakfast. Overall, not what it seems at all... location was ok i guess

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TenciaG
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for the New Years Eve celebrations. The hotel is in a perfect location as everything is within walking distance. The rooms are clean, free wi fi and the beds are so comfortable. This hotel has a cosmopolitan theme and is good value for money. We will definatly be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and functional.”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiIndiTraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a one night peaceful stay at this hotel. Despite asking for a room close to the elevator I was given a room a little far away. However, it turned out for the better as it was quiet and I slept well. The rooms are small and oddly designed butit has a tea or coffee maker, adequate toileteries and a mini bar. The receptionist was friendly and had concern that guests saved wherever possible and they offered what was most economical and convenient. Unless breakfast is included, I generally suggest taking a walk into the streets where you can order fresh ala carte breakfast at half the prices and tremendous satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: close to the Jordaan, near to train station and shopping streets. My room was big and the bed was huge, comfortable and amazingly quiet. The breakfast was great - much better than I expected but bit expensive. Staff were pleasant and helpful with things like directions, suggestions, printing tickets, etc. The price of eur120 did not include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional but modern hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: christawanner
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in the city center of Amsterdam which is modern. When we did find this hotel I was surprised about the nice looking junior suites. They are modern but also traditional. Of course the room rate was not cheep but the breakfast was included and by the way delicious. I have never been in a hotel before that served broiled breakfast eggs in two different cooking stadiums. Most of the time eggs are hard and cold, but there you will find 7 and 4 minute eggs. All rooms are decorated with nice pictures from different people. The hotel is located in the heart of the city center and close to the Centraal station.

Reviews.Title: “"Clean and Centrally located"”
Reviews.Author: YnaJB
Reviews.Content: We made our booking on line so we just had to trust the photos on the website that the rooms were as nice as they looked. We were not disappointed at all-- our deluxe room had modern interiors and most importantly, it was clean and smelled clean! Everything was also within walking distance! You need not go far to dine for there is a variety of cafes and restaurants just around the hotel. Some of them stay open until the late evening. The central station is just a few blocks across, while the Damrak, which is the pick up point of most tours, is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Some of the staff at the front desk may appear unapproachable but they were actually helpful whenever we needed directions or assistance. it certainly was a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Rude and pompous manager”
Reviews.Author: lubadear
Reviews.Content: Rude, rude and pompous manager at the front desk heading a team that will chew you up like a pack of wolves. Hotel also cheats. Watch your money. General manager not available. **Â½ hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Avalar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel when staying in Amsterdam! Just a few blocks from the square or Centraal Station. Staff is friendly and the rooms were super!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated good hotel”
Reviews.Author: seraphic
Reviews.Content: As others have shared, the Inntelhotel is centrally located and is an easy walk to and from Central Station, St. Nicholas Church, Nieuwe Kerk Church and Dam Square, The Jordaan, 'coffee' shops, and Magna Plaza for shopping. The Anne Frank museum is a ten minute walk. You will need to take a tram if you are not up for walking 40 minutes to the Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum. My only contention with the hotel was the lack of ventilation in the room. We had difficulty regulating the right temperature so we could sleep comfortably. Otherwise the rooms are adequate and comfortable. The beds were firm and the comforters warm and cozy. We paid for a booking deal that included the buffet breakfast. It is a great spread.....with a wonderful coffee machine that makes everything from espresso to lattes, and a full on breakfast with a fresh orange juice press, eggs, sausages, all sorts of breads...the works! If you are not a big breakfast person it's not worth it to pay for the breakfast, and you can go right to the corner for fabulous lattes and pastries. We went to Humphrey's restaurant right next door for a glass of wine, but they wouldn't allow us to sit at the bar! Seems they stipulate you can only eat dinner there. We found that odd, so we went to a nice little bar/restaurant up the street. Nevertheless I hear the food is very good and you can order from their menu in the lounge area of the Inntel hotel.....and share a drink there as well! Also, we stumbled upon a lovely little Indonesian restaurant that had great food..... Sukabumi on on Oude Leliestraat in 04. Unfortunately we had very lousy Indonesian food the next night in a touristy area. Always good to get recommendations! Should I return to Amsterdam I would certainly consider staying at the Inntel hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel but excellent located”
Reviews.Author: Tricks_4_trips
Reviews.Content: It is right in the heart of Amsterdam, yet a few tenths of meters away from the main street. To the main trainstation a mere 10 minutes walk. Perfect for a city break. The rooms are small, but what could you expect in that location, for a decent price ? The heating is kind of noisy.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: TerryHCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last weekend on Nov. 2011 at thsi hotel. we found the hotel to be very comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. There was some noise from the street but this is to be expected in the centre of a busy city. Hotel security was very good. Overall a very pleasant weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Hadi S
Reviews.Content: Close to Centraal, the main Train Station. Everywhere seemed like within the walking distance. Very helpful receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: anneceline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a night on a business trip. The room was very very clean, modern, welcoming, and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless, it's the type of bathroom that makes you want to runa bath and relax. The bed were very comfortable and the overall experience brilliant. the location is unbeatbale as well. Close to the train station, you can walk to all the main parts of amsterdam. Its technically on a main street (easy to catch a taxi) but slightly turned away so that noice levels are kept down. Breakfast was amazing, and all you can expect from a continental breakfast. The staff was friendly, though maybe a bit disorganised. Overall great experience, i would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Asherix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located: 5 minutes from the central station, couple of minutes to the Dam square and right in the middle of a shopping street. Rooms are good and spacious enough. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LisaD87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend at the end of November. Hotel was really easy to find - 5 minute walk from the train station and a tram-stop right outside the front door. As the hotel is so close to the station most trams go past it, making it really easy to get anywhere in Amsterdam. The rooms were a decent size, very clean, quiet and had a mini fridge. The hotel is on a main road, but the small streets to the side have a lot of take aways, and there are also some restaurants but we didn't eat in this part of town. There are some much nicer areas in which to find restaurants and bars. I'd recommend this hotel if you, like me, don't know Amsterdam well as it's so easy to find your way to and from (even after a night out at Leidesplein!!) Dam Square is only 5 minutes away. But if I was going back to Amsterdam again I'd stay somewhere a bit closer to the nightlife as trams finish at 1am. Really enjoyed my stay here, didn't try the breakfast but there were plenty of cafes where we bought a coffee and croissant instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: IsraelTuli
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night but enjoyed it very much.First the location is very central then the staff is very friendly and professional.Rooms are medium size but very very clean as all the hotel.I think the beds are the most comfortable that i ever slept .We ate a nice breakfast with good variety of products(it was included in our room price). Overall it was agood stay and recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lightin80
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night fall of 2011. The location was great. Walking distance to the train station and some of the tourist areas. The staff was very helpful. The room was good with adequate room (we had a king size bed) and very nice bathroom and shower. The hotel offered discount tickets to some of the museums, take advantage and skip the lines. They have a bag check which was very useful to us. we were able to leave our bag and play tourist until it was time to catch our 1800 train. Check with the hotel for the best room rate. We will stay here next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cheapest, but a good quality hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tajandmark
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times over the years. It isn't the cheapest hotel in its class, however I have always experienced a good nights sleep in a clean and tidy room with all the mod cons one expects these days. Staff always seem friendly and effecient, and of course the location is fantastic. Everything you could want is within walking distance, good food, bars, clubs, museums, architecture, canals, red lights etc. No restaurant on site, however hardly a problem being slap bang in the center of Amsterdam. There is a lovely little coffee shop a few doors down (a real coffee shop that sells good quality coffee and freshly baked cakes and pastries, not the other kind of coffeeshop!) Walk out of the hotel, turn left and its the tiny coffee shop on the corner. Having stayed in many different hotels in and around Amsterdam I have no problem recommending the Inntel, formally the Golden Tulip Inntel.

Reviews.Title: “great for a business stopover”
Reviews.Author: RoytonBrowns
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times on business now, and it seems to me that is what the hotel is geared towards. And it does it very well...free wi-fi, comfortable rooms with desk. Good beds, bathroom, etc. Just what you need for a night away whilst working. Location is good - 5-10 minutes walk from Centraal Station (depending on your walking pace and luck with the bike lanes). About 5 minutes from Dam Square. It's not on the main road, instead nestling in a small square of it's own next to Humphrey's Restaurant and the trashy sounding BBQ Bar and Diner. So it makes for a quiet night's sleep. Breakfast is traditional buffet style in a bright and airy restaurant area. It's fairly standard fare, but I normally get enough on my plate to see me through. The hotel displays huge photos of people. This is intended to show the variety, shape and size of people coming to, or living in Amsterdam, and how the hotel accommodates all manner of people. However, they are not to scale and this can be quite disconcerting, despite the fact they are invariably happy and pleasant! I don't like getting into full lifts at the best of times, but when the lift doors open and you see ten foot giants smiling back at you from the back wall, it takes a moment for the brain to register what it's seen. All in all, a good business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: bdahye
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare of an experience with the Amsterdam train services, a nice hotel was what we needed. It is nice, great service and within walking distance to centraal, restaurants and shopping. Free high speed WiFi was a blessing. Only complaint would be the room service. We couldn't find a menu, had one brought up from reception and it contained no prices or beverage listing.

Reviews.Title: “Central City”
Reviews.Author: GeriNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the last minute after our room at Phil Dutch Houseboat was double booked. It was clean, comfortable and friendly. Check-in was easy despite the hoards of tourists in the lobby and the room was what we were expecting. Perfect location for the red light district, train station and main shopping streets.

Reviews.Title: “OK Bit very expensive !”
Reviews.Author: faceys
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to Amsterdam for a weekend break, This Hotel was Good, Cleen,Great location,Â£150GB room only rate so it should be ! We new it was going to be expensive with the rate exchange being 1.15euro to Â£1 But at 6euro a pint and 3.5euro a half IT was rather more than expected, an average Steak meal with wine any where in Amsterdam will cost you 45 euro p/person, the quality at its best is average and you always have to ask for your drink to be topped up or accept a1/3 of it as Froth. a Regular Coffee ( they call it large ) is 3.50euro ! Taxis are about twice the price they are in UK, BUT the Trams and Trains are Very Cheap. I dont think I would go to Amsterdam again and I have visited a lot of EU Cities that I would rather go back too. every where is expensive at the current exchange rate But this is just over the top !

Reviews.Title: “High Level Hotel, in the city central”
Reviews.Author: Ofer777
Reviews.Content: The hotel place in excellent place, 500 meters from Amsterdam Centraalâ€Ž main train station. You can walk and discover the city from it without transportation needs. (the tram station near the hotel, if need) In the Hotel, the room is very spacious, big bed, working area space, clean and fresh toilet and bath. Strong recommendation !!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: yazzmundo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, within five minutes walking to all the main sites in Amsterdam. Hotel was great for a two night stay, any longer then I would recommend staying some where a bit more plush. Staff were great, happy and ready to assist. Rooms were clean and adequate. Great fire place in the lobby, perfect for warming up after a cold day out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but clean, with helpful staff and plenty of comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Andy R
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of expedia package and not disappointed. Located really well for all 'typical' sights of Amsterdam. Eat next door at Humphey's for good food at great value. Breakfast on the corner at coffee connection for a real slice of Dutch hospitality. Also, ask for a double bed at check in and like us, you might get upgraded to an executive room! 4/5. It's not a palace, but it's a pretty good substitute if you're on a midrange budget.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: katemaria
Reviews.Content: when arriving at the hotel. we were a bit disapointed ,but when we entered the hotel it was lovely. the rooms are nice but smaill, but what really put a damper on the day was arriving at 9am after travelling all nite and to hear our rooms would not be available untill 3pm. so we had to put time in to pass the morning and afternoon. we took a chance going back at 1.30pm and was told our rooms were ready. the staff were nice but the porter was a bit abrupt with us. dont know y. but he just didnt seem to want to help us,it was take it or leave it. so we just put it down to a bad day . over all the hotel was nice, but have stayed in nicer , just a note for anyone travelling to amsterdam. make sure you book a 4* hotel and up as under that the hotels are not nice at all. plus 3*s ask for more money. out hotel was a 4* and was just right.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sunist
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 1 night. It has a perfect location which is located just next to the main shopping area and its only 10 minutes walking away from Amsterdam Centraal train station.The staff was really helpful and they have a luggage room which you can put your luggage after you checked out from the hotel and get any time you want during the day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cheggs46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for a break with our 2 teenage children, found the hotel easily from central station, smooth check in with helpful staff, we had 2 twin rooms interconnecting which was good. The bedroom and bathroom were spotless, rooms were really quiet didn't hear any noise from guests or outside except for the church bells which was really nice.The bar area is great with free wifi which the kids apreciated, also the drinks were reasonable for a hotel in fact some drinks were cheaper that in the bars outside. We opted not to have breakfast in the hotel as they are often disappointing instead we did some research on cafe's in the area and found a great one just 5 mins walk away called "Greenwoods" great food and staff, cooked breakfast for 4 people with drinks 32 euros we went there both mornings.This was our third visit to Amsterdam but first for our children so naturally we visited "Anne Frank House" there is always a queue to get in but don't be put off as it moves really quickly. If you are going to Hard Rock Cafe try to book in advance as we had to wait almost 2 hours for a table(children's choice) Ate at a great indonesian the other night recomended by the hotel.Great weekend away, great hotel would definitely stay again. Oh just one more thing, we booked through hotels.com and saved over Â£200.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: di2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in August 2011, our stay was very comfortable. The room was very clean and could not fault the hotel in any way. We needed to print our boarding pass, for which we used the computer available to guests and were able to print them no charge. The room has a mini fridge and a coffee machine, which comes in nicely if you just want a cup of coffee without having to go out. We arrive by train and it was very easy to walk to the hotel. There is plenty of restaurants in the area and felt very safe at all time. We would not hesitate to return to this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, hard bed”
Reviews.Author: redrobyn01
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. However the hotel has a policy to not change the sheets and towels every day supposedly for ecological reasons but I enjoy sleeping on fresh sheets so this disappoints me. And while on the beds... They are quiet hard. Otherwise although the rooms are small they do have a mini bar and a bath and are clean and pleasant.BUT IF YOU BOOK THROUGH EXPEDIA YOU WON'T GET TO CHOOSE TO INCLUDE BREAKFAST!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you all the stuff of Inntel hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mercier25
Reviews.Content: Hi! I would to like to comment for this hotel. I was never disappointed during my stay. Especially all the lobey stuffs were so helpful and friendly. I think this human touch is very important. Their attitude made me feel to come back to Inntel again. I prefer this kind of simple style hotel. But all the amenity were really studied. I broke my nail in the plane and it was bothering me. However In the bathroom, there was an box of cotten puf, cotten tige, and a nail polish! There was even a bath salt! I really appreciated it! I have one more thing I want to recommendvthis hotel. It is a location! It is easy to find. Walking distance to almost everywhere I visited. Like Anne Frank house, flower market, national musee,etc...highly recommended for those looking for a hotel for affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Good value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: O'Polo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to explore the best of Amsterdam. Nice breakfastroom with a wide range of stuff you can pick from. Room was comfy, practical and has all mod cons. Verr friendly and helpfull staff. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Getting ripped off by internet booking”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDiana516
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for this hotel though an online booking system. When I need to cancel the booking, I found that they intended to charge me for a full night's stay because the internet booking had offered a 5% discount. I offered to pay a penalty and my cancellation was made a full 48 hours before my reservation. They also refused to offer me credit for another stay. This is completely unethical and unreasonable so I strongly advice people to not book via the internet and to ensure that they can cancel if necessary. Worst of all, this seems to not only be hotel policy, but that of Tourism Amsterdam. RIP OFF!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BallparkBob
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was clean and it was very convenient to the shopping and red light district of Amsterdam. Despite being just an alley-way from the ruckus of the party area, I never heard noise outside the room. Internet in the room worked flawlessly and was free and that is a huge selling point for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fine as Everytime”
Reviews.Author: StoaGroningen
Reviews.Content: Have been here many times and the hotel has always been truly wonderful. Good, clean and efficient rooms (excellent desk with good lighting, fine and comfortable beds, quietness, nice and clean bathroom), good all-roundbreakfast, great central location within easy walking distance of the trains station; there's a tram stop just opposite and trams will whisk you quickly to any destination in the city. Reception is friendly and quick and informative. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and worth for Stay”
Reviews.Author: draveller
Reviews.Content: This cozy hotel, with in the good location meaning - reachable by a 2minutes walk from the Damsquare(Damstrat). Housekeeping is really good. There is breakfast here, good. There is enough and more food joints of all types in a 1minute walking distance. there is tram and bus stops very near. excellent for family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Funky Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We chose to spend a couple of days in Amsterdam to break up the long journey from Adelaide to the UK and enjoyed two comfortable nights at the Inntel. We arrived much earlier than check-in time and were relieved when they said our room was ready. (Some hotels are not so helpful. when it comes to early arrivals.) The hotel decor is creative and inviting and the staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. Another bonus is that the location is so central that many sights and attractions are within walking distance or a short tram ride away - fabulous shopping areas are close by as well. Despite mixed reviews on TripAdvisor, I am glad we chose this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Imaglobaltrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend, the hotel is in a great area, central to everything. Breakfast in the nearby places is great and cheap. The hotel is clean, chic, updated and generally well kept. Enjoyed my stay here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mimimoura
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find and so close to everything I wanted to see. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor and location. I stayed here with my husband and another couple. The staff were very friendly. Check in was a breeze and we were given information about the area. I like how there were apples to take at the reception desk. great snack on the go. Our rooms were on the 3nd floor right next to other couple's room. This was great for planning our next adventure of the day. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights and the other couple stayed for 3. I'm going to share the other couple's review of the hotel since i have it written in my travel journal: "The hotel looked pretty fancy from the outside and I was surprised to find the inside fancy as well. The front desk people were nice and friendly. I liked the fact that there were 2 computers in the lobby that you can use for free for 30 minutes. to get to our room, we had to go to the 2nd floor and then walk to the other attachment of the building then go to the 3rd floor. our room was really nice. 2 beds were pushed together. the washrooms were nicer than i expected. I liked the fact there was a safe. a minibar was also available and a few snacks." I was impressed with the size of the room. The bed was extremely comfortable. There was a huge closet for clothes and a nice sitting area. There was plenty of room for luggage. I loved the bath tub. I took a lovely bubble bath one of the evenings. It was so relaxing. The bathroom was a good size. I like the travel size samples that the hotel provides. The snacks included in the minibar were Stroopwafels. The brand they had was Daelmans Mini Stroopwafels. I ended up buying them at a shop nearby with the intention to bring it back as a souvenir but I ended up eating them. They are delicious!! too bad they dont sell them in Canada, so I suggest you get your fill of them while in Amsterdam. A lot of people complain about the images of the people in their rooms and scattered around the hotel, but I had a lot of fun with them. We would try to guess what the situation was and what these people would say or think. We didn't try the breakfast because of the price, I highly suggest you have your breakfast at the Pannenkoekenhuis Upstairs. OMG I will never look at pancakes the same way ever. It was the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. I crave these pancakes and wish I could get something like this in Toronto. Upon checkout, we had to pay additional taxes. We paid in cash and were given a receipt. I would definitely stay here again. I miss Amsterdam. While I was standing outside waiting for the rain to stop, a gentleman came out of the hotel telling me how happy he was that he was able to get a room at such a good rate. He said usually this place charges an arm and a leg. I paid CAD$147.43

Reviews.Title: “"You'll be surprised" (not in a good way!!!!!)”
Reviews.Author: KGBF
Reviews.Content: Having told my sister of the delights of Amsterdam we decided to book a short break with our respective partners and came across the Inntel Hotel. With the location being central and the hotel pictures looking relatively nice we decided to book this hotel. This is where the pleasantries end - never in my life have I experienced such inept customer service which to be honest borders on downright disgraceful! I reserved the room with my card details and as I understood the room had been paid for in advance. This was also confirmed to me on checkout by the hotel staff when again they had my card details and told me that the rooms had been paid for. So you can imagine that it came as quite a surprise when the hotel thought it was acceptable to take Â£526 out of my SISTER'S BOYFRIEND'S account 6 weeks after we had returned home (bearing in mind they only took his card details to cover sundries used in the hotel room. Now I've been to a few hotels in my time and the last time I checked peanuts were not that expensive!) I contacted the hotel immediately to query this as having thought the room had been paid for and not been told otherwise by the hotel staff, I assumed it must have been a mistake. I was then given a half hearted excuse with the standard "accounting error" being the cause. I then asked why they had taken it from my sister's boyfriends account as he had not made the reservation and they told me they were the only card details they could find. I then asked them to refund his card and they told me that I could set up a payment plan to just pay him seeing as he was my sister's boyfriend. Bearing in mind this had taken his account overdrawn and he needed the money asap. As it was their mistake I suggested that they come up with a more suitable compromise as obviously Â£526 is a lot of money to have at your fingertips when you think it has already been paid. They told me they would refund my sister's boyfriend and then charge my card for half of the amount which I felt was fair and more affordable given the big mistake they had made. I agreed to this and passed on my card details again. However I have since found out that they have only refunded my sister's boyfriend for half the amount and still charged me for half. When I got in touch again with the hotel they decided it was in the interest of good customer service to just totally ignore my emails. Needless to stay the overall experience of this hotel has soured what was an enjoyable stay. The final kick in the teeth was that the "surprise" at the hotel was a naff pair of flip flops. The last time I checked Amsterdam isn't exactly spoilt for choice when it comes to beaches and the hotel doesn't even have a pool! RUBBISH SURPRISE, RUBBISH CUSTOMER SERVICE, JUST RUBBISH!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Crepes2
Reviews.Content: 5 mins from train station. Very near entertainment area.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Stay”
Reviews.Author: cray11
Reviews.Content: Inntel Hotel is in the perfect location, short walk from centrall station. It is close walking distance to all the sites, red light district, shopping, flower market, muesuems, Anne Frank House. Hotel is very clean, rooms are larger than normal and comfortable. Staff very pleasant, two computers for guest use. Surprisingly quiet area with all the nearby, restaurants, bars and coffee shops, cafes. Grocery store down the street. overall good recomendation to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Dean M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on August 31, 2011, for one night. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in downtown Amsterdam and minutes away from the main train station and other public transportation. I walked a lot around downtown Amsterdam and was never very far away from this hotel. I decided to stay at this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, and I wasn't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel at the Center”
Reviews.Author: wdalati
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night during my trip in July and i would say it was not a bad choice at all. i picked this hotel randomly and its name sounded quite attractive. I read some reviews on Trip Advisor and it sounded okay to try although i am a chain follower. The hotel front desk were quite helpful as there was a mistake in the booking from my side and after fixing it they handed me over a key for a nicely located room. The Breakfast was good and the variety are quite alot. thumbs up. The hotel is located in the center of activities in Amsterdam, shopping street is just 1 minute walking, the Amsterdam attraction streets are few minutes away and that what makes this hotel quite convenient. I would stay over here again and again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: sakshichoudhary
Reviews.Content: Inntel Hotel is a comfortable hotel in terms of location. It is walking distance from all the major attractions such as the coffee shops, red light district and the main shopping area. The rooms are very comfortable for the price they offer with modern furniture. They are a variety of eating joints right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anastasia_033
Reviews.Content: it is a lovely hotel,modern,clean and the most important of all..the ideal location!only 5 minutes walk from central station,dam square,red light district.around the hotel there are plenty of shops,where u can eat or buy anything u wish!we definetely recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a busy place”
Reviews.Author: pjfarkel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 17 days in Europe with my 16 yr old grandson (I'm the grandma). London, Liverpool, Amsterdam & Pairs. Our hotel in Amsterdam ended up 4th in our overall hotel rating. It was the most expensive, with the least to offer. The room was small, but ended up being manageable. Our "view" was of the air conditioning units (and I was promised a room with a view) and being left-handed caused me pain! The doorknob is such that when shut with the left hand (I finally learned after bruising my hand and almost destroying my wedding ring) it catches your hand between the knob and a very heavy steel door jam. OUCH! I did approach the front desk with email in hand that promised me a larger room and view, but they were not friendly or accommodating. I was told in very plain English, that that is ALL that was available. Their way of handling it left a sour taste in my mouth. I am trying to be objective with my review, but really glad we were only staying two nights. The beds were extremely comfortable and that is a top priority of mine. The bathroom was nicely appointed too. The lobby and bar are beautifully decorated, though my grandson thought the "portraits" in the hallways and elevators a little odd. It is a modern, contemporary property and I thought it was very nice. The FREE Wi Fi worked very well. We did not partake of the restaurant or breakfast. There are far too many places to eat within steps of the hotel. Amsterdam is expensive-so be prepared. Would I stay here again-probably not. I would like a quieter location on a canal away from the seediness of the area. It is a short walk to the red-light district and Dam Square. It is conveniently located for getting around. Took us 5 minutes with luggage to walk to/from the Amsterdam Centraal train station. This hotel is in the middle of the "coffee shops" and if one wanders just down the little street it is located on, one might just get a "contact high" from the smoke in the air! My grandson got an eye-full and a good lesson from it all. We did the hop on-off bus so he could see the better parts of the city. The highlight of Amsterdam was our visit to the Anne Frank Huis. Make sure you book in advance as we did. The line was a mile long, but we rang a bell, and walked right in-a place not to be missed. In closing let me say that if I was a young adult, without children, who liked to party, this would be a great location to base my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ali M
Reviews.Content: It's about a 5-10 minutes walk from the train station (which can be adventurous with rolling luggage, pedestrians, bike riders, mopeds & cars), which is perfect and it's a great in terms of Dam Square a lot of other great tourist attractions. There is a good selection of restaurants (from cheap to expensive) close by and the hotel staff was very helpful (one of us needed to see a doctor while there and they made all the arrangements for us). The breakfast was wonderful and the breakfast room was large and comfortable. Our room had no view of any kind, but who stares outside their hotel all day and night anyway; we were busy exploring. Also, I felt very secure here as at least you needed a room key to use the elevator. The room was smal, but clean & updated. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “good value in central location”
Reviews.Author: Divos
Reviews.Content: compared to its peers, this was good value. 5 min walk to the station

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AlmaShark
Reviews.Content: Positives: The location was perfect, only a 2 minute walk to get to the centre/ top of the red light district and a 5 minute walk to get to Dam Square. The hotel staff spoke good English and were helpful, the service was also prompt. Room looked recently decorated/furnished, had a comfortable bed with some English channels on TV. Negatives: I was surprised at the size of the room when we arrived, it was smaller than expected and only just enough room for a medium size person to move around the bed. Despite putting a do not disturb sign outside the maids knocked on our door every day and one morning even came in! The facilities in the room were quite basic - hairdryer didn't really work, only tea or coffee with powdered milk. Overall we enjoyed our stay, I would say this hotel is very overpriced for what it is (we paid Â£125 a night) but I think this will be the case across all of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel, will definitely come here again!”
Reviews.Author: Shyatto
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous, literally a 3 minute walk from the Central Station. The tramline stop is right there and the yellow bike rental is 3 doors away. The hotel accommodation is great, we were met extremely warmly by the reception staff and then upgraded to a business room! Given that most hotels in Amsterdam are small due to space constraints, this hotel has done a fabulous job to design the rooms in such a way that it is extremely spacious. It has all the bells and whistles of a 4.5 star hotel. Free Wi-Fi and it is fairly fast. My wife and hired bicycles on day 1, and toured the city all day - probably the best way to see Amsterdam. Do get lost as you get to see the lovely treasures Amsterdam has to offer. Day 2 we walked through the city and visited all the tourist hotspots - Dam Square, Waterloopien, New Market, Skinny Bridge & a couple of museums. Day 3 - took the train to Delft and Den Haag. Delft is a lovely quaint town with two stunning churches - the New Church & the Old Church (easy names!!). We will definitely stay at the Inntel Amsterdam as and when we are back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_McM
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay and I will certainly be back. The hotel is conveniently walking distance from the main rail station on the edge of the red light district. Although not my favourite part of Amsterdam, the hotel itself is quite different to the tacky outlets nearby. Guests receive a warm and efficient welcome, my room has been spotless and very comfortable on both occasions and wifi is included in the price. Breakfast is good and service in the breakfast room and bar are unobtrusive. Overall very good value and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Bake69
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel location ever. My bad experience was the cab driver dropped me off to far away. I told him, no, I'm not getting out until I can see the hotel. Then we see police officers come by and they assure the hotel is through that lane way. Then I trusted the taxi driver. Wrong again, I had 4 bags and finally after 45 mins found the hotel. Once inside it was nice. Staff speaks English very well. Expensive but that's Amsterdam. I would stay there again. Breakfast is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: ANDYuk07
Reviews.Content: Clean and friendly hotel in a very good location close enough to Dam square and the station.lovely bar area,stayed for four nights and Amsterdam was great.

Reviews.Title: “Double Take”
Reviews.Author: Elton_Bear
Reviews.Content: Only when walking up to the hotel did I realise I had stayed there before. Only then it was a Golden Tulip Hotel. Shows that my internet browsing selections are consistent! Being just a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station, with plenty of trains from the airport, and also Dam Square and its nearby day and night attractions, this is a very good location. It is also right by the tram (streetcar) route to the Museum quarter and the RAI exhibition halls. Also the Jordaan district is not that far to walk. Even though we arrived in mid morning, a room was ready and check in was very efficient and helpful with city map and advice. The room was typically small as with most city hotels, but perfectly adequate, clean and well appointed. No view but very quiet as it was interior facing . We accidentally locked ourselves out of the safe and had to call reception. What seemed to be a manager turned up within 3 minutes and sorted it out. Really good service as we have all experienced long waits when asking for such help. Breakfast at â‚¬15 is a touch expensive, but close by there are a number of small cafes that provide a good start to the day for half that, though probably not as comprehensive. There is Internet access in the bar area. No hesitation in recommending this hotel. Would use it again for any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Run of the Mill”
Reviews.Author: wOoDpEkEr
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, 7 minutes walk from Centraal, or 1 minute from tram stop. Walk back alittle from tram stop to reach the hotel. Arriving late at night, the reception was manned singularly, and thus took about 15 minutes in queue to check in on a Friday night. Area surrounding was vibrant with clubs and cafes opened, but sound doesn't permeate into the rooms. Room booked was a Superior Double, clean linens and towels, toilets is tiny with bath and shower combined. Water pressure average. Very comprehensive amenities but no toothbrush, so b-y-o. Minibar(paying), wifi free, tv with huge amount of channels as well as coffee/tea maker available. Room soundproofing is relatively standard, and corridor noise doesn't flow in readily. Airconditioning fully adjustable and strong. Close enough to Dam Sqaure and Damrak both 3-5 minutes walk. Near enough to the largest shopping mall in town, just down the road for 5 minutes. Lots of breakfast shops opened in the morning, so if breakfast is not included in rate, there's plenty of choices around. Staff are courteous and professional, nothing out of the ordinary though. Bar looks interesting with an open fireplace in the middle of the room, didn't try it though. The rate can fluctuate from day to day, for eg. Superior room booked cost Eur 140, the next day it costs Eur 130, so check back regularly. Slogan of hotel is "Be Surprised", but didn't provide any.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: orangeblossomspecial
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location for walking to pretty much everything we wanted to see. The rooms were simple and clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. The price seemed a little high but looking at most other hotels was comparable to others around. I would consider staying there again if we make it back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Hits the Spot”
Reviews.Author: Mark-choosy-chappy
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel a few times over the last few years. I do not tend to use any of the facilities but as a comfortable place to stay, at the sub 150 euros per night level, it is hard to beat. In my opinion Amsterdam has become quite expensive for accommodation. The pros are numerous: 1 - just over 5 minutes walking to the central train station 2 - always a quick check in 3 - no long waits for the elevator 4 - rooms are spacious 5 - good choice of English station on tv 6 - lighting level is just right 7 - bed is very comfortable with plenty of spotless linen and quality pillows 8 - kettle with basic coffee making etc 9 - well lit bathrooom with powerful shower - hot water too! 10 - very quiet 11 - very central and close to Dam Square One minor drawback is the downstairs lobby - it is very dark during the day. All in all this place really hits the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellentt”
Reviews.Author: aw189
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time staying at this hotel. The hotel used to be "Golden Tulip", they still kept the same quality if not better. The location is in the center of Amsterdam where everywhere is within walking distance. If you need a bike or bicycle, you can rent one at a shop right next to the hotel. The breakfast is simple yet delicious. Rooms are a bit small (for some people) yet well designed. The staff members are always welcoming, smiling, and helpful. It is the first hotel I look up when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel with Young and Contemporary Feel - Close to Centraal Station and Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: snayyar
Reviews.Content: The Inntel is reasonably priced and conveniently located. 5 minute walk to Centraal Station, RLD or Dam Square. The check-in was flawless and the hotel seemed to cater to couples and young people (20's-40's). Our room was a tight fit, and very awkwardly shaped with a window into a courtyard = no view. The Bathroom was tiny and difficult to maneuver around the shower and counter. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. Housekeeping was as expected - but there isn't really much to clean in a 250 square foot room. The location is really what should bring you to this hotel. Located on a busy street, you can throw a stone and hit two coffeeshops, a breakfast place and 5 pubs. The rooms seemed to mostly face inwards, so there wasn't a real issue with street noise at night. The staff was really knowledgeable and willing to help with activities and dining options. The concierge adeptly confirmed all my dining reservations upon request and made sure I was called when each was confirmed. Very nice! The hotel would get 4 stars from me if the rooms were a little bigger and the bathrooms were updated. The common areas (lobby, elevator) were clean, and updated in most cases with cool Dutch Design. For example, the carpeting in the hallways resembles a city street, with manhole covers and all! Definitely a good choice for a "reasonably" priced stay in the 'Dam for young folks or a couple! TIP: Walk from Centraal Station unless you have heavy bags. It's a 5 minute walk or a 7-10 Euro Taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Amsterdam centre, but not quite our style”
Reviews.Author: steviecee
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room at Inntel Hotel because it was right in the city centre and the price was a real bargain. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Central railway station, and we found it easily. The Reception staff are professional, welcoming and knowledgeable, and within 5 minutes we were in our room. The room was fine, a bit of a squeeze for 2 of us, but it was well designed and the bed was both huge and comfortable. There were no bathrobes or slippers, but these were available on request. However, we were disappointed with the quality and quantity of the bathroom soaps and gels (again, we asked for more and got more), and the towels were thin, miserable affairs which, once wet, were impossible to dry and re-use (not very 'green'). We also found the hotel to be quite noisy, as we looked onto other rooms and the inner courtyard (but the room was cheap for a 4* hotel). The shower was difficult to get right, sometimes too hot and sometimes too cold, but by persevering I got the water just right for most of the time. We opted for breakfast locally, which I think was better value than the 15 Euros the hotel was asking. It was very busy over the 4 day period we stayed there, but the receptionists never lost their cool and were charming - except for the last morning, when we left at 0600hrs to catch our flight. I had settled the bill the night before, but the nightwatchman on duty at Reception insisted he double checked to make sure, which we found annoying and irritating. Wi-fi was included in the room cost and worked perfectly. Perhaps it was the hotel's location rather too close to the coffee shops and sleazy shopping area, or perhaps the noise and bustle in the hotel that puts us off staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Dirty old hotel with tiny rooms and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: IODC
Reviews.Content: Looking for bed bugs? Inntel Hotel in Amsterdam is awaiting. This place is terrible. I can't believe those who wrote 5-star reviews... Do these folks work for the hotel? The place is old and dirty. There are two buildings inside. The majority of the rooms are in the second building with NO city view. Most likely, you'll end up in the second building with the view of trash cans. The rooms stink. There are stains on the bedding. I don't think they change it after every single guest. Maybe, once in a month. I was disgusted even thinking about touching anything in this hotel. Rooms in Europe are small. But rooms in this hotel are TINY. Rolling the luggage into the room was almost impossible. Rolling it between the beds and the tiny desk next to them was ... a challenge. They advertise free WiFi. Yes, it's free because IT DOESN'T EXIST. My MacBook Pro (2 months old) was getting a 1-bar signal and reading my emails was simply impossible. I had a MiFi box from XComGlobal, and that was a lifesaver (however, this is a different story). Did I mention no other Internet connection option from the hotel? The hotel charges 15 Euro for breakfast per person. We had two kids with us. The price was the same for everyone, even for the kids. The breakfast is ... if you like McDonalds it might be OK. Otherwise, stay away. No pastries, no salads. 1 choice of yogurt. No decaf coffee. We just came from London, and the breakfast was more expensive there, but it was WORTH IT. I enjoy paying for good products and service, but I hate wasting money. The staff is RUDE. Yes, R-U-D-E. We visited France, Belgium, Italy, France, Spain, and Germany a number of times and know the difference between Europe and the US. The service you get at this hotel is terrible. Terrible according even to the European standards. TripAdvisor was the reason why we decided to stay at this hotel, so I feel quite strongly about leaving a review. This place is a dump! We will never come back to this hotel again. NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Lilykkkk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent! Good location, very central, excellent service, great staff, good breakfast buffet, everything is good value, clean, convenient, felt at home! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good ooms”
Reviews.Author: puh4o
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in february for 2 NTS. the HTL is very centrally located but at the same time in a quiet place. Walking is about 10 min to Dam square. Rooms are good,nice large bed, very modern and clean. I stayed in a superior room first night and moved to business room 2nd night. the is not a big difference between them and the extra charge is definately not worth it, especially if you are leisure traveller. I had room only rate and didnt use the restaurant and cannot comment on it. I did use the bar - the fireplace is lovely and i highly recomend it for a drink or 2. in general everybody at the reception and the bar were quite pleasant polite and it was nice experience. will recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dk108
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we ever stayed in. Great location, nice interior, free wi-fi, coffee & tea facilities in the room. Breakfast is good but a little bit expensive, so may be it's better to go outside and visit one of the cafes which provide breakfast for just 5-8 euro. Anyway, the price of the room was very reasonable for real 4 stars. Strongly recommended!
