Reviews.Title: “Be careful with Inntel Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kakifry
Reviews.Content: I have noticed there is a pending charge of 120 Euros on my credit card today. I paid for our room well in advance and checked-out with the receipt clearly staing I have nothing further to pay.(except city tax) However, instinct warned me to keep my receipt, which I have duly done. I have just read another customer's review how he was charged an extra 120 Euros for an upgrade to an executive room (60 per night) and I am furious that this may be why my credit card now has the same amount pending! When we arrived, the 'trainee' receptionist said "we are giving you an upgrade" and I take that to mean free. There was no mention of a charge or so. She did however take my credit card and did some stuff for a few minutes. She didn't tell me what she was doing though. So, I have already called my bank to dispute the charge once the Euros 120 is taken from my card and will be calling the hotel in the morning!! Shocking practice - basically telling you and making you feel the upgrade is complimentary - then trying to charge you when you least expect it. Luckily I checked my internet banking today and luckily I did keep that hotel receipt when i checked. Very sneaky!! Why didn't they inform me of the extra charge or have it showing n the bill at check out!?! Dodgy. In addition, I never felt it was a warm welcome for a 4 star hotel, the rooms were indeed noisy with doors slamming and bangs and thuds all day and night as a few other posters have mentioned and apart from the bed and location, i wouldn't recommend this hotel at all. Like someone else said, I got the impression they were a bit snidy and cold. Oh, and of the hotels I have stayed in Europe the past few years, this was ther only one to charge me city tax too!! Shocking! I wasn't going to write on here; couldn't be bothered, despite my complaints, but seeing the charge prompted me to warn others. I note from calling my bank that the pending charge was made on he day we checked in, so this tells me she had charged my credit card there and then. So why isn't it on my check out bill. SNEAKY!!! I now think the staff have been told to do this to maximise profits and keep there jobs or something. Cynical yes, but I wouldn't put it past them seeing as I wasn't told they were charging me for the upgrade that they offered and implied was complimentary. Again, shocking!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mjh555fire
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam 7 times now staying in various hotels so I know what to expect, we opted for the extra day after the weekend to get a better deal so we flew home Monday. My first thoughts it's an excellent location very near to the Grasshopper so quick walk from the station. Reception is very good didn't have to wait long to get booked in with a nice little bar you can see if you want a drink. We stayed on level 5 a twin room for 2 single beds fast lifts so takes seconds. First impressions very clean and the beds are brilliant with flat screen TV really comfy we slept so well it's a cosy modern look. Bathroom again very clean good size but watch out the water it's so hot!! The rooms bad points are the mini bar don't bother â‚¬4.50 for water plenty of shops near so get some supplies take the stuff out of the fridge and put your new cheaper goods back in like beer!!. A few reviews have said about noise we had the same it's near a main rd so you can here people walking by and the usual hustle from a city like Amsterdam, take some ear plugs it didn't bother us it wasn't bad at all. Amsterdam is getting more expensive each year now â‚¬5 per large beer cheapest was â‚¬3.50 but the food was excellent a very nice curry house just round the corner so take plenty of money average meals about â‚¬30 each. I would stay here again next year as it's a good location not far from Dam Square or Central Station. You can walk to Leidseplein, Rembrandtplein good bars different shops take some good trainers we always walk miles. We checked out at 11.30am and the room was cleaned each day with fresh bedding all to a high standard enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with polite efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: janpet47
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights mid July and found the room opening onto dining area courtyard and of typical size with all conveniences working and bathroom clean. Location is terriffic 2/3 between the Central Train station and Dam Square and only a few metres from the tram. Surrounded by cafes and restaurants with great range of dining options at average prices. Shopping streets surround the hotel with access to everything very convenient. Hotel staff, Martijn in particular, were quite helpful with hints for touring and travelling around the City. Did not dine at restaurant as 15Euros each was much more than we would find of value so ate breakfast around corner for 15Euros for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelNJ63
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the front desk staff. Noisy, dirty, ac broke down and although we reported it TWICE it was never fixed. Horrible horrible hotel. One elevator was broken most of the time we were there. If you have problems going up and down stairs NOT the hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location. well presented hotel. highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lydia1975
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 5 mins walk from train station and round the corner from shops which lead to dam square! It is clean and well maintained with polite professional staff. Has a luggage room which can be used if too early to check in or if you have a late flight. we liked this so much are going back this november! We bought madame tussaud tickets in advance online and it was worth it to walk past the queue! The candlelight canal cruise was good especially if you.re the only one at your table drinking wine!! They take you through the red light district which most r curious about. The Heineken tour is well worth a visit also as it is surprisingly entertaining and is both informitive and interactive.The diamond visit is free but is a selling exercise with only a quick 5 mins in a room with two women behind a screen polishing diamonds then herded into a room to look at rings that they want to sell you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pasopvirpot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during our Europe travel. We stayed in a standard double room on the third floor, with our window facing the glass-enclosed breakfast area. Overall we were very happy with our stay. There are more expensive hotels but we donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth it if you are not planning to spend many hours in your room anyway. The rooms have everything you need, furniture in good condition and a very nice bed. The room was very quiet; we were never bothered by any noise. We found the location very good - within walking distance from Central Station, the red light district and a tram stop about 50m from the hotel entrance which was very convenient. Right outside you find decent restaurants, take away food and coffee shops. We enjoyed the Wok to Wok and Burger Bar within one block. We didnâ€™t have hotel breakfast so canâ€™t comment on this. The front desk staff were friendly in assisting us to get the required adaptor for our laptop and to assist us to get the free wireless internet working. You can also borrow an umbrella for free at the front desk. Check-in and check-out was quick and efficient. We were early for check-in and were able to store our luggage in a room at the reception area. The only negative was a lack of hot water on our last morning which was a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “All things considered nice spot”
Reviews.Author: LeonXave
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very nice outside...everyone walking by wants to know what it is.. The room was nice, small but nice. I guess being that I am not used to $200 a night getting me a small room it was a lil bit of sticker shock but as I understand it things are smaller in Europe sooo it was nice. Very clean, pleasant staff. The night porter was a little rude. He thought I was just crashing in the lounge but the Wifi was GARBAGE in my room signal was only working in the lobby on the first floor. So I hung out there to talk to friends at night which was day time in the states. Great location, train station is a 6min walk, everything you could want is with in 5mins walking. Breakfast was an additional 15euro but I am not sure they present that there is a cost to it....it was ok nothing special nothing great not sure its worth 15euro

Reviews.Title: “ok, if you like super touristy area.”
Reviews.Author: xstaceynyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a friend's wedding. The positives: close to the train station, excellent buffet breakfast. The staff were not super helpful. Asking directions (um, a left, a right, down an alley and I don't remember the name but you can buy magazines there). Not so great. The night of the wedding it was pouring and we asked for a cab. They said it was a 5 minute walk and didn't want to call one. I love to walk, but not wearing a silk dress and heels in the rain. They did the same thing to the mother of the bride. Beds weren't super comfortable (2 flat twin mattresses pushed together, maybe this is a European thing?). There are weird stock art black and white photos above the bed that made me feel like I was in a corporate brochure for a 401k plan. I think they were going for modern but it was a little creepy. It was loud at night, I think our room faced an alley. This is the Times Square of Amsterdam. If you like that sort of thing, it's good. They don't have a gym but there is one next door and you can charge a visit to your room. That was great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible First Impression”
Reviews.Author: Dubaiexpattraveller
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 1.30pm and was advised "we don't have to give you a room until 3pm". They left me sat in the lobby for an hour until I finally found someone to give me a room. I was served b a girl called Tamsa who ad a very surly attitude. Alhouh given a lower grade room than I booked I settled in. What then followed was a banging of doors from 8pm until 2am so not great if you want to sleep. Oher than this te location was great and breakfast very nice - just a same the check in staff had such a poor attitude. The next day t check out staff were really ice so perhaps a blip ut left a ad tase.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great a city..unless u like "nightlife"”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and in a good location, its quite mordern and clean which is what you want....the city well I don't quite care so much for the 'offers'..the canal cruise (13 euro) is commercialised,.....u can walk the city in two hrs so think abt that ........I was there 1.5 days and it wasn't special...but good for stopover

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, everything within easy walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Munch_73
Reviews.Content: The rooms was very clean and comfortable. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The location is absolutely superb, if you don't want to walk, there is a bicycle hire shop 2 doors down, the train station is 3 minutes away, the same as the canal boat stop. I would recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: kevvtx
Reviews.Content: Good choice just 5 minutes from the station. The Reception staff were very helpful, the room was spotless, the bed comfortable and bathroom clean. Plenty of choice for breakfast. Four of us stayed and couldnt fault the hotel or Amsterdam, a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location for Train Station”
Reviews.Author: oschmidt28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in 2010 when the hotel was still the Golden Tulip. We arrived in Amsterdam on the train from Schipol airport, and the hotel was a quick 10 minute walk from the station. The room was nice and the hotel itself was very adequate. The hotel is also well situated for walking to all the major attractions in Amsterdam. Good value, nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TraversingTrini
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance from dam square, central station and easy access to the tram lines. Very helpful and accommodating staff. Great experience! would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. And that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: amihaic
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely terrific. Spot on in the center of Amsterdam. The room, however, was really disappointing. I came the with my girlfriend and upgraded to the "Executive Room" with the "Tropical Rain Shower". It turns out that "Executive Room" means you have a big chair instead of a little chair next to the table and the tropical rain shower is nothing but a slightly larger shower head, which was immensely uncomfortable to use since I'm 6"3, and the shower head is about 6"1... The entrance to the room is very small and you need to put your weight onto the door in order for it to open. I paid an extra 60 Euro per-night (!!!) for this room. Now that I know what it feels like I wouldn't chosen another room. Possibly another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Trent_PL
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Inntel Amsterdam Centre. I can't imagine a hotel with a better location to experience Amsterdam than this one. 10 minute walk from the train station, 2 minutes to the tram, and 3 or so blocks from the red light district. An open cafe square is just outside the hotel. Staff is very friendly, bed and pillows are confortable. The staff helped me out with all my questions. Very nice. Rooms are a tad on the small side, but they are really nice, so it isn't a problem. The one warning I'll give is that the in-room safe is tall and shallow. No problem fitting my iPad into the safe, but I doubt I could fit a laptop into it. A bit pricey, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasingly modern”
Reviews.Author: hobart_10
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the last stop of our 6 week European trip. We had stayed in many cute and charming hotels and B&B's, but by the end of our trip we were very happy to stay in this quite modern hotel with its quirky decorating and large photos of miscellaneous people around the walls. We tend to get a bit tired of 'character' hotels by the end of a long trip and loved the modern feel of our bedroom and bathroom. We'd probably rate it a solid 3.5 star hotel. Not sure what it's official rating is, if it is in fact rated. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient and the check in/check out process was fast and straight forward. There is a computer for free internet use near the foyer. Our room was very comfortable and quiet despite the handy, buzzing location. There was a full range of toiletries in the bathroom, or should have been - some of the boxes containing shower cap, nail file etc were in fact empty, so maybe a tiny bit more attention to detail wouldn't have gone astray. Having said that though, the room was clean, fresh and well maintained. The hotel looks as if it was recently renovated. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the station and walking distance to most parts of the city centre. There are plenty of places to eat and drink all around the hotel. Amsterdam is a real buzz and we had a great time. A couple of doors from the hotel is a little cafe specialising in great coffee. The owner, a very charming barista, is passionate about coffee and we had the best coffee of our 6 week trip at his place. Sad that we found him on the morning we were leaving. Not sure of the cafe's name but looking at the front of the hotel it is to the right hand side about 100 metres up the street, on the corner of the main road. Do yourself a favour if you love good espresso.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: erdriver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the main train station, less than 10 minute walk away. It is in the middle of every thing that you want to see in Amsterdam. The staff were very friendly and let us check in early after a long overnight flight from the states. A very big plus! The room was clean and bed comfortable. The only downside to this hotel that I found was the air conditioning does not cool the room very well on hot days. Other than that we liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: jcice
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is one of our favorite cities in the world, we usually stay in apartments, but this hotel is one of our favorites for short stays. It's location can't be beat, within walking distance to Central station (assuming it's not raining), Dam Square, Anne Frank, Red Light, and pretty much everything else. The rooms are small, but what rooms aren't in major European city centers? You aren't here to sit in the room anyway! The beds are very soft and comfortable, and everything is very clean. The pillows selection is also good. The bathrooms are small, but also clean, and the shower worked great. We used the free wifi on multiple devices with little problems, maybe we got lucky in a good location, but it worked fine for us. Last year we stayed on the other side of the the hotel, and it also worked well. It also wasn't a big deal to have to take one elevator up and cross over to the other tower for us. They have to maintain the historical buildings in the city center, there is only so much they can do. Pricewise it was also pretty good particularly compared to the other hotels in the nearby area. Amsterdam is a walking (or biking) city, and to best experience it, you have to stay in the city center ("Centrum"). From someone who has spent a lot of time in the city, I'd highly recommend this hotel for price, location, and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great but poor wifi makes it impossible for business”
Reviews.Author: HentiCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on business. Great location, right in the centre of the city, clean and reasonable rooms, pleasant staff. Unfortunately the wifi was chronically slow, to the point of unusable. Working with colleagues in the USA late at night was impossible. So, good for a city break but until they upgrade their internet connection, for business, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk from Central station to the hotel. The name has changed from THE GOLDEN TULIP to INNTEL. but the place is still as good. The staff are all very friendly, the rooms are great with flat screen TV............but who needs TV when in Amsterdam??? Coffee and tea supplied in the rooms. We will definately use the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good accomodations”
Reviews.Author: wearsy2
Reviews.Content: Great location. Near the Dam, Central Station, Red light district and shopping. Rooms are a little tight but clean and recently remodelled. No fitness centre but there is a gym next door which you can pay to attend. Free WiFi although the connection is intermittant on the 4th floor. You get much better reception on first floor. Hotel was surprisingly quiet. Slept with the window open all 4 nights and did not get interrupted.

Reviews.Title: “Modern fitting, fixtures and service in a central location”
Reviews.Author: royal618
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel with all the amenities one could find useful for a short break in Amsterdam. New, modern, (slightly) edgy fit-out makes a change from the boring vanilla rooms that so many hotels offer, and will appease the more discerning traveller. Unfortunately, my bed was two singles pushed together with two single quilts which was annoyance. My room, whilst on a high floor, faced one of the laneways, and there was a bit of noise from people through the night, so your best option would be to get a room that faced inwards. Breakfast, whilst being a decent spread was expensive at 15â‚¬. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms though was a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: AKtravel83
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is within walking distance of the central station and was a great spot to base ourselves. Rooms were clean but nothing special - very standard hotel including room facilities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: tourist8335
Reviews.Content: good service, nice and clean hotel in a very convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up & Thumbs Down”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNila
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inntel Hotel in city center for two nights. The hotel itself is exactly how it looks online: modern and cozy. The location is perfect, within close walking distance of restaurants, bars, shopping, and other points of interest. We were greeted by a personalized message on the TV screen as we entered our room, which was great. We were disappointed, however, in the twin sized beds that were pushed together to give the appearance of a queen size--these beds were not too comfortable and the pillows were quite flat. Also, the room was tiny, but we are aware of the fact that most European hotel rooms are. We were most unhappy with the temperature of the water in the shower. It was almost impossible to find the right temperature as it went from icy cold to scalding hot and vice versa. We also did not like the fact that we only had one small trash can in the entire room, which was in the bathroom. For the price we paid, I would say this hotel is average--we found good and bad. Would we stay again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Hagenger
Reviews.Content: With a few minutes away from the train station it is perfectly located. Nice and friendly staff. Nice and clean room. My room was "full" of desks and the bed was a cupboard bed type. So it was obvious that the room has more than one function. The room was quiet even though it faced the street. Breakfast was really nice. I didn't miss a thing. I have also stayed at Inntel in Zaandam and I can really recommend this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Grea location but small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: catp79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inntel for 3 nights in March. The location was perfect; within walking distance of the train station; red light district and the city centre. There are plenty of good bars and restaurants around as well as fast food outlets. The staff were friendly and the room spotlessly clean however, it was the noisiest room I have ever stayed in. Not only could you hear the constant ringing of some church bells but the noise of the lift was ridiculous...every time the lift was used we had to put up with the loudes whirring noise imaginable. Also the size of the bathroom was tiny. Shame as the fact we couldn't sleep put a real downer on our trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: When we booked the hotel we got a very good price for 2 nights stay. We also found the location of the hotel to be excellent and at the centre of all the place we went to visit. The room was neat and clean. It was furnished with all basic amenities. The staff of the hotel was very kind and friendly and spoke very good English. I recommend this hotel if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Not so Good”
Reviews.Author: Two1zna9
Reviews.Content: The Good: Closeness to Central Station is a plus, about a 10 minute walk. Also, the closeness to City Center, RLD, Damrak, Shopping, Restaurants is a very big plus. The housekeeping staff are very friendly when you see them in the halls. The rooms are spotlessly clean. Bed and linens are extremely comfortable. Good hot water, AC/Heat worked perfectly. The Bar is nice and relaxing in the evening to sit and have a Heineken and catch up on emails with the strong wifi signal. Bartender remembered what I ordered only after one visit the next night, nice. The concierge was friendly and helpful. The decor is modern and different, but I liked it. The room was incredibly quiet for being in the City Center. Getting a Taxi to the airport from the hotel is cheaper than flagging one down, you buy a voucher for 42 Euros from the front desk then they call and 5 minutes you have a Taxi. The Not So Good: The elevator situation is a little weird if they put you in a room in the back of the hotel, actually another building. You go up 2 floors on one elevator, get off and go down a long hall to another elevator to go up to your floor. With that said, the elevators are fast and you don't wait more than a few seconds. Hotel advertises Free Wifi in every Room, not true, being in the back the signal is weak and if you can actually get on you won't have a signal long, minutes at most, I'd say 90% of the time I tried to use it in my room there no signal. Very frustrating since I booked this hotel over another hotel like it because of the Free Wifi as I needed to keep up with work emails daily. Complaining at Front Desk will get you nowhere, they don't care. Re: Front Desk Staff, some are grumpy and unhelpful especially at night, not all, most. The sign you hang on your door, one side says â€œPlease Do Not Disturbâ€�, the other side says â€œPlease Clean My Roomâ€� Me being a bit of a night owl I like to sleep in, so I hang the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign on my door, every morning I get a call from the Housekeeping Supervisor asking me if I want my room cleaned. If I wanted my room cleaned donâ€™t you think I would have hung the side that said â€œPlease Clean My Roomâ€�? Maybe they donâ€™t know how to read I guess. That was annoying since I said the 2nd time they called I donâ€™t want my room cleaned if I have the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign on my door. They still called. Upon checking out they tried to charge me for 7 days of breakfast which I never had breakfast one day there. She started to argue with me and said it says here you did, I said I donâ€™t even eat breakfast kinda irritated and she quickly said there must be a problem with our computer, Iâ€™ll take it off. I wonder if that is just standard practice to charge you until you argue it. Would I stay here again? Maybe, if I couldn't find a better one in the same location and rating. I liked the location, the clean rooms and the hotel itself. Just wished they wouldnâ€™t advertise free wifi in every room when they know it isnâ€™t. That is my biggest complaint. The other stuff I can live with.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nstro
Reviews.Content: I stayed in may 2011, with my partner. The hotel was just as others had written. Great value, good room, good location, helpful and friendly staff. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: juc77
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel's location is fantastic. It is less than 10 minutes' walk (even with heavy bags!) from Centraal Station, either straight down Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal or down Damrak then cutting through the alleys around Nieuewendijk. It is located on Nieuewzijds Kolk, a small courtyard with bars and restaurants, leading to many more food/drink places down the alleys: brown bars, coffeeshops, fast food and bakeries - all with late night opening. (Would personally recommend Wok to Walk, 420 Coffeeshop, and the Croissanterie opposite that.) A main tramstop leading to the wider city is located only a few steps away from the hotel on Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal. Dam Square, the Red Light District, several shopping areas and the Grachtengordel are each only a few minutes' walk away The hotel itself is very smart and the reception staff were friendly (and helped me with my stumbling Dutch! Their English is perfect). They stored our bags for us before we could access our room and also after we had checked out. The 'Superior' room was a decent size, quiet, and very clean; its view was onto an internal courtyard and the breakfast room. It had a wardrobe, suitcase rest, desk, flatscreen TV with remote, a table, two chairs, several lamps, bedside tables, a mini bar, and tea and coffee facilities; plus the double bed was enormous! The en suite bathroom was fine and, most importantly, clean, although I'm not sure how much I'd agree with the hotel's description of 'luxury'. It does have a bath with a good shower, but it is a touch small and the decor and hairdyer is only basic. It did have nice toiletries: the usuals, plus a basic beauty kit and bath chrystals. Housekeeping were very prompt in bringing extra tea/coffee etc when we asked. The room also had free wifi which was a useful bonus. We didn't eat breakfast or a meal there so cannot comment on that, but the bar area looked nice and cosy. The same area also had two PCs with internet for guests to use. All in all a very pleasant clean hotel with nice staff and a fabulous location. Would certainly consider staying here again. Amsterdam itself was lovely, we were very lucky with the Easter weather, and would definitely recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but let down by the Reception personnel”
Reviews.Author: Bhavish271
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location as its in close proximity to all the major attractions. The hotel itself is very nice. During our stay we had a standard double room which was big enough and easily comfortable for two people. The staff from the breakfast area, the room service staff, etc were all extremely helpful and friendly. The only downside to the hotel is a couple members of the Reception staff as mentioned in the title. Examples of this include not helping when requiring assistance about restaurants that might be open after 11pm, standing outside smoking knowing that we are waiting at the reception desk for their assistance and lastly charging us AGAIN for City Tax. We had already paid for the tax when booking the hotel however the Receptionist insisted on charging it again. I wrote an email to them three days ago asking for a refund however I have not heard from them. If it wasnt for the negatives mentioned then I would definitely have rated this as a five but the staff in question severely let the hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Centre”
Reviews.Author: DeputyDawg46
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 5 nights at the Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Centre in Amsterdam. We were very pleased with our stay. The room was your normal European room but was large enough for a king sized bed, small table, and a couple chairs. The room had a mini-fridge for our personal items and the hotel had free wifi. There were 2 elevators that required key access and were in good working order. The hotel and room was quiet on all nights. The room was clean upon arrival and cleaned very well each day. Cannot say enough about the location as it was within 3 blocks of the central train station, 2 blocks from where you can get tours and board tour buses and many eating places. A supermarket was within 2 blocks. We took the train from the airport to Central Station and walked the 3 blocks to the hotel easily. The hotel staff spoke excellent English and were very responsive when we asked for more towels. We do not plan on visiting Amsterdam anything again soon but if we were to, this is the hotel that we'd stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: beav
Reviews.Content: Our first of three nights in Amsterdam, I booked the Inntel because there was no availability at the b&b in the Museumplein where we spent our last two nights. I was grateful for the opportunity to be close to the train station (where we came in) and especially pleased when they offered us a free upgrade to a junior suite. Our room was comfortable and spacious. The real orchid was a nice touch. The bed was super comfortable and the flat screen TV at the foot of the bed was an unusual placement. The bathroom was nice. Especially the double showerhead - see photo. The view out the window was gorgeous during the day, but on a Saturday night was quite noisy (right on a touristy square). Everyone at the front desk was very helpful - even recommended an area of town for dinner that proved to be excellent. (We ate at Restaurant Zwaantje in the Nine Streets area.)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic everything”
Reviews.Author: meisarah
Reviews.Content: the staff are very helpful,polite with excellent service, the location are great so near with shopping centre,coffe shop,resto,red light district and central station this is a very recommended hotel in amst to stay

Reviews.Title: “Bland but clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Loddonlily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. It's a fairly standard international tourist hotel - everything was clean and well looked after, but there is a complete absence of local character (well, any character at all!). Our "superior" double room was comfortable, level of equipment was ok without being luxurious. Our main complaint about the room is the level of lighting - the only place you will have enough light to read something is in the bathroom! The only food served is breakfast, which is an uncontroversial international buffet. It's ok, and obviously convenient, but expensive at EUR15. There's no benefit to buying it in advance, so you might as well avoid paying up front and just go if and when you feel like it. Handy for your first morning, perhaps - but once you have found your way around you will find more choices and better value just around the corner. The location was ok - 5+ minutes walk from Centraal station - but unless you plan to spend most of your time in the red light district it may not be the best. Every time we went somewhere we had to start by getting a tram (stop very close by) - it might have been better to have been a little further South. As has been noted there is wifi - but at least in our room the connection quality was poor - not good enough to play a YouTube stream, for example. Someone else commented on grumpy reception staff: this appears to be the luck of the draw, as we had a a grumpy one when we arrived and a much friendlier one when we left! Bar is comfortable with good service and, considering where you are, not unreasonably expensive. But, as always, stay away from the mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: rong236
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on reviews on tripadviser, and a good choice. I found the hotel to be in a perfect location, a 5 minutes walk from central station, and having great tram transportation close by. the hotel staff where very friendly and offered great advice. Our room was in the second building at the back of the hotel, we had views of a block of flats, but it was great for us and very quiet. The hotel offered a good breakfast with a good choice, and is open till late incase you need a little longer in bed. Overall we enjoyed our stay, and I would recomend Inntel hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: linksmom
Reviews.Content: Group of 6 people stayed here 4 nights. It really is only a 6-7 minute walk from the train station. The staff in the reception were very friendly and nice, they gave us maps and explained about Amsterdam`s different areas. The double rooms are comfortable, so are the single rooms, but they are expensive compared to the doubles. Beds are good and the bathroom has tiles all over and looks very new and clean. Breakfast is good and the breakfast room is light and nice. They also have fresh oranges so you can make your own orange juice. I liked very much the interior design with big black and white photos everywhere, even on the tables in the breakfast room. And very important - they have free WiFi all over the hotel included the rooms. It`s a short walking distance to tram, restaurants, shopping and - yes, Red Light District. I would not hesitate to stay here again if I went back to Amsterdam. The only thing I did not like was this: If your room is in "tower 2" you have to take the lift to the second floor, get out of the lift, walk through a corridor to tower 2 and find another lift to your room. Was a bit confusing at times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: moodle
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. It is in a great location - quiet but close to all the attractions, bars and restaurants, and only a 5-minute walk from the main train station. Check-in and out were very straight forward and prompt. Our room was at the very back of the hotel in the 'second building' and was a good size for Amsterdam. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean as were all the areas of the hotel we visited. The only negative was that there was just enough cupboard space for two for a long weekend but not if you were there for a week. The breakfast room was very light and airy, with cheerful staff and a good choice of breakfasts - hot and cold - and all very fresh and tasty. We did have to wait a little while for a table and for fresh bacon on the Saturday morning as it was very busy so perhaps another member of staff wouldn't go amiss. A bonus on the weekend is that it opens from 7.30am until 11.30am so plenty of time for a lie-in! The barman was very helpful, welcoming us on our first evening and suggested lots of places to eat and drink. We thought the drinks were expensive until we got out and about and realised they are expensive everywhere! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: pallinime
Reviews.Content: GREAT location! Close to everything you need. Nice hotel. Rooms are small but rather comfortable. The bed was perfect!! I lived in the second building (not main) and there was quiet enough. Breakfast isn't bad but very standard, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: cMcJ10
Reviews.Content: I have previously read about the street facing rooms being too noisy so we ensure we requested a quiet room and had no problems. The hotel is modern and has an updated style. The rooms are pretty snug but they still provide all the necessary amenities. The buffect breakfast is absolutely delicious and very fresh. The service was good but not excellent or above and beyond. The location is very central allowing you to freely walk to all major locations. Plus it is close enough to Amsterdam Centraal so you can easily catch a train to nearby towns, the airport, or anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ferdn
Reviews.Content: The room was small but modern. The bed was fairly comfortable, but the pillow was a bit flat and worn out. Brilliant location right in the centre. There was some noise from the trams at night. All in all a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location-yes Comfort-yes Price-yes...and no”
Reviews.Author: treyjewels
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location was perfect. The tram stop was 30 yards away, and Central station was maybe a 1/2 mile. The hotel was on a small side street close to Dam Square and the Red Light district. The rooms were big and comfortable by Ams standards. Everything was clean and tidy as well. We decided to stay through the weekend in Amsterdam, and the hotels pricing for Saturday night soared to Grand Amrath levels. We wanted to stay in a different part of town anyway, so we left. There was no billing or overcharge issues as some have complained about, and the staff was always helpful and attentive. For example, we arrived at 7am and the staff went out of their way to get us in a room immediately (which they did)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: san1jayin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times now. This is located in the centre of Amsterdam. Apart from its location, it has all the necessary facilities which I would need during my business travel. It is reasonably priced, good staff and most importantly, very neat interiors of the room and well maintained. Hotel also provides free wi fi access.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest bed EVER!”
Reviews.Author: amandamonkey
Reviews.Content: What a hotel, clean, friendly, helpful! Right in the centre of everything 5 minutes walk from central station, red light, tram, canals, food and cafes. Now the bad is massive! two people can do star fishes and still not touch, it was very comfortable too. I wish Inntel would roll out their hotels everywhere i would stay with them everytime. Really enjoyable stay and highly reccomended :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrmrscoxy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, the reception staff were very helpful. The hotel gave a very good 1st impression however the room wasn't as chic looking but still nice. There was a wardrobe but no shelves or drawers for clothes or underwear which I found a little annoying. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Very good location in the city centre

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient even if the carpets are strange!”
Reviews.Author: Simon-Laurie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 6 times since November 2010. 1 & 2 night stays and will be going back. The staff are friendly the rooms are clean and have comfortable beds. If anything is wrong a quick call to the desk puts it right. I have not eaten here, still looking for a good inexpensive restaurant / brasserie type place in Amsterdam. (any recommendations?) I do find the new carpets a little odd, I sort of understand the design but they are a little strange. (For those that have not stayed here the carpets resemble a pavement with drains, manholes and red bricks like the ones in the city. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station, and a few steps to trams.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: Nice_Fit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past December, but it was booked for me as part of a group, going to Amsterdam for a business meeting. I have actually been to Amsterdam more times than I can actually remember, going back since 1986. I liked the hotel last time I stayed there, and as this trip involved flying to Amsterdam, spending a night, and then getting on a train early the next morning to Eindhoven, I thought it would be a good place to say because it's minutes away from the Central Station, which I had to get back to for my train journey. The hotel has a very warm atmosphere, friendly staff, ultra clean and well appointed rooms with all the conveniences, and serves a great buffet breakfast in the morning. The rooms aren't huge, but I've stayed in worse. Comfortable bed. Good toiletries in the bathroom. I liked the fact that the staff recognised that I had stayed there before. I agree with another reviewer that the people photography might be slightly over the top. I understand what the hotel manager said about it part of their brand personality (I've been a brand consultant and I'm a marketing manager) but they might be hitting people over the head with it just a tad, but I give them points in a way by trying to portray their brand in a different way. I really can't think of anything negative to say about it. Maybe that the Wifi was a bit slow? The bottom line is that I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a great time”
Reviews.Author: UK_Yank83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned, near the train station, Red Light District, and tram lines to anywhere in the city. You are near the nightlife of De Wallen (red light), you can get to the museums and Leidesplein in 15 minutes, and Dam Square and the Royal Palace are nearby. There is also a whole row of bars and pubs if you or anyone in your group wants to go out and not get caught up in the trappings of the Red Light. Our room was functional and good size for the Continent. The beds were a little soft, and it did take an act of Parliament to get extra pillows brought up. These were only minor setbacks, though. If you are in Amsterdam to party, this is your place. If you are here fro business, though, it seems far from the centers of commerce. Breakfast was also very expensive for what they offered, but there were restaurants and Creperies offering breakfast options for under 8 Euros nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty horrible smelly hotel do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Amh13_123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like there web site,it is filthy smells even has mold on the Walls, you would,net let a dog sleep in there rooms. We got a full refund and walked the round the Courner to another hotel intel hotel which is 4 star and very nice

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: ladyjc76
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfectly located and great price , 16 ladies stayed here and we loved it , rooms great size clean and new, bed s were comfortable and staff were lovely

Reviews.Title: “great location good hotel....”
Reviews.Author: neetzrag
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 days for a off site...first things first the location of the hotel is excellent,right in the center of action,loads of restaurants near by,shopping district at 3minutes walk,stores like new yorkers,c&a,hema close by,central station at 7 minutes walk,maddame thussadds at 5minutes....in short excellent location... rooms were small but clean...gud service...helpful staff...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for business or leisure, location excellent”
Reviews.Author: maninette
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and breakfast, beautiful rooms but price/quality a little bit too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Modern and inviting,pleasant and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: BuffyManchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near to the train station as it is only one tram stop away (and the lady let us on for free!) but easily walkable if we had known our way. The hotel is on a quiet side street but well lit and visible. The reception area is clean and quiet,with a real log fire feature in the lounge area (which became apparent later that night) The two lifts require room cards to gain entry which we thought was a great security feature. At check-in, the lady on reception was very pleasant and professional wearing a smart/clean uniform which is always a good first impression. I requested the use of an iron for our 3 day stay, the hotel staff were very efficient in this as the iron and board arrived at our room within 5 mins,i was very impressed by this. I also asked to borrow an adaptor the day after, as i had forgotten mine and realising they were 7 euros to buy at the nearby supermarket!! Wow This of course was done with a small deposit required. The rooms are very small but cosy with a great sized bed and cute/clean bathroom. The water was especially hot though so be careful! My only little niggle was that there wasnt any hair conditioner in those little bottles they provide,we even had a sewing kit?! The carpets on our floor were being replaced on our last 2 days but this sort of thing has to be maintained and didnt bother us at all. There was a polite notice in the lift to inform guests of this. Can i suggest if your are,like me,a big water drinker,do not drink the large 1 litre bottle as part of the minibar as it is 4.95euro and i had 2 bottles before realising this!! Overall we had a pleasant stay and if visiting Amsterdam would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: scrambledmegs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and well-kept. Have to use your room key to open the door at night, which I liked. The room was very clean and well furnished/decorated, like the rest of the hotel. Television was a bit limited, but I only needed it for background noise to fall asleep to anyway. The bathroom was especially nice. Room itself was a bit small, I guess, but it didn't bother me.. especially for the price. Room for a dresser, wardrobe, two twin beds, a little table and two dining chairs, anyway! The staff were readily available.. we didn't seek them out very much but they were helpful and friendly. The location was the best part about it; we were never more than about a 10 minute walk from most of the things we wanted or needed, including the Red Light District, but we weren't so close that somebody who wouldn't want to be near it would be uncomfortable. Very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: csf1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location, right in the centre of everything, great bars and restaurants all around. The rooms are fine, nothing special, nothing flash, but then again, you're in Amsterdam, how long do you actually spend in the room?? One thing I would say is not to bother upgrading - the upgraded rooms didn't actually seems any different to the standard!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: krityur
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel to stay in for business travel because of the proximity to the central station and restaurants which are open till late. The breakfast was average but all right for 15 euros. The king sized bed was very comfortable and the free wifi a plus. The room was also spacious. The hotel is located directly across a tram station for Trams 1,2,5 etc. It's also very near the shopping area which is open till 9:00 p.m. on Thursdays. The cheapest way to get here to and from Schiphol is via the Connexion shuttle transfers which leaves every 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NabaRD
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location just off Dam Square and right beside a lovely little italian restaurant. Rooms are standard but clean and the breakfast is nice. There is a lovely foyer area with comfy chairs and a fire that is great to relax by. Would definitely recommend as a great option for Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Very Smart Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nelvalamy
Reviews.Content: Really friendly hotel with a "trendy" bar/lounge area. The open gas fire is a warm and welcoming feature when you come back from a hard day walking and sightseeing. Particularly want to mention the friendly and very helpful barman called Gideon who recommended to us one of the best restaurants we have eaten in for a long while.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, cannot say 1 bad thing!!”
Reviews.Author: uberdude
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this was everything we expected and more! The hotel itself is immaculately furnished with a nice modern feel. The staff were fantastic, greeted us around every corner and only bothered us when we approached them, which arguably is a big plus for hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam. Many of the reviews lambasted the size of the rooms, but we honestly felt that it was very much on par with other European destinations, arguably not the biggest rooms, but more than ample considering that every square inch of Amsterdam comes with a premium. We however did go for a superior room which comes with a king size bed for a couple extra quid a night. Ever though the hotel itself is right in the middle of the action, its brilliantly placed position in the square guaranteed a good nights sleep (No direct traffic passed the windows). Initially we could hear all the noise the city had to offer but we quickly realized there was there little gizmo attached the window, that allowed some air into the room, and after a quick pull of the strings, we were dead to the world, or rather, the noisy streets of Amsterdam were dead to us. I highly recommend this hotel and will most certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ctron1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed the hotel. The only contact we had with staff was on check in and check out. Both experiences were great. At check in the guy, without us asking, pulled out a map and pointed out all the sights and the best ways to get there. The rooms are comfortable and the beds are very good. The hotel seems secure as well. The lift requires a room key to access and the rooms come with a safe. I have heard many horror stories of people having their rooms robbed in Amsterdam, so to see those security features (the safe was free) was a comfort. What was really surprising about this hotel is how quiet it was. I am a very light sleeper and I heard no noise all night. The location of this hotel is really a plus. We walked everywhere we went. We walked to Dam square, the Van Gogh Museum, Anne Frank house, the Heineken experience etc. Nothing was more than about 30 minutes walk from the hotel. All in all it was a great trip and we would certainly return to this hotel if we ever go back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location But not for toddlers”
Reviews.Author: Eifa2012
Reviews.Content: We arrived news years day Room not ready but we understood as it was a busy time the week before. Checked in and the girl at the desk kindly took our bags. First impressions where good. Only problem we had was the bill we dad my parents with us and we paid for there room in cash and ours in credit card when we first arrived When we came back to collect keys the girl tried to charge us again. We showed her the recipit and she told us our room numbers We had our 14 month little girl with us and the hotel supplied us with a cot. So with the cot and buggy in the room made it feel very small and not much room for her to move around . The lounge bar was lovely with big open fire but it did not open till 4 and on our 2nd night we came back for a drink and my husband was charged 26 euro for 4 drinks a bit steep we thought he went back to the bar and asked her to check it and she told him it was right.. The real bar man came back on and we asked him when he came ober to see if we where ok he checked the price of the round and refunded the 8euro difference and a really really nice bloke he also checked our Room number and it turned out the other girl had also charged our room as well as over charged us. The bar man was so nice we did not bring it up at check out. On Wednesday morning the Tv came on while we where in bed and at about 8.30 am and woke my little one up. Asking me to contact reception that there was a problem with my credit card I rang reception and she told me the card had failed I told herctge room was paid . She told me she would get back to me.. I got up and brought the recepit down to reception ( as I had been shopping while there) again I had to prove we had paid and she said we owed her 50 euro deposit but she had been trying to put the full room price and the 50euro through. Sorted again I thought on check out again I was told I owed 100euro I again had to pull out all the recepits. And it turned out they owed me 47euro and the other 50 euro to my credit card. Found it all a bit stressful. The very nice man on reception said it was because of the way the booking was done on easy to book.com and it was all sorted but 4 times at reception and 1 time at the bar to be worried about been over charged lucky I stayed out of the coffee shops and had my recepits

Reviews.Title: “No regard for their customers!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: studentcity_10
Reviews.Content: on 17th December last Amsterdam closed its airport due to snow (not our fault). 10 of us (all working for a travel company in southern Ireland) were booked into the Inntel Amsterdam Hotel. Obviously, we could not get there. However, the only satisfaction we got were copies and copies of their cancellation policy, which did not pertain, in any way, to our situation!! They charged us over a â‚¬1,0000. We too have cancellation policies, but continue to make exceptions in exceptional circumstances. A similar situation last year, during the ash cloud, saw the Hotel Mangan in Nice, not charging us a cent!! Shame on you Inntel Hotel Amsterdam!!!! KEEP WELL AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. YOU WILL ALL BE TREATED LIKE US!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nixey99
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, excellently located hotel. Although close to the main tram line we found our room to be quiet & were not bothered by noise from the city centre. Shopping is right on your door step & most attractions are walkable if you are fit & don't mind strolling around. The red light district which is a massive tourist attraction is minutes away. We found some of the better coffee shops & eateries in the near vicinity of the hotel. The staff were very helpful. The room was clean & a reasonable size, not large by any stretch! Good quality complementary toiletries. We didn't eat at the hotel as breakfast was very expensive...mind you, food in Amsterdam is expensive generally. Humphries restaurant next door is well worth a visit, good food at a good price. Over all a pleasant expreience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Has it all!”
Reviews.Author: s209travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our trip. We picked another hotel in Amsterdam at the beginning, which was more centrally located. After touring a few cities, we picked this one to be near the train station (which we could walk to) so we could get to the airport easily the next morning. There were things I liked better about this hotel as compared to our first. This felt like a decent sized hotel. The employees had really cute/fashionable uniforms. The lobby was inviting, with a fire going in the fireplace, two computers with Internet access, and a long table with reading material (in Dutch, of course!). The vibe is modern, if you don't mind large pictures of strangers looking at you, even above your bed. My husband joked that he had his way with a couple of women during the night. The room was a nice size, and the water in the shower came out nicely instead of straight down like it did at our other hotel, which made us feel cold! The only "negative" here is that -- whether it was the mattress pad or comforter -- my husband was sweating all night. *I* was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in AMS”
Reviews.Author: IUBBFAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Dec 4-6th. We arrived early in the morning after our flight from SEA-AMS at approximately 0830. Even thought it was well before check in time, the receptionist was so nice and we were happy to find out that they would have a room ready for us! The rooms are average size by European standards, but very clean and modern. We didn't have a single problem while staying for the weekend. The reception staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. they recommended a "local" eatery that the staff liked to frequent "Three Giraffes", it was great food and well priced. A much better value than the 15 euros for the hotels breakfast. The common areas were all very nice, staff great and we would gladly recommend this hotel to friends to stay at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Watch what you ask for”
Reviews.Author: kap6244
Reviews.Content: Upon checking I asked the desk staff if breakfast was included with room price. Thw reply I was recieived was yes. So every morning I went to breakfast. No hwere is there any indication of a breakfast charge or price in the breakfast room. Upon checkout breakfast for two people was charged on my bill at 150.00 us dollars. I told the clerk I was told it was included. She asked by whom . I did not get the girls name on check in or I don't know if I would have remembered it after flying all nite, Did not have time to dispute since I had a taxi waiting. Save your money and take a walk down the street to the many different coffee and pastry shops near the hotel . You will save alot of money and have a good breakfast. Wish I had done that . Lesson learned hope this helps someone out and saves a tourist from being riped off.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: Trent1984
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Centre the weekend of Nov 19-22. I arrived at the hotel at 10:30am and my room was promptly available. The aesthetics of the property are modern and clean. The rooms are of nice size and the bedding very comfortable. The hotel is centrally located in the Centrum.. Steps away from restaurants, bars, shops, and the trams. The hotel is located just 5 minutes from Centraal Station and within walking distance to many of the cities top attractions - Anne Frank House, Red Light District, Dam Square, Old Town, etc. The only time that I relied on the transit system was going to the Van Gogh Museum. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, which makes any stay at a hotel all the nicer.. All in all, I had a very pleasant stay at the Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Centre and would highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: andresphabian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in the middle of our "Late Gap Year" traveling throughout Europe for a month and we have stayed at some amazing little places thanks mostly to trip advisor. That is how we found this place in the middle of the old centre in Amsterdam. It's clean. The rooms are big (for Europe). It's convenient. So if you don't mind rude, un-professional front desk staff then this is the place for you. Let me explain. My wife and I are traveling using a fixed rate debit card from Australia, which allows put some money into it at a fixed rate and saves you from fluctuating exchange rates. So needles to say this has been our lifeline. So throughout all our travels which have included Portugal, spain, France we had never encountered a hotel. That would settle the whole hotel bill before the end of your stay. Which is what they did. They charged our debit card and said they cannot withdraw the charge until 4 days. We wouldnt even be on the country at the end of the 4 days. And what's worse. Leaving us with no money for 4 days!!!! We we confronted the hotel manager with this she was quite abrupt and unhelpful and made us feel as if it was our fault that we didn't had an extra 400â‚¬ sitting somewhere waiting for a hotel to screw up your holiday budget. So there we were stranded in Amsterdam for 4 days with no money thanks to their stupid hotel policies. Summary. Good hotel, Good location. unhelpful staff. bad management.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing locations & the smallest room i have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: AHMED81
Reviews.Content: the hotel location was a walking distance to every thing in the down town. the room was very small i did not expect it. any how it was only 1 night so it did not matter we were out all day. but the hotel was clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated exactly in the city centre which was very convenient for me. The room was clean and the staff is helpful. I liked that Internet access is provided for free. As it seems quite normal it is not common in many hotels. On the other hand, i found expensive the price of breakfast (15 euros per person). Generally, i think that the services of the hotel are overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Tiffin
Reviews.Content: Lovely welcome from reception on arrival. 5th floor room,(rm 5566) was really clean..& not a bad size,(well how much time do you spend in the room on a 2nt trip. We specifically aked for a quiet,end of corridor,& our request was met,so we had a peaceful nights sleep. Very central..lots of bars & resturaunts around,only 5 mins walk from Dam square,the staion,& red light area. Loads of fabulous shopping right on the doorstep too. There's also a tram stop less than 30 seconds walk. Brekkie was dear at euros 15.00,so we took it at coffee conection on the corner.(just left out of hotel). We would really recomend this room..We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cestlaviebaby
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very good located, workers are nice, breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good but oddly-shaped rooms”
Reviews.Author: NYCleveland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an extremely central location, a few blocks from the train station and red light district (not along a charming canal, if that's what you're looking for.) It's near all the tram lines, but also a good central place to start walking from, and not far from a few gay bars and "coffee" shops. The room was small by American standards, but comfortable. But ours was oddly shaped: you had to take a sharp turn to the left to get from the door to the bed. They didn't have one large bed for the two of us, so they put together two single beds, which gave the place a little dorm room feel. The staff was pleasant (but strangely not able to give us very good dinner recommendations). The cons? Breakfast was overpriced so we ate elsewhere. The view from our window was of another building which was a little noisy at night (but being a New Yorker the city noise didn't bother me).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ej2denali
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Centre and couldn't be more pleased with the hotel. It is ideally located in Amsterdam, near the downtown area and most tourist sights, but on a street where you can get some peace and quiet. Rooms are fairly small but very comfortable and clean and service at the front desk is outstanding. The free wifi internet is a big plus too. We didn't try the breakfast, as it is 15 EUR per person, but overall would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KathiPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: We found the Inntel Hotel through our travel agent and were very satisfied with our choice. The hotel is clean and modern, and the breakfast room was beautiful and the breakfast--although not included--was very nice. Located near Dam Square, the hotel is an excellent base for exploring the city on foot. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and spoke English. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre-shaped rooms but generally great and ideal location for adventuring”
Reviews.Author: Norcal.Vaughan
Reviews.Content: I say bizarre-shaped rooms because my husband and I had just arrived from Germany, where our hotel rooms were also small and efficient (we're from the US) and, while we were expecting similar small efficiency, we instead found bizarre angles and spaces that didn't make a ton of sense. Overall though, the room was nice and it even had a tub, which was unexpected and actually a nice way to relax after a long train ride. The bed was large (a king) and comfy with the down comforter. We did sleep with the window cracked since the down made it a bit warm. We had a brief squabble with the safe, but someone was there to help us in a flash and it opened as they knocked on the door. Great service over all. The only down side of the hotel was the computer situation in the lounge, as the connection was slow - even slower than the free wifi - so printing out our boarding passes took some doing, but we waited it out. The decor was pleasant, though inconsistent from the lobby to the hallways to the room - as the first and last were contemporary and the second - well, it was more reminiscent of a Marriot than a W, but it hardly mattered. This hotel puts you in a great spot to explore the city center and beyond, since you're right on the tram line, in walking distance from the Central train station and close to any and all of the Amsterdam sights you might want to visit. If you're planning a trip to the Anne Frank Museum, first make a reservation online (saves HOURS in queuing) and then visit the Resistance Museum (near the zoo and botanical gardens) before going. The Resistance Museum was the surprise of our trip and thoroughly interesting. Gives a great background of the resistance movement in Holland during the German invasion. For dinner, we loved Kop Van Jut (Head of Jut) for good old Amsterdam/Holland fare and their home brew, which was quite good. The NoorMarkt (sp?) was also a good find for trinkets and food and the Flower Market for gifts and just general amusement. Beautiful. Of course, walking the canals and ducking into coffeeshops and bars was lovely - especially given the moodiness of the weather that was at any moment raining, sunny and warm, hailing or overcast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Becks1180
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a weekend stay in this hotel and recieved excellent service from the minute we arrived. After arriving into Amsterdam very early (10am) we took a chance in visiting the hotel to see if we could leave our bags there. The delightful gentleman was more than helpful. He looked up our room for us and told us it would be available at half 12 and that we could leave our bags in the luggage room. He then gave us a map of the city circling the places of interest for us. When checking out they again let us leave our bags until our flights later in the evening. The location was perfect, the decor was beautiful, the rooms were spotless. Didnt have the breakfast so cant comment on that. Could do with an information booklet in the rooms but other that that - a warm,welcoming hotel in a great location for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location. Close to central station, near tram lines and very close to shops yet still very quiet in the room. Modern hotel, well designed rooms and very clean. Minibar overpriced but what's new about that ! Breakfast was nice, well laid out hot and cold buffet.

Reviews.Title: “We had money taken from our account”
Reviews.Author: livvy1_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, good location also stayed here about 12 years ago. We all paid our city taxes in Euros on departure morning but then they tried to take it again off my partners barclaycard a week after we returned. Luckily Barclaycard contacted him but my friends partner wasn't so lucky and had money taken from his card.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: HPK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one weekend night in advance of a business trip that had me working in the outskirts of Amsterdam. I chose the hotel because it was reasonably priced and seemed to be in a convenient location that i could use as a base from which to explore the city. I was really happy with my choice as it turned out to be everything I was looking for. The room was clean and comfortable (although small by US standards). It is a 5 minute walk to the central train station from which you can get trains/trams to anywhere in the city. Just outside the hotel is a tram stop for tram lines #2, 5 that go to some of the most desirable tourist spots (museums, etc). You can buy a pass for the trams but I just paid for each trip as i got on the tram (2.60 Euro). There are also lots of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Tip: If you plan on going to the Van Gogh museum definitely buy your tickets online in advance so you don't have to stand in line when you get there. the wait can be over an hour on busy days. If you don't buy your tickets before going to Amsterdam you can use the hotel PC in downstairs lounge and print your tickets on their printer at the front desk. I did it and it was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: BearSensei327
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the service of this hotel. Our hotel room was clean and comfortable with air conditioning (though we didn't need it much). The hotel also has two computers for using the Internet, in addition to free Wi-Fi. The front desk staff are very helpful, friendly, and willing to go the extra mile to make sure your stay is comfortable. There's a nice lounge area in the lobby where you can just relax after a long day of sightseeing as well. What I liked best is that the Inntel is in an excellent location in the heart of Amsterdam: a) literally a 5-minute walk to Centraal Station b) walking distance away from the major tourist sites (shopping, museums, Red Light District) c) in close proximity to restaurants and other services My one negative comment about the hotel is the cleaning person knocked on our door way too early to want to clean our room (at around 9:00, when checkout is 12:00). When I return to Amsterdam for another vacation, I will be definitely staying at the Inntel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an overpriced marked”
Reviews.Author: fcbenni
Reviews.Content: The Inntel Amsterdam is located only 5 walking minutes from the central train station that over direct connection to the airport and other cities in Holland. The hotel has multiple different rooms where es the business executive rooms are much nicer than the standard rooms. However overall the hotel can not keep the same standard the big 4/5 star chaines like Sheraton or Hilton. The Internet connection is very slow although it is free but the prices of the Inntel are fair compared to hotels from the known brands, which are just too high for a city like Amsterdam. The hotel also offers free newspaper if you book a business room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.. centrally placed!”
Reviews.Author: Bexxy1976
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam and a birthday treat from the other half so i wasnt paying!! (Always a bonus!!) :-) We wrongly took the long way round to find the hotel (its actually very simple once you know!) but its very handily placed for both the train station (which we arrived via - 5- 10 minute walk) ) & town centre with all its shops, restuarants and pubs! Hotel was a joy to stay in. Front desk very helpful and staff serving drinks also very good and not afriad to smile!! It was very cold when we stayed in Amsterdam and the hotel was always toasty warm and made even cosier by the roaring fire in the reception/ drinks area. Rooms were a very generous size, as were the beds!! Free wifi always a bonus and i did always make sure i grabbed a handful of the very tasty free boiled sweets off reception!! (Fruit is also available!) The location of this place is fabulous... Walking distance to anything you could possibly want - food (you MUST try out Humphreys Restaurant which is next door - Truly fantastic venue and food) , drink or sights! To look at the hotel from the front - you wouldnt think it would be so spacious inside... and the fact you are on top of everything is NOT a problem whatsoever as far as any noise goes - you just dont hear a thing!! As mentioned, this was a treat from my other half and knowing what he paid, its probably a bit out of my own price range ... BUT, it was certainly worth the money and if he wants to treat me again, id be there in a shot!! 9/10, thanks very much!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Great”
Reviews.Author: TonySI
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, and I can be very critical when it comes to accomodations. I had an executive room and it was great. Exceptionaly clean, near eveything , the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. My friend had a standard room and it was just as nice. I wouldnt stay anywhere else next time I visit Amsterdam. The staff was great ( except for one woman at the desk at checkout, but we all have our bad days). Free fast wireless internet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dawn_sorcerer
Reviews.Content: Well worth a visit. Hotel was clean and staff very helpful. Would agree with another reviewer though, beds need to be harder. Location was first class.

Reviews.Title: “I got ripped off”
Reviews.Author: gwailoah
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotel.nl, credit card got charged on the date. Inntel couldn't find my online reservation, made a new one using the same hotel.nl reservation number, got charged again!! Three attempts to contact the hotel (fax, email, hotel customer feedback) gets negative response. Hugely annoyed. No one has the decency to respond to my complaint. Am half glad that Holland lost the world cup final. Strongly advise against using hotel.nl to book at this hotel. Wish I could give negative stars to bring the rating down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janice_xxx
Reviews.Content: It's all about location, location, location! Wherever we went, it only seemed to take 5 to 10 mins to walk there. There's a bike hire place next door, eating places and bars on the street outside (yet still quiet inside the hotel) and one of the main shopping streets was less than a 2 minute walk away - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trvllife1
Reviews.Content: Been to Amsterdam several times and I found this property to be very affordable compared to other hotels in the area. Rooms were very clean and hotel is in a great central location. Close to train station and city center. Rooms were above average in size for a European hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here multiple times and will stay again. Everything very good, clean, and friendly. As an added bonus they have low price for the breakfast.Very helpful staff with particular reference to the recption staff who assisted greatly with planning of city tours and canal trips.great free WIFI 24 hrs!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel08_9
Reviews.Content: picked this off expedia after reading other recent good reviews.very pleased.short walk straight up from station,lovely little square outside to sit out in with a beer or coffee after walking all day.some great restaurents bars there two.recommend the little italien about 4 doors down and the dutch restaurent, Humphreys i think, next door.very good value and lovely food.short walk from red light,main shopping area,dam square.trams stop two minutes away to take you up to Rembrandts square and lively spots.very modern interior,think its just been renovated.rooms clean modern everything you need.would stay here again without doubt. excellent.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: CLAUDIU_PATRASCU
Reviews.Content: It is ok for a 4*,good location,near city centre,very well equiped(business room),many restaurants and shops around!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very good location, but a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: GroningenCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a very good location - close to everything. Rooms seemed nicely renovated, but to my best knowledge did not match a 4 star standard in both cases (1 of the room was to compact to my like). Some noise from outside during the evening, but not to bad. Confusing to find the rooms - guidance (I would have put it on a piece of paper) could have been better. Breakfast was ok. In total to expense compared to what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharging ruined my stay.”
Reviews.Author: CPK10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very centrally located not far from the main train station. Rooms are clean and comfortable but not on a par with the room rate. However my experience at this hotel was spoiled by firstly being charged for breakfast I did not have on my final bill and secondly an additional â‚¬60 being charged to my credit card after I left. The hotel did credit the cost of the breakfast to my credit card when I queried this but I am still awaiting confirmation from the hotel that they will refund the additional amount of â‚¬60 to my card. Disappointingly the hotel tried to pass off a completely different invoice as my final bill from the invoice I received when checking out.
