Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EJ_LIC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Centre for 3 nights. The location is extremely convenient - just a skip away from so many tram lines that can take you to most places in the city. The room had a bit of a cruise ship cabin feel to it, because of its small size, especially the bathroom. However, when I got to Paris afterwards, I realized that our room in Amsterdam was a decent size. We enjoyed our stay very much and if we should ever return to Amsterdam, we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, rude staff, no flexibility, poor service”
Reviews.Author: melchior07
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam to attend a conference. BUCHEN.NL recommended the hotel. I had to cancel one night, did it within the required 24 hours. Buchen.nl did not communicate the cancellation, and although I had the proof of it with me, Inntel has charged me full accomodation. They were also very rude to me and would not give me access to management. Moreover the staff was also very rude in general, taking elevator with a hoover and not leaving priority to the guests, not being able to give you any recommendation for dinner (portier). for a business, not up to the level, for leisure certainly fine.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kipellen51
Reviews.Content: We were at the Inntel Hotel Centre five nights in an executive king (which was small, but supposedly bigger than the standard or superior double/twin) and found the room comfortable, if not luxurious. We paid an average of $215 a night. The walls were white with one greenish-blue wall behind the bed and the bedding was a plain white duvet over a thick down comforter. The curtains were a rubberized blackout material with a blue/green print. There was one picture on the wall. We were at the front of the hotel so there was some street noise but because the windows are double-paned, it was not a problem. The newly-renovated bathroom was perfect for one, tight for two, with tile flooring, a tub and a partial-glass-door on it that did little to keep the shower from splashing the entire bathroom. We had a big Grohe rainshower but because there was virtually no water pressure, it was tough to shower and even more difficult to wash hair. I ended up attaching the hand shower and using that. The door could not open all the way into the bathroom because it bumped against the tub. Small vials of shampoo, shower gel and lotion were provided, apparently not the case in all the rooms. Hardly worth the extra expense, though. We did like having the bigger bed instead of two twins.... We did not have the breakfast buffet because there were so many cafes and restaurants nearby that were much less expensive. There's a wonderful coffee place on the corner called Coffee Connection run by Dave who is a true coffee fan. His espressos are to die for and the cappuccinos (with hearts or leaves in the foam) are made with half and half and are bigger than standard cappuccinos and truly delightful. He also makes great paninis and "tostis" which are great for breakfast. The staff at the hotel were all friendly and helpful and really good English-speakers and were always willing to help with directions and suggestions. They provided a reasonable map, but you need a much better one (buy at the train station or a bookstore) that has the names of many more streets so that getting lost is not a problem. The biggest issue we had is that it was warm (about 80degrees) and the air conditioning even set at its coldest could not keep the room comfortably cool. With the heavy duvet/comforter, we absolutely were too hot at night. We asked for a lightweight blanket but all they could provide was a sheet. It has become clear to me that most of the hotels we stayed at had the same problem with a/c. Maybe it's too expensive to calibrate so that the people in each room can actually determine their own comfortable temperature? No matter where we were, we couldn't get the temps below 21 degrees centigrade, really too hot at night. And, in most places, the windows didn't open. In this hotel, because we were on the street, we didn't want to open the window because there was too much noise from the hotels and bars just below. Next time I'd prefer a hotel with a little more personality, but the location of this one was absolutely fantastic- right on a tram line and close to everything, including a five minute walk to the train station. Transportation in Amsterdam is a breeze and walking is easy to everything. Wi Fi was included at no extra charge but the connection was not speedy. They also had two computers in the lobby that were available free to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: Em1701
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 3day break, cant really fault the hotel, great location and very clean. Didnt eat here and only issue we had was some tv channelsdidnt work and they didnt actually care but we went there to watch TV so didnt matter! Couldnt fault it really

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and very central a great base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: TJBrooke
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at Inntel which is in a very central location. We were driving up from Brussels so wanted somewhere with car parking. The hotel offers discounted rates at the nearby underground car park which was very clean and secure. Be careful with car parking as it is very expensive - 48 hours cost us â‚¬75. The hotel was a great base to explore Amsterdam. Very helpful staff who can give you all the information and directions you require including a great city map and they speak fantastic English. The room was comfortable, clean and the bed was large. The bathroom had everything you need but was a little small. The room had a safe and a range of snacks and drinks Breakfast seemed a little expensive so we ate out one morning and in the hotel the next. I'd suggest eating in the hotel as the range of food is extensive and you can even have champagne (nice). The hotel is in easy walking distance of all the major attractions including Ann Franks house, The Red Light District, The River taxi (a must), and the main shopping streets. Very close to the entrance to the hotel is a bike hire shop which may be something you would like to try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Beds and Location”
Reviews.Author: TwoGuysCalgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only minutes from the cetral train station and right in the middle of the great city of Amsterdam. The staff were adequate and some what helpful. The room was a goo size and very claen and modern. The bed was one of the best in Europe and linens great.. Breakfast was an extra charge too much for what you were getting (20 euro). So a bit pricey for what you were getting but overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for the price”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2010
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel for the price although location was excellent. Had to switch rooms after the first night as was facing the front of the hotel and the noise from the bar next door kept us up till 2am. Upgraded to an executive room which was so tiny 2 of us had trouble being there at the same time. Bathroom was very small and basic, small closet with 6 hangers! Had to live out of my suitcase as there also were no drawers. Breakfast room was nice with a good selection. Next time I would check out other hotels for the price, as it is just a basic hotel for a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and quiet enough”
Reviews.Author: DuckIsland
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Amsterdam and just a short walk to several attractions and shopping street. Room standard quite allright. Clean and comfortable rooms. The WLAN connection in the hotel is quite slow... but it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good location”
Reviews.Author: emmarole
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1pm and only 1 of our rooms was ready â€“ no problem as check in was not supposed to be until 3pm. Good display of leaflets about the area. Room was clean and airy, we had a court view which made it nice and quiet in the evening. Lovely shower and ample toiletries. Very welcome tea tray in room after a hard days sightseeing. Get the hot chocolate sachets from breakfast they are delicious. Breakfast was 15 Euros but the choice was good and it sets you up for the day enabling you to save money on lunch! Did have a problem with one of the room keys which was a bit annoying but soon sorted out. Bar was ample and the staff courteous. All in all a good price for a room in the centre of the city. On the excursion front â€“ Anne Frank House â€“ can't say enough about it, the Westerkerk next door has an amazing tower that lets you see over 30kms out past Amsterdam. Did a 4 hour bike ride thanks to Petra at Mikes Bikes Tours â€“ even in the cold and rain she made it fun! Also did a dinner cruise â€“ food was good and plentiful. I Loved Amsterdam and would recommend a long weekend but remember your rain coat, they have an average 200 days of rain per year.

Reviews.Title: “Fully functional hotel, well located in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandCreature
Reviews.Content: The room was fully functional and not too small. Plenty of closet space. Good Internet access included in the room price. Close to Centraal Station; the tram to museums stops right outside. Breakfast was okay but nothing special -- buffet range and quality at the standard for this kind of hotel, but 15 euros is a bit high. Street noise (even on fifth floor with the window closed) was annoying -- mostly loud revellers on the square outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: I missed my connection to Berlin and had to stay a night in Amsterdam. Looking at the prices on the fly, Golden Tulip Amsterdam Centre had a lower price for that night than most hotels in Amsterdam so I went ahead with it. The location was just fabulous, a 5 minute walk from Amsterdam-Centraal station and with a lot of restaurants, bars and coffee shops around. The Red Light District and the Dam square are just across the street. The staff were very friendly and the room I was given was quite ok I guess. The bed was very comfortable and the toilet so clean. Overall, the hotel is very good and would book there again for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “not so beautiful”
Reviews.Author: RobertoChi
Reviews.Content: Not excellent; good position to visit the Amsterdam city centre; room was small and the toilette not comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - close to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: RSWTravels
Reviews.Content: We were desperately looking for a hotel as we were stranded in Amsterdam due to the Iceland Volcano. We found this hotel on Hotels.ca and booked it! The hotel was absolutely wonderful. We even got upgraded as it was our honeymoon. The room was amazing with a lot of character - attic style room, with exposed beams overlooking the main square and the betty boop restaurant. The staff were incredibly helpful, friendly and pleasant. The hotel also offered free internet which was a bonus. The location of this hotel was the best part - close to everything, including main shopping areas, dam square, anne frank house, etc and also very close to Centraal Station. There are many restaurants available near by, coffee shops and incredible cafes! We would definitely recommend this hotel and would return to this location if we visit amsterdam again! The hotel was a true Gem in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Clean, comfortable, friendly and courteous front desk staff. Breakfast good value compared to others”
Reviews.Author: XsunshineX
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Very comfortable bed. Clean bathroom. Good breakfast. Front desk staff have good English and are friendly and courteous. Excellent location as near Dam Square. Ask for restaurant recommendations as we made a few bad choices. Avoid mini bar in room as expensive. Just remember to buy water, drink and chocolate bars yourself. Buy cheese in supermarket instead of speciality cheese shop as cheaper and kept cooler. Could thoroughly recommend this hotel although look for Inntel not Golden tulip as was hard to find

Reviews.Title: “Could be anywhere in the world really”
Reviews.Author: FOONK
Reviews.Content: My trip here did not get off to a great start, as there was a problem with the reservations......no fault of ours I hasten to add. We were kept waiting for an hour and not offered anything in the way of even a drink. I ended up two floors above my friend. She got a plush new room, and I didn't! This hotel has one of my my biggest bugbears in that the windows only open about 3cm! I can understand that some people may wish to jump out of an open window, I'm just not one of them; I like to open the window! The breakfast is excellent as is the breakfast room which is light and airy. The internet was unavailable for much of our stay, and slow when it was available. Checking out was a chore and took too long, I think they need more staff at reception. The facilities here are very good, and it's clean and spacious. It is overpriced though, and could be anywhere in the world. I think it's more suited to business people than to holidaymakers. On my subsequent visits to the Dam, I have stayed at a 2* hotel and received fantastic service for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHNearBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We stopped here in late Dec 2009. We've stopped in many hotels in Amsterdam, but this was the first time in this hotel. For us, the location was great. It's a short walk from the main Central Station, great for the main shopping area, Dam Square, and close to the bars we wanted to visit (Cuckoos Nest & bars on Warmoesstraat). Our room was respectable, quite modern, clean, though we were rationed to one little guest size bottle of shower gel per day, so we ended up asking fro some from the maid. But other than that it was fine. Our room faced the back and so although it meant there was no view other than to rooms ontheother side of the hotel, at least it meant it was quiet. Breakfast was adequate, but we felt over priced for what it was, but as it was included in our room rate we ate there each day and whilst the choice wasn't spectacular it was ok. The staff were very slow to clear away after guests had left though which meant that for some arriving later, although there were many empty tables, most were still strewn with the previous people's dirty dishes & leftovers. I'd definitely stop here again if the room rate was right. We've looked at this hotel before and it seemed rather pricey, but this time around (for us) it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: MattMurray86
Reviews.Content: great hotel, only thing wrong was the front desk staff was abit stuck up but apart front that the rooms was great

Reviews.Title: “Good location, slightly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: T_Belgique
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Amsterdam Centre has a very good location, the city center is around the corner! Check-in was fast, but unpersonal. Room was OK: good beds, small flat-screen tv, bathroom with rain-shower head. Guest supplies were of a bad quality! Better take your own! Extensive breakfast, with sparkling wine. In general, I would say that this hotel is excellent for a hassle-free stay, but don't expect anything special. It is slightly expensive, but so are most of the hotels in Amsterdam. Make sure you park your car somewhere else, parking was 70 euros for 1 night!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mandy043
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location , staff helpful and friendly and adequate for a few days city break. Upgraded to business room which was clean although lacking in cupboard space! On 3rd morning of stay we were woken up at 7.30 a.m. with banging & drilling which apparently had nothing to do with hotel and was underneath at the shopping centre. When we complained the manager knew which room we were in , knew about the drilling and said at weekends they have to use all their room allocation, whereas during week they can allocate rooms the other side of hotel when not as busy! So much for the upgrade! We said it was most unfair to place guests in rooms where they knew works were being carried out. We should have been told. Offered free breakfast the next morning which was poor. Glad we never booked a breakfast deal as cheaper & better outside hotel. Lots of good shops, cafes and bars nearby and within walking distance of many places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stay but No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: franz85
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night before we embarked on our cruise. It was a quick stay but we enjoyed it nonetheless. Our room was rather small, however it was clean and comfortable. The staff were super friendly and were able to offer us some restaurant suggestions. We also booked our canal cruise through the hotel. I would recommend this as it will save you a few euros. They were also accommodating in holding our luggage for us after we had checked out so that we could do some sight seeing and organized a taxi for us to the port. Location is great as well - you can walk to many of the "must see' attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Tripomid
Reviews.Content: Forgot this hotel, the room was small, cold, dusty The pictures you can see from hotel is not real staffs was not helpful

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but odd layout with bridge makes a quick exit hard!”
Reviews.Author: EZ_Voyager
Reviews.Content: I was only here for a very short time- a late arrival on the train into Amsterdam Centraal Station, and an early morning meeting in the city. For me the walk over a bridge to get to my room made it a little less convenient than I would have liked- I had to take a lift from the lobby to the walkway, cross the bridge, then take another lift to my floor. If you're in a hurry like I was, perhaps not the best choice. The room was nice enough, clean and comfortable- had a 'woody' theme which made it more 'homey' than a typical corporate hotel, so that was nice, but the room was tight in dimensions. I chose this hotel for price and convenience for business, but if I was going back to Amsterdam on holiday, I would look for somewhere with more local charm.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellingYork
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip and this time wanted somewhere central. We wouldn't think of going anywhere else now. Staff were really friendly and let us check in early. Rooms were spotless and warm - had such a great sleep - so quiet considering its location. Great beer house two doors down and reasonable pizza next door. Breakfast was excellent - even had the option of champagne! Reception had a lovely open fire and the Christmas decorations were just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean comfortable, perfect location - what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: lucyjm
Reviews.Content: I searched for a long time to try and find a relatively spacious and comfortable hotel room in central Amsterdam that didn't cost the earth and from which we could enjoy some time relaxing in in between trips out sightseeing. I would definitely recommend the Golden Tulip in Amsterdam Centre. For a start, its proximity to the train station made our cheap transfer from the airport super easy. We found the hotel really easily (just cross the bridge to the right of the station, cross the tram lines and keep walking, the hotel is on a pedestrian area on the left, second building in, the building on the corner is a glassy structure). The staff were courteous and helpful and room was warm, clean and had everything we need. Of course, this is a chain hotel, there is no 'experience' staying here, no dutch touches which make it memorable or amazing views, but after pounding the cobblestones in snow and sub zero temperatures we found it a pleasant room to relax in, very cosy and warm so we thawed out well! The fact that we could also make a cup of tea in our room was a definite plus and the free WiFI was great and very fast. We didn't eat in the breakfast restaurant or drink in the bar - there are a multitude of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby so why bother? I can also recommend the restaurant directly next door that do a set three course meal for 22.50 euros per head. Delicious food. All in all a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, modern, clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: kel1042
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walk to central station, great location by either foot or bike. Bicycle hire shop on corner. The room was lovely, clean and tidy with lots of space, good selection of toiletries, the kettle in room was a bonus, something you dont normally get! Ice machines on each level, staff very friemdly and helpful, they even printed our boarding cards free of charge which saved us looking for an internet cafe. Definately stay there again. As we left early in the morning we didn't have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is central, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: roundtiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for one night while in Amsterdam with my wife. The hotel is pretty central to all major attractions and within easy walking distance of Centraal Station. The beds are very comfortable however but any bed would have been comfortable after the flight. I would stay here again the only thing that would have made it better would have been a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterLG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Tulip for six days and had a great experience. I thought my room was good when I arrived but I ended up appreciating it more after I spent some time in it. It was a really comfortable room with a great king size bed, cute lamps, comfortable chair, nice bathroom with rain shower. The hotel is also in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - but some snags”
Reviews.Author: London Frequent Traveller
Reviews.Content: This large business/lesiure hotel is conveniently situated in the centre of Amsterdam, 5 minutes' walk from the Central Station. It is also located on a pedestrianised side street which makes it quiet (and most rooms are in the interior). The ground floor lounge/bar is adequate in size (but maybe not at peak season) and there is free internet (which however gave us some access problems). The rooms are adequately sized but some have access complications (e.g. a step between the entrance/bathroom and the bedroom, which could be awkward for those with mobility problems; I had to change mine. Also, in winter they are not particularly warm and the thermostatic control seemed to be virtually ineffective. The breakfast buffet is good, with the option to squeeeze your own fresh orange juice. Overall I rate the hotel good-average.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aforma2
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms, bathroom was great, has a shower clothesline for those doing a bit of travel laundry. Easy walk from Amsterdam Central Station. Check in / out was easy and professional. Noticed other reviewers complained about the city tax, but this was spelled out in the booking terms for me through Hotels.nl. Wi-fi was free but quite slow (husband was trying to watch NFL football streaming online -no luck) perfectly adequate for email and web surfing though. Overall a pleasant place to stay, location is very convienent. A bit pricey, but in line with other European hotels with the same type of amenities. We did not purchase the breakfast, but in hindsight, it may be worth it if you like an early breakfast, nothing much open in walking distance in the morning (before 10).

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but this is NOT a 4-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VCUK
Reviews.Content: If this hotel had been classified as a 3-star hotel (with related prices, of course) I would have been happy. Cracking location (I'm serious, really spot on), 3 minute walk from the train station, 1 min walk from the main shopping street, 7min walk from the red light district. Max 10min tram ride (2.6 euro for an hour!!! and they say London has the most expensive transport system??) to the main Museums area. What more would you want from a location? Ah yes, close to good restaurants... well you can tick that box too (10mins walk). However, for the price paid for a double room (450 euro for 3 nights without breakfast and excludint he 5% city tax, and the exchange rate is not very favourable right now!), this hotel does not feel like a steal anymore. Room and bathroom, despite being clean, are cramped. If you think 4-star hotels you think of good spaces, huge fluffy towels, nice complimentary toiletries and good fitting throughout. Well, you won't find any of these here. Ladies, bring your own shampoo, conditioner and body lotion if you have sensitive skin - I had to go and buy some emergency ones in the shops after coming out of the shower with a dry wig instead of my usual hair. And if you normally need/want to blowdry your hair, don't be tempted to rely on the hotel's drier: it's an 800W one. Attached to the wall. Like in public swimming pools. (I rest my case). However, as I said, the location is fantastic and yes, I would come back here ona another trip to Amsterdam, because it's really convenient. Personally, if I had been advised about the shortcomings of the room, I still would have booked it - I just felt cheated because I was expecting a 4-star hotel and I found a 3-star one with 4-star prices.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: gerrard008
Reviews.Content: avoid this one at all costs,worst hotel ive ever stayed in,staff are absolutely horrible horrible people,cleaning staff burst in on top of you even if you have the do not disturb sign up,they tried to fine me â‚¬150 three times in 7 days for smoking,im a non smoker,my card wouldnt work for the lift,infront of 8 people the said i was smoking in my room and the duty manager wanted to talk to me,i checked out of the room at 6am as i was rushing for a flight and they charged â‚¬250 for the mini bar,i brought my own goods,didnt go near the minibar!!!!! and they were non responsive when i complained,rooms are over-rated and over priced,i tried to check out after 3 days and they wouldnt let me,said id made my booking through another company and they would be charging me the full amout regardless unless i checked out through my booking company.please for the love of god stay away from this horrid horrid place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: malhotra007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the staff is very friendly and nice. The staff at the lobby are knowledgeable and tell you all the directions. It takes only 5 minutes from Centraal Station and it is possible to drag your luggage to the hotel. It is also located 5 minutes from Dam Square and in the very heart of the shopping district. There is a Beer bar in the same lane that goes by the name Wild Man and it serves 200 different varieties of Beer including 18 on tap. Would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless, rude, and arguably fraudulent”
Reviews.Author: Nicoloo
Reviews.Content: It's soulless, corporate, and expensive. The staff are rude and unhelpful. And whilst I was quoted 500 Euros for a three-night stay, the charge on my card was 700. Avoid. Like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice we've made!”
Reviews.Author: triptimeCG
Reviews.Content: We had a different hotel booked at first and I am so glad we changed our minds and picked the Golden Tulip! It's in the perfect location. There are tables and chairs and restaurants, coffee shops, cafe's and bars with in steps of the front door. It is located in an area where no cars are allowed just in front and it is very peaceful small plaza yet many still in where the action is. Great security at night, even tho the neighborhood is wonderful! We are still here and we are loving the hotel and Amsterdam! Don't miss staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: worn2000
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! It's tucked away from the main street (Damrak) so it's very quiet. It's very close to shops, restaurants, bars and coffee shops, as well as the Red Light District. There's also a bicycle rent shop (Yellow Bike) beside it - which I recommend. It's great to explore the city cycling. For a discounted fee, you can also access Fitness First gym beside the hotel (which I did). It was raining one day so I decided to use the gym. It's well equipped! The room has a good size.. nothing fancy. Quite clean and very quiet. There's free wi-fi in the hotel lobby. There's also 2 internet kiosks, but a bit slow. Definitely recommend this hotel. A+

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: tingtongAU
Reviews.Content: The location is 5 mins walk from central station - cafes, restaurants (Mexican etc) a few steps away - if your looking for a great coffee shop the "Betty Boo" shop is run/owned by a few really fab guys - very chilled out and relaxed. Hotel was so good - not huge rooms but generally the accommodation in Amsterdam is of a different standard then other places in Europe! Awesome modern bathroom and tea/coffe/jug in room - really decent hotel. We will be back and its worth the $$ for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be your first choice”
Reviews.Author: ams-ibz
Reviews.Content: This one is "OK" if you're in a hurry and not with company. You will be disappointed if you don't' get an executive room or better. The rooms are cramped and all in all the place just has a dismal vibe about it. Simply not a comfortable place to stay...there is little to no light in the place, even the halls and lobby are dark. I've stayed here twice and both times the staff were not very appealing people (but then neither would I be if someone left me in a hole to work). It is clean and safe; I just wouldn't recommend it unless you can't find anything else in the area. Be sure to pay the extra for the exec room.

Reviews.Title: “HIghly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mjomcauli
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient and the staff were courteous. Our room, though small was tastefully decorated, in working order and spotless. We were provided with everything except an iron. I found it to be an excellent value for the money and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location !!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBoy'H'
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Golden Tulip and loved everything about it !! First of all, we arrived around 9.30am thinking that we would leave our cases and check in at 3pm. However, we were amazed to find that our room was ready for us - we have never had this happen before - first class !! The location of the hotel is prefect for the RLD/restaurants (5 mins walk) and trams stop just a few yards away - not a cheap hotel by any means but still good value for money. We got an Amsterdam All In One travel ticket for 22 euros from the tourist office at Sciphol Airport - this gave us return rail fare to Centraal Station plus unlimited tram/bus travel for 96 hours. Centraal Station is a short walk (10mins max) from the hotel. Amsterdam is expensive at the moment but we ate in Ghandi's Indian Restaurant on Damrak and it cost Â£29 which we felt was probably cheaper than a similar restaurant in the UK. We also ate in a couple of good chinese restaurants on Zeedijk. Nice break made all the better by a good quality hotel in a tremendous location !! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip Amsterdam Centre is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jashner
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week in Amsterdam and stayed at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Centre. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was immaculate, and the location was perfect for EVERYTHING! The rooms were not huge, but definitely adequate. The hotel is located on a pedetrian only street, but close to one of the main streets, where the tram is located. The location could not have been better! Close to everything, but quiet. I highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: Uz27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel a year ago. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of the city. Comfortable rooms and good service . Free WI-FI . In my opinion breakfast price is too high (~ 20 Euro )

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic breakfast, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: patte_noire
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel. The rooms are not huge but clean and comfy. The hotel has free wireless Internet and fantastic international buffet breakfasts. :) The location couldn't be better. Quiet but very close to all the excitement of the Wallen (Red Light District). The staff is very friendly and nice. Always available to help. The beds are very comfortable as well as the pillows. If I return to Amsterdam, I will stay again at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLa83
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Hotel is a great place to stay. Breakfast is a bit expensive (â‚¬ 15 - and we even got a discount!), but avoid the breakfast buffet and head outside for grabbing something to eat. Apart from this, the hotel is excellent. Great location, nice room, cheerful and friendly staff. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet in downtown Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MagnusNOR
Reviews.Content: Great service from day one. The room was nice and clean. Location is quiet, but only a few minutes walk from the Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the booking site-poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: onholidayAlaskan
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't look anything like the booking site photo's (booking.com).The room was dirty,the shower area corroded, the room security non-existent, and the behind the counter service extremely poor. Wouldn't suggest the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding customer service, great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: isis88Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: perfect location - very near central station and tram stops just one block away. very quiet, despite being in a bustling part of town. Free wifi, elevators, clean facilites, and an average sized room ( for Amsterdam)

Reviews.Title: “Fine experience - good location, nice staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tripdenver
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with our 2 night stay at the Golden Tulip in June 2009. The staff were helpful and friendly - the location top notch. We had a child traveling with us and I didn't consider this location to be too close to Red Light district, or seedy at all. The hotel price was fine, less than 200 euros for bed/breakfast and a dinner at Humphrey's next door which was a great restaurant. The rooms were fine and clean - everybody in our 9 person party was happy with Golden Tulip!

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to RLD w/o staying in it - no kids”
Reviews.Author: eh1777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for singles or young couples who want to be near the RLD without staying in it - but no good for families at all and others not into the Amsterdam nightlife could stay in other prettier parts of town. The room was adequate, although no view, and neighbors one night were noisy, and the art is obtrusive and weird. The staff was excellent however. I would stay here again, but this locale is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A little too close to the action”
Reviews.Author: ipushbuttons
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you can be a little too close to the center of activity. This was my first time to Amsterdam, so maybe I was a little shocked. But areas outside the city proper seemed more beautiful and relaxing. My room was very small, I guess normal by European standards. But certainly the smallest I had in my Europe travels. The area around the hotel was bustling with activity. Didn't seem like a great value. Although, I can't give any specific complaints on the hotel. There was free internet which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Forgettable”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with spouse in tow, and would not go back. There is nothing wrong with the hotel or its staff, but there was little to particularly commend it, either. It is ideally situated for the train station and Amsterdam nightlife. Perhaps even too ideally situated for the nightlife, as there are late-night snack bars literally around the corner and the area is littered with wrapping and other reminders of the past night when you go for an early-morning walk. Our room was fine, with a good bed and decent-size bathroom. The A/C was inefficient, and facing street-side, we were consequently woken up every morning by either the trams or the bottle collection. In fairness, we were offered another location at check-in, but even the receptionist was not certain whether that would be any quieter. Breakfast was of the buffet variety, but seriously overpriced and not worth it the mornings we had it. Be warned that, although there is parking facilities adjacent to the hotel, they are part of a public car park, and not accessible directly from the lobby. You will have to carry bags over the little square leading up to reception, and as it is a pedestrian street, there is no option of driving up and leaving bags that way. Overall, we had an ok stay, and if you are looking for a place to easily retreat to after a night on town, this is as good as any. For romance, ambiance, top-notch service with that extra little bit of something, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown Hotel, Close to Train Station, Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Easyas123
Reviews.Content: My wife was in Amsterdam for a business meeting so I tagged along to sightsee. Following an overnight flight from the U.S., the staff allowed us to check into our room early. We also received a free room upgrade. The staff was low key but pleasant, and offered helpful suggestions for restaurants and transportation. The room was a reasonable size and the kingsize bed was comfortable (always a plus when traveling). The window overlooked an alley, which was generally quiet. Did not eat in the restaurant (was told the breakfast was expensive) but several bakeries and small grocery stores are in the vicinity, which sufficed. The hotel is several blocks from the Red Light District, but "coffee" cars are a short walk from the front door of the hotel. Take the tram to the Rijksmuseum and/or Van Gogh Museum unless you are prepared for a long walk. Certain trams run directly to the museums from the hotel (ask the consierge for the appropriate numbers). All in all, a pleasant stay (despite a fair amount of rain). A tip for U.S. travelers -- Our best exchange rates came from ATM machines.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: chriskuo
Reviews.Content: We were using a EuRail pass during our 2-wwek trip around Europe and we found the proximity of this hotel to Amsterdam Centraal to be a great asset. We stayed in Amsterdam 4 nights but we took day trips while we were there. We saved a lot of time getting back and forth to the train station by staying here. The rooms were typically small but well maintained. The hotel seemed geared more to British trade rather than American, but we found the staff to be very helpful. There was no need to eat in the hotel because of the wide variety of restaurants and food stands in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: Fahrvergnuegte
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Amsterdam-Centre was not our first choice. We wanted to stay at a B&B, but finding a good, reasonable-priced room during the Easter holiday week seemed close to impossible. Everything was booked. Lucky we were able to capture this one. Although small in size and a view of another row of windows, we nevertheless were very pleased to be able to stay there for two nights. Clean, contemporary, in a quiet side-street, and convient location, location, location. The breakfast buffet looks yummy but way too expensive for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just five minutes walk from the central railway station. It is also 'slap bang' in the middle of Amsterdam making it an ideal base for your stay. The service from the staff was superb, everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was very good, recently decorated and quite modern looking, maybe it was a little small but very comfortable all the same.The bathroom was also good and a reasonable size as well. There was the regular towel change, beds made up etc, additionally a Kettle is supplied in the room. I didn't try the internet here. Didn't use the restaurant either probably because I felt that 20 euros for breakfast was not a good incentive! That was really the only thing I didn't like. I ate locally and there is plenty of choice or food in the vicintiy anyway. A local tram and bus service run from outside the door, they are very cheap, run regular and the staff are very helpful when it comes to finding your way around. I definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Amsterdam. My top tip would actually be to use the trains to get to and from Schipol airport for central Amsterdam, not the shuttle bus or taxi they are far more expensive. Trains run very regular and tickets are far cheaper, you wont be disappointed that you did trust me.

Reviews.Title: “best bargain”
Reviews.Author: bobococo
Reviews.Content: We had done a hotel booking from the web for a hotel in Amsterdam. Since it was our first visit we had no idea about the hotels in Amsterdam, once we reached the hotel booked by us it was a shock........ it was a terrible one with no security, we had no choice but to look for another hotel, we checked in a couple of them on the street and then to get the best rates for them we serached over the net, as the net rates are anyday better than the rack rates...... We got Golden tulip at 110 Euros per nite, trust me this is a steat during Dec...... the hotel was very cozy and comfy...... loved the good bed and the peaceful stay there ......

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CAPRICORNGAURAV
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL AS A GREAT LOCATION BUT THE ROOMS ARE SMALL AND OVERALL ITRS NOT AT ALL VALUE FOR MONEY... rooms are small, no great view, expensive place location right in the center and next to RED LIGHT District... good places aroung to have food

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very well located for travelling and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: hibjoy04
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and decided to book this hotel. It was quite centrally located for travelling around Amserdam. Staff were helpful. Did not find it noisy, in fact it was qite quiet even though there was a flood of noisy Scottish football fans. Drawback was the view from the room was not very exciting even though we were in the front of the building. I was expecting a much bigger room as we booked the executive suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ni_traveller74
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from Centraal station which is an easy 15 min train ride from Schipol airport. Beside Dam square, most of the shopping, red light district and bus station if you're going on a trip out of town. Still walkable in under 30 mins to Leidseplain and the Museum District. Large hotel - but despite being in a busy location, is really quiet as its built in a pedestrianised area. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and in good condition, tho small. Free wifi which works reallt well, and several computers in the bar area. Didnt have breakfast here. Go to La Place which is in the V+D store on Kalverstraat!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: wannagotravel
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, very affordable ($155.00 Can) well located hotel in a decent area of Amsterdam and very friendly service. A room typical of North American standards. Smaller, but not bad for European sized rooms. Very quiet at night. Good security - must use room keycard to access elevator. Walking distance to Centraal Station. We stayed for one night on a layover to Bruges in Belgium. No character like some of the other hotels on the canals in Amsterdam, which was fine for our purpose; just to sleep. Will stay again on future visits. Did not have breakfast here as we were having it on the train to Bruges. If staying longer we would most likely buy breakfast in one of the neighbourhood cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Tulip in Amsterdam City Centre for five nights in January 2009. The room was average size for a European hotel, but functionally arranged, and was quite comfortable. We arrived on a Sunday morning, around 9, and our room was ready. The location, the prime reason we picked this hotel, is excellent. Several trams stop directly out the door of the hotel, and Centraal Station and Dam Square are both within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Several restaurants and museums are also nearby. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast, but it is quite expensive and not included in the room rate (we only ate there 1 day, after discovering the cost). There are several small bakeries nearby, and most days we just went there for a quick bite on our way out for the day. The wireless internet is free(another reason we chose the hotel). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: deb500
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The location is excellent only 5 mins from Central Station and walking distance to Dam Square. There is also a tram stop right across the road. The rooms are cleaned daily with new towels, soap etc. The bed is very comfortable. We had no complaints and would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AMSTERDAM... What can I say?”
Reviews.Author: RafaF
Reviews.Content: If you want all the fun of Amsterdam but don't want to give up any ammeneties then stay at the Golden Tulip. Booked on Hotels.nl, it was very inexpensive compared to others in it's central location and equal class. This hotel was very nice and, by the look of the people at the breakfast room, frequented mostly by business travellers. Although it is a block or two from the Central train station (short 5 min walk), it is on a quiet street walking distance from everything fun. The only bad thing was the two single beds put together.

Reviews.Title: “Really creative use of space”
Reviews.Author: Observer79
Reviews.Content: This was a bit of a find. I booked a single room and the hotel must have had a recent refurbishment as the room was really nicely decorated. As a single room you have a shower cubicle but it's spacious and modern and super quick at chucking out the hot-water. Excellent service and well placed about midway between Centraal Station and Dam Square. Breakfast was good with wide selection of continental and cooked breakfast. Highly recommended/

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dub-SS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January for 4 nights, found my stay very pleasent, had no problems at all! Found it quite reasonably priced as our friends were staying in an upmarket hostel and paying the same! Lovely rooms, not too cramped as in Amsterdam rooms are normally tiny, great shower! The location is perfect, 5 minutes walk from both Central Station & Dam Square - perfect for what we wanted!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a good hotel second time around!”
Reviews.Author: johan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from the 12th until the 16th December 2008, and strangely we stayed here 6 years ago on the same dates as well. We said then that we would stay here again. The staff are very friendly and informative, the room was nice and warm, tea and coffee facilities, a stocked fridge, a comfortable big bed, and a good bathroom, the shower was powerful enough to clean the patio outside our house! Only one thing we had a problem with was the pay TV did not work to well on the first day, however it did work the next day. Nice open fire in the lounge downstairs. Wireless internet around the hotel. The breakfast was excellent as usual and you can eat as much as you want, which brings to mind whilst we were there there was this American man who put in a croissant in the toaster which is only meant to take sliced bread, and you guessed it, the croissant got stuck for a while, it appeared a minute later on fire and fell to the floor ..much to the amusement of the guest! Kinda the like the film Deep Impact were the meteor flies overhead with a long tail of fire behind it! To sum it all up we did enjoy our stay and probably will return again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharinalatina
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel. Housekeeping staff are very efficient and friendly. Except for this receptionist Elzira who checked us in at the reception. I memorize her name because she gave us the feeling that we are not welcome at all. When we approaches her at the lobby she showed us a very unfriendly cold look. And as if she does'nt really know what she's doing. Are all your front desk staff like her? Because if it is, it will scare away all your guest. She should take a training on how to treat the hotel guest with respect and proper manner.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Duzeler
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, comfortable, well-furnished and excellently located hotel. The rooms were extremely quiet and the free wireless service was terrific. Furnishings were immaculate and staff were extremely helpful. Booking through expedia, the rates were also very reasonable. We would stay here again and recommend to others. PS Unlike some hotels it was easy to open the windows and allow fresh air in at night. This is very important to us!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Golden Tulip - Inntel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CamsPig
Reviews.Content: Great location - within easy reach of Central Station, Dam Square and Damrak - with a tram stop right outside. Hotel was clean and everything worked. Beds were comfortable. Didn't have the breakfast as it wasn't included and was comparatively expensive but there were plenty of places nearby to grab breakfast. Was also within easy walking distance to the red Light District should you so desire. Amsterdam is a great city and I'd consider staying here again for a future visit

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jules52
Reviews.Content: We have just had 6 nights at the Golden Tulip and found it to be a great choice in Amsterdam. The location is fantastic - just near the station and an easy walk or tram ride to anywhere in the city. The hotel was clean, with comfortable beds and a good bathroom. As others have indicated, the rooms are small but most people don't spend too much time in their room anyway! Hotels in Amsterdam aren't cheap but this one is good value (except for the breakfast!) We found a great little "croissanterie" a few metres away that gave us a good breakfast for a fraction of the hotel's price! Free wireless internet is a bonus too. Would recommend the place!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandMisty
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel staff were very efficient and friendly. The room was spotless and adequately sized and the bathroom very nice. The hotel is in an excellent situation for sight seeing. This was a birthday present to me from my daughter and we could not have picked a better hotel to stay. My only slight criticism is the extortionate price of breakfast. Thank you for a lovely few days. Les - Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: Anaximander
Reviews.Content: Giving this hotel a rating of 2 out of 5 grieves me greatly. To describe it as "terrible" would have been somewhat unfair - but "Okay but some problems" doesn't adequately criticise the experience we had. This, incidentally, is the first ever occasion on which I've made what I consider a serious complaint about a hotel, certainly the first on which I felt moved to report my criticisms to others. Having booked at one price, we found ourselves charged another - and it's taking some time to manage the dispute. Without warning, 10 days after our departure, the hotel randomly added a figure of 300 euros to my Visa account. The rooms were barely larger than the average low-budget Ibis, while a plastic bottle that I noticed under the bed on the day we arrived remained there until (and presumably after) we checked out. Generally, the room was uninspiring - the bathroom was clean, though the towels could have been of better quality. The hotel is overpriced in general - standard rate for standard rooms (I'm sure our room couldn't have been graded any higher than that) being at over 140 euros - rising, we were told, to over 400 euros at times of peak demand (which I would consider the equivalent to highway robbery). The breakfast - though decent enough - certainly hadn't the variety and quality to justify its rather exorbitant price of over 16 euros. The staff were in general OK - but that is all that saved this hotel from receiving a rating of "terrible" after our experiences with them. In short, I won't be staying in this chain of hotels ever again under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Perfect! Stay Here...”
Reviews.Author: RoyalHome&Body
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, Staff Very Helpful, Everyone speaks english, Really close to the train station, Coffee shops, resturants, and the red light district. We were very pleased with this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Very good - just like before”
Reviews.Author: grumpytravel
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit of several days to the 'Tulip'. Clientele is a mix of tourists and business people. The hotel was full this trip but guests were quieter. Service and rooms very good, as always. Worth about what we paid - EU 160 per night. With two good experiences, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Now if the 'Tulip' would drop their buffet breakfast price just a bit .....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel central amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jess-B80
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Golden Tulip what a good little hotel, very central to Amsterdam and provide easy access to all the sights of amsterdam. Within a 10 minute walk of amsterdam central station. The rooms are compact, providing every comfort needed and the beds are exceptionally comfy. The hotel staff are friendly providing as much help as needed. There is also a very good restuarant left to the main entrance of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy and far from AMS airport”
Reviews.Author: pauloregon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip. Basically an ok hotel just a short walk from the coffeeshops and red light district if that is what you are looking for. NOTE: Also a good location for exlporing the other parts of Amsterdam. (There is more to the city than just RLD) The taxi from AMS to the hotel was 50 euro or more if there was traffic. The dance club next door keep my room booming with bass one night until after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: twizzleLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and found the hotel very comfortable, the room was big and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic, lots of choice from a full english to toast or fruit too much to mention. There was a mix up with the rooms when we first arrived which was a bit worrying, reception gave one of my colleagues a room key and he found luggage already in the room!! Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2 hotels in one”
Reviews.Author: noosasunshine
Reviews.Content: Be careful as this hotel has two sections,the original is quite good and is in the mall area , on our arrival we where put into the back part of the hotel annex .this area stings of age and ex smoking, this older hotel has just been added to their building by a walkway across a lane. If you are asked to take two lifts you are in this old hotel section. must admit with some presure we where transfered to the front section , the next 3 nights a lot more pleasant. location excellent ,cannot have it every whichway so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Christen_8
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory value for money. Nothing more, nothing less. Nicely located in the center. Small rooms, with even smaller bathrooms. Friendly service and ok prices gives a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rand415
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Golden Tulip from 8/19-8/22. We took a train from the airport to Central Station and the hotel was pretty easy to find from there. We walked with our suitcases, which was a challenge with all the people on the street and bike riders, but wasn't a bad walk overall - pretty much a straight shot to the hotel. Don't bother with taking a taxi, it's a quick trip. We checked in with no problem and when we got to the room, we thought it was nice. The rooms are small, but all European hotel rooms are pretty small so this one was average. The bed was comfortable and the room was kept clean so we were happy. The blowdryer was interesting and didn't work all that well so I kept my hair in a ponytail for the few days we stayed there! There was also a safe in the room, which was helpful. As with most of the reviews I've read on this hotel, we passed on the breakfast because it was expensive by comparison to some nearby restaurants and little cafes. The hotel was in a good location - close to the train station and also within walking distance from many sites (Dam Square, Red Light District, etc). One warning is that pick pockets run rampant through the Red Light District so be careful with your purses and wallets if you choose to roam through that area of town (which I recommend because it's just so unlike any place you can find in the U.S.). My boyfriend and I both wore those thin fanny packs that you wear under your clothes when walking around there. I didn't feel comfortable carrying a purse. Sounds dorky, but it made me feel a million times more comfortable. My favorite part of town was the area close to the Westerkirk and the Anne Frank House. We got lost one day roaming the streets in the area and were so happy to be lost because the streets on that side of the city seemed to be more residential and quiet. They were BEAUTIFUL to roam through. Always have a map on you though! Another recommendation is to check out Amsterdam's Smallest Gallery which is located on one side of the Westerkirk building. Really bright, funky paintings depicting the city of Amsterdam can be found here. My boyfriend and I purchased one to bring home and frame. We didn't want to buy any T-shirts or traditional touristy gifts for ourselves so we were pleased to have found this art gallery as a way to remember our fun trip. Amsterdam is typically known for it's craziness, but outside of all the Red Light District and coffee shop stuff, we found the city to be just beautiful. One last reco is that if you can take a boat ride through the canals, definitely do - was lots of fun!!

Reviews.Title: “The tale of the magical changing beds”
Reviews.Author: pengal
Reviews.Content: Popular hotel located in centre, close to station and Dam Square. Like most tourists, we didn't bother with the hotel breakfast as there was a plentiful supply of cheap coffee and croissants nearby. Hotel is spacious and very comfortable and offers reasonable value for money. We did have a few problems. Booked two double rooms for two nights and were given lovely rooms close to the lifts. All went well and we had a great nights sleep. We returned the next day to find the room made up as expected. Right? Well not quite... the staff had replaced our king size bed with two singles cunningly pushed together. After several incredulous calls, where the hotel staff blankly denied changing our beds at all, we were moved to an inferior room along the corridor. When we went to see our travelling companions to tell them we had changed rooms, we had to go through the same routine as their beds had magically changed during the day too. Hmmm. Amsterdam..

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Joyseekingbunny
Reviews.Content: This was a clean hotel with just enough ambience in the lobby to make it feel that you were staying in a quality place. We got a good deal so it was worth the money. The rooms were a bit small but the bed was very large and the bathroom nice and clean. We paid for a superior room but it was no different than the one our friends got for the regular price. I think it had a throw at the bottom of the bed and that was it. The double bed was really two singles pushed together. We didn't have breakfast but there is a choice of places to eat nearby and everything you might wish to see is within reasonable walking distance. If you are taking children beware of the TV as there are clips of hardcore porn if you scroll through the channels. It is Amsterdam after all, probably not the best place to take the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sleekjaney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely nice and we were relieved we were staying there compared to some of the other hotels we were considering. Just outside the front of the hotel are plenty of chairs and tables etc and you can purchase food & drink for nearby bars etc. The overall location was great as was just 5-10 mins walk (depending on how much luggage you have got) from the train station and only a few minutes walk to places such as Dam Square etc. Only a minute away you could catch a tram and pretty much go anywwhere so this was great too. The rooms were very clean and tidy and the staff were really friendly and helpful. The only drawback to the hotel is how much they try and charge for breakfast, 20â‚¬. Not a chance just go for a short walk and there are plenty of places to eat for more like 6â‚¬. Overall would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: split_second
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from a travel agent at the Amsterdam airport, as it was a spur of the moment vacation. Normally I check out trip advisor so I am a little more prepared, but didn't have that luxury this time. We walked to this hotel from the train station, which is about 5 minutes away, and upon arrival, we were completely shocked! The hotel lobby is beautiful... all marble, and the front desk was very nice and accomodating. They *upgraded* us to a business room for free, although I'm not sure how much of an upgrade it was. The room was really great, for a budget hotel in Europe. Really modern, flat screen tv and tastefully decorated. It was the only place we have stayed in Europe that had an iron in the room, which is a definate plus! We went out for dinner right beside the hotel, at a place called Humphrey's... and it was one of the best meals we had eaten on our vacation! The staff were all very friendly, and even though we slept in each day, the housekeeping staff was patient with us. The location of this hotel was great! Lots of great stores and cafes around, along with the square, and madame tussads right nearby. The red light district is about a 10 minute walk away. Overall, this hotel was great! Clean rooms, friendly staff, and an excellent location :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aces-n-8s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth the money. This hotel is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. The staff is very helpful and nice. The location of the hotel is by shopping, restaurants, transit, and close walk to just about everything. The rooms are very nice and clean and have everything you need including a safe. This hotel is great!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms (what can you expect?)”
Reviews.Author: RubyTuesday008
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location of this hotel is certainly prime. The walk to Central Station is about 5 minutes, tops. A quick walk down the nearby alley drops you right into an area with shops and restaurants, and Dam Square is no more than a 5-10 minute walk. I stayed there for a business trip, and was able to get an "Executive" room - or at least they assured me it was an Executive room. It was very, VERY small. Of course, this is to be expected in the heart of any European city, but it was so cramped that my husband couldn't walk from one end of the room to the other if I was at the desk (in fact, it was hard enough to squeeze by when someone wasn't at the desk). Our room was in the "other" tower (the hotel has bought the building next door), and it was well decorated and clean. The bathroom setup was odd (toilet flushing mechanism was strange and there was only half a shower door), but that is likely just a cultural difference. There was no view (only the windows of the apartments across the way) and the noisy church bells went off through the entire night, but the A/C and closed window kept the noise at bay. I stayed 4 nights and overall very much enjoyed my stay. I would recommend this to anyone who had the funds to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates, Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Scotts
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Golden Tulip because of the rates and a recommendation from a friend. It is directly in the city center, a 5 minute walk from the Bahnoff. The room was clean, and everything in working order. The air conditioner was rather loud and was in need of some service in 2203. That's the good. Now the bad: We opened our window and directly below it was trash that has not been cleaned off in sometime on an overhang. There was no view, except other windows of the hotel. Phone calls are by the 'impulse', which means the longer the call, the more you pay. Beware of 4AM, drunks stumbling into the hotel yelling and cursing. Evidentally walls are pretty thin because my husband heard someone come in upstairs, piss, flush and then throw up with another flush! If your looking for a hotel in the city center, and you just plan on going out and partying, this place may be good for you. If you wish to relax and take in the rest of Amsterdam, I would look elsewhere for lodgings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sas410
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Golden Tulip in Amsterdam. The location of this hotel is, in my opinion, its strongest point. It is very well situated within the center of it all. You can quickly walk to the hotel from the Central Station. There is a tram stop exactly round the corner from the hotel, making travelling to other areas a breeze. You can also easily walk to different areas. Our room was not very large, but was very comfortable and well appointed. Buffet breakfast was included within our rate, and it was very satisfying. Overall we had a great stay here and I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Amsterdam. Oh and as other reviewers suggested, do visit Humphrey's restaurant which is just next door to the hotel... it is yummy!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the Tulip”
Reviews.Author: gibbscr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two nights after a river cruise in late May. We found the staff most helpful and attentive. Plenty of great restaurants close by as well as tram stops and the central rail station. As others have pointed out, the breakfast at 20 euro is way to much for a typical buffet. There was no wait staff so you even had to find and pour your own coffee. The room was quite adequate and comfortable. A double in this hotel is a king in the US. Our room was facing the interior courtyard so noise was not a problem. Yes, we would recommend and return. P.S. Humphry's restaurant next door is excellent .

Reviews.Title: “clean but has no charm”
Reviews.Author: anonymousfromlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located near the train station if that is what you are looking for. The room was the smallest I have stayed in Amsterdam and I visit regularly. It is clean, has a new bathroom and good reception staff but there are quieter nicer hotels. I paid a good price for my stay but wouldnt chose it again

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Fritch
Reviews.Content: Easy to get on the tram system from this hotel. It was not bad. Room was a bit small and laid out funny. Staff often disappeared or were too busy socializing to help people. Breakfast could have used some variety and upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Tulip Is Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: Omsibuc
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Golden Tulip and found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful. I was there during Queen's Day, and the hotel was very quiet despite all of the festivities happening right outside the door. The room was quite large by Amsterdam's typical standards. There was a small refrigerator in the room and an ice machine located downstairs. The bathroom was nice, it had a large tub with shower and complimentary toiletries. Plenty of towels, too. You really can't beat the Golden Tulip's great location, the main part of Amsterdam is literally right at your doorstep. It's only a few minutes walk to Centraal Station from the hotel. I did not have breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of other low priced options in Amsterdam for those of us travelling on the weak American dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Louts Ruin Weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: GaySquinty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tulip for the May Bank Holiday weekend 2008. To say it was loud was an understatement -to be honest my husband found it tough to get 40 winks, and would frequently go for walks alone in an effort to become fatigued. The noise in the hotel was sufficiently bad for my husband such that a brisk 30 minute walk twice a day, alone, was the only way he could achieve sleep. Having arrived on Friday evening, we checked into the hotel and went for a drink locally. There was a large group of young men in the local London Bridge bar, shouting loudly and raucously with recourse to bad language. One young man vomited in the direction of our drinks, to the amusement of his colleagues, before repeating this activity 4 times before insulting the manageress with an Alex Ferguson jibe an quickly leaving. Another young man with long hair and tight trousers appeared asleep and wasresting his head on a full table which could easily have been used by others. He appeared to have been drugged. A heavy waft of marijuana emanated from another pasty young man who spoke with a heavy Dublin accent and whose eyes were rolling back in his head. He also vomited before ordering another hand rolled cigarette and leaving for a brief period. He returned roughly 15 minutes later, shouting loudly about being "ripped off" and menacingly shouting at my husband "the nookers should take their time". He proceeded to sit back down with the group and commenced rolling another cigarette. My husband and I were aghast to find that this group were also staying in our hotel, and when the room became heavy with the smell of marijuana, my husband again excused himself, saying he'd never get 40 winks if he stayed put. Just at that point an elderly man, similar in appearance to Peter Ebdon, flew past us in a wheelchair and a tuxedo. He was sweating considerably and had what looked like flour on his face. He was followed closely by a man who looked like Brian O Driscoll, the rugby footballer, who in turn was being followed by the police. He sprinted past the wheelchair bound Ebdon character before turning the chair around and free wheeling it towards police in an effort to put distance between him and them. We found out this was not in fact Brian O Driscoll but instead a young man who was attempting to smuggle certain items out of the country. All in all a group of louts ruined our weekend, and I won't be travelling back. My husband seems quite happy with the trip however, and is returning later in the month alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in a good location, had a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly had a pleasant stay at The Golden Tulip. Room was a decent size with a nice bathroom with all the amenities of a modern hotel. Internet was free of charge and had good connection. The room overall was very comfortable. Location was also excellent, and the staff were helpful. Main grouse: check in time here is quite late (3pm) and with the generally high occupancy, they are not very flexible with early check-ins. So those who arrive into Amsterdam in the early morning (like me, who arrived at 9am) will probably have to wait until at least 2.45pm. I thought this was rather slow and perhaps unaccommodating, since check out time is 12 noon. And I'm sure at least one room can be cleaned up within 90 minutes. Would've given this place one more point if the staff were less by the rule about something that is often practiced almost everywhere else. Would I recommend it though. Yes. Just book an afternoon flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a central location...”
Reviews.Author: dashadam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Tulip for 2 nights in April-08. The hotel was pretty good and overall my stay was enjoyable. Most reviews I've read on this hotel have emphasised how good the location is and I can echo this. You are in the centre of Amsterdam and its easy to get all the key areas of the city. There are plenty of shops and eateries next to the hotel and everything was very convenient to access. The central train station is about 500m up the road for example. There is a tram stop next to the hotel however I was able to walk everwhere... There were problems at check-in as my room had been handed out to someone else and the whole situation was handled extremely well by staff at reception. They gave me a drink voucher and took me to the lobby bar and had the issue resolved in a few minutes. I found the staff to consistently be extremely friendly and helpful- very good with directions and recommendations. I dont speak dutch and found everyone english to be excellent which made things very easy and smooth. My room was quite spacious with a comfortable modern feel, certainly by European standards the rooms are really large. Bathroom was a little smallish however as I was on the 5th floor I had a nice view of the city from my room. My bed was extremely comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job and I no problems in this area. Previous reviewers are right in indicating that housekeeping do seem to start early so I had a Do Not Disturb sign on my door to prevent problems. I picked up a pretty good deal and was pleased with my choice. I would certainly consider staying there again...

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LondonChris1975
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was close to the city centre but just enough out of it. The rooms were OK, the service was OK, the whole thing was really just OK, not one of the places that stays in your mind for any real reason. One bad point it was expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Margarita51
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend to see the flowers at Keukenhof. The hotel's best selling point is its central location. It is within walking distance of the Centraal station and the town centre. The downside is that you pay a lot for very average rooms and facilities. Our rooms were clean,but very small. Bathrooms have a hairdryer and toiletries. A kettle is provided. Breakfast is not good value for the price of 20 euros per person, but there are plenty of cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Where did the cleaner go?”
Reviews.Author: Joinke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, the reception looks nice, people at the reception are very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, the more you approach your room, the hotel seems to lose some stars and the cleaning personel seems to have forgotten what they're there for. We found something disgusting sticking on the wall and found next to the bed and two pairs of socks under the bed that were not ours, which only shows to me that nobody cleaned our room before we came. If you are keen on cleanliness, do not choose this hotel. I will try another hotel on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lizdunne
Reviews.Content: Have to say, the best thing about this hotel is its location. This was my third trip to Amsterdam and when I return I will always stay here. Its just so central to everything. There are lots of lovely restaurants and bars around it. Would highly recommend Gaucho's if you like steak!! Oh and do not leave Amsterdam without visiting Wok to Walk at least once, words cannot describe how yummy it is!! The hotel is bout 5-10 minute walk from everything. It was just perfect. A little on the expensive side but hey in Amsterdam you get what you pay for. Definately well worth it. Our room didn't include breakfast, but at E20 a pop, I wouldn't be bothered. There are so many restaurants near by. The room and bathroom were clean, with fresh towels everyday. I would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: yamana
Reviews.Content: As has been stated extensively, the hotel is very well situated in central Amsterdam. Check in was friendly, rooms were good size, well maintained and with a comfortable bed and it was a good experience, especially from a large hotel chain. Breakfast was OK, but not good value for â‚¬20 - this is why it not get 5* from us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring the city!”
Reviews.Author: Fiendish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. As other reviews say, the location couldn't be better. 5 minutes walk from the train station. Don't bother with taxis or trams as you can walk everywhere. Watch out for the bikes! They come at you from all angles-even when you think you are on the pavement! Standard room was very clean and comfortable. Bit more expensive than many hotels in the area but well worth it! There are some pretty rubbish looking hotels in the lower price range! Close to all the tourist attractions and bars and restaurants. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel-food-RLD-Drugs”
Reviews.Author: valuetrav
Reviews.Content: Our stay in amsterdam was excellent . The Golden Tulip Inntel hotel was good enough for me and my stag attendees. The staff were spot on,The room and bathroom were a bit small but didn't stay there too long anyways because after all your in amsterdam. A member of my group has an uncle living on the outskirts and visited the hotel.He believed we were very lucky to of stayed here because there is a lot of poor quality hotels in the area. The place was very clean and at the end of the day thats all you want. The area was very safe i didn't feel in danger during my stay but its a city and things do happen occasionally so stay safe and stick together. The food was excellent so i wouldn't get bogged down researching that front. Go with your instincts and where food is being churned out on a regular basis. The Redlight district was fine for a walk to see how the other half lives but it wasn't mine or the lads cup of tea.
