The second night we went to the banana bar and its a pure ripoff i wouldn't recommend it at all or any shows and packages of that nature.On the drugs front i actually was only asked once and was therefore not an issue with me.A kind No and move on was enough to give these boys the picture but in fairness have your wits about you if you do venture to that area.I would visit amsterdam again its a nice place and the people are very friendly and relaxed, I would avoid the RLD and stick to what an Irishman loves best having a few pints and heading to a club. The Hotel above will be my base if i decide to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dutchess08
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the hotel last week. The rooms are a decent size by Dutch standards and well priced. The location of the hotel is what drew me to stay there in the first place. It's an easy 5 min stroll from the Train Station along the Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal. The "Kolk" in which the hotel can be found is 150m from the main shopping district. The room, and more importantly the bathroom, was clean, albeit a small stain on the wall that the cleaning staff could have cleaned up after the previous occupant. Reception and Concierge staff were friendly and well informed about the city. I did find the staff at the Tourist Office more helpful with regard to tour information. The concierge and recption staff merely pointed you to brochures. They did, however, arrange for dinner reservations at a local Chinese Restaurant. Note that it is vital that you book a table at restaurants, even in winter. One disadvantage that I found was the excessive noise made by cleaning staff after 7.30am. If you are looking to sleep in, then forget it. They start vacuuming at 7.30 in the morning ! I suggest you bring earplugs if you want a lie-in. I did not have breakfast in the hotel restaurant, which looked lovely, as it's much cheaper and more enjoyable to wander the canals looking for a cafe. I found many only 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will return on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Less than 60 seconds away from The Wildeman Bar!!”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireEvil_Homer
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam several times before, this hotel is the best one we have stayed in. And when we go again, we won't be looking for any others!! The hotel is slap bang in the the centre, right near to Dam Square and only about 500m from Central Station. Check in was easy and pleasant and the room was very modern and absolutely spotless. Also had free wifi access. Breakfast is superb with hot and cold choices and really sets you up for the day. There are loads of bars, restaurants, cafes etc nearby. It really is the ideal location! If you're looking for a comfortable, clean, ideally located hotel in the centre of Amsterdam, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: dav_ss
Reviews.Content: Having just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam, I am pleased to say that the Tripadvisor members who advised me to stay at this hotel were completely right! The hotel is clean, modern, and in the perfect location - it's not the cheapest option, but you do get what you pay for - peace of mind that on reaching Amsterdam you won't find yourself staying in a dive located miles away from the various attractions. The Golden Tulip is just off of a main road, 5-10 minutes walk from Centraal Station, as well as all the other main sights.(On exiting the station, look for the Victoria Hotel on the corner of a parade of buildings, head for the other end of the parade, continue down that road, and the Golden Tulip is just on your left). I cant stress how pleased we were with the location - simply perfect. We had an Executive room, which probably isnt all that different from the standard ones, so on my next visit I may just settle for a normal room as I doubt I'll have any complaints. Our room was at the front of the hotel, but as The Golden Tulip is located on a small square just off of the main road, noise was not a problem at all. I found the hotel staff to be polite, and checking-in & checking-out were both prompt and hassle free. The hotel has numerous bars and restaurants literally on its doorstep - Wok To Walk is handy for a quick bite, and for a "proper" meal you have Humphrey's next door, or a steak place directly opposite. I also highly recommend the Betty Boop coffee shop 10 seconds across from the hotel - friendly, well-appointed, and so convenient that it's easy to spend way too much time "chilling" at the bar ....trust me, I know! ;-) (And make sure you try the special chocolate cake! The results are pretty interesting! lol) (Also, there is a small grocery store across the main road to the left of the hotel for any bits and pieces, and the Pancake Bakery isnt too far either - well worth a visit.) The complimentary wi-fi is also worth noting for those of you who travel with a laptop, and for those of you who dont, there are two computers for guest use in the bar area - very handy. All in all, I would definitly stay at The Golden Tulip again, and recommend you to do the same if you are considering it amongst others.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: terryulsterman
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated near Central Station and other attractions. Hotel is expensive but then again in Amsterdam you do get what you pay for !!! Rooms are air conditioned, clean and have a well appointed mini bar - check the prices before you try the goods. Staff are polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A real quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: LewisSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, you could not ask for better location! Breakfast was a feast and the hotel bar was modern and trendy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Avril S
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day stay at the Golden Tulip Inntel.We walked to the hotel from central station which only took about 5 mins.Our room was ready and that was fantastic as it was only 10am.Beautiful big clean room with everything you need in toiletries even shoeshine.The heating is ajustable and so is the air con.The breakfast was outstanding and catered for all tastes and if you fancy champagne for breakfast why not its there chilling.The bar is small but so cosy with a big log fire in the centre and comfortable sofas. The staff are so polite and helpful and always have a smile to share.Next door to hotel is Humphreys Restaurant. The food was out of this world and so much of it.very reasonable.Everything is within walking distance and very easy to find from hotel.Loved everything about this hotel and would highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's basic, but don't expect to be blown away”
Reviews.Author: garbage1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 3 nights and were ok with it, but had some problems here and there. Overall, its close to everything, has some cool businesses around it. The rooms were small but with most the basics. However, they weren't clean. We found hair all over the inside of the beds, urine in the toilet, and filthy, very filthy, bed spreads. When I found a maid in the hall to tell her, she just gave me some clean bedspreads. SO my friend and I were reduced to making out own beds after spending $200, not cool. Another problem was when we called to ask for some clean towels, 3 times and not getting any delivered. After the 4th call, they finally came. So its ok if theres nowhere else to stay, but I doubt we'll be going back on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for the center”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas C
Reviews.Content: In the first site your opinion is not very well but when you go to the room you change your mine. You are in the center and you can do anything, everything is near !!! Free wifi internet access. We came for new year holidays and was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: belle1284
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Tulip with my boyfriend at the end of our 5 week trip around Europe. After initially being a bit hesitant about going to Amsterdam after researching hotels I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel and our Amsterdam experience. The staff were really lovely and very helpful and the rooms were huge by European standards and were very modern and clean. Our room had a very comfortable king bed as well as some arm chairs and a desk. The bathroom was also really big, included a bath and was lovely and clean. This hotel is centrally located with just about everything being no more than a 10 minute walk away such as Central Station, Anne Frank's house, Museums and other attractions. There are some great places to eat literally right outside the hotel door as well as a couple of cafe's where you can have the "true Amsterdam experience" - I was worried at first but again I was pleasantly surprised as the area was very safe and clean. We wondered around most of the day and night and felt completely safe the whole time. I loved the Golden Tulip - it really topped off our European holiday, I cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smiley72
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend break to the Golden Tulip. We had a great time. The hotel was located in the centre of amsterdam just 5 minutes walk from Central Station, 10 minutes walk from Dam Centre. The hotel was very clean, the staff were very helpful. We would def recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: Lazen
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel many times and the service is faultless. very convenient for the Station and amin attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: TheCursedVagrant
Reviews.Content: Only a few minutes walk from the station and quite easy to find. Rooms a bit on the small size but quite comfortable. Beds were a bit narrow too. Location very good with plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Humphreys next door has excellent set menu at a reasonable price. Breakfast choice was excellent, even squeeze your own oranges for juice. If you only want a cheap and cheerful Full English instead, then go across the the road to The London Bridge. Nearby is Gaucho's if you fancy Mexican. Wildemans nearby has a great range of local beers. Betty Boops across the road is a small and friendly Coffee Shop. A slight overcharge on the bill when we checked out but this was rectified without a problem. All in all, a good central hotel although not at a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: kbtx328
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Everyone is very friendly, and excellent English is spoken. It is in a prime center location in the Old City Centre of Amsterdam. It is steps away from Dam Square & minutes away walking distance from Centraal Station. Breakfast is a little expensive but we didn't eat there. There are many restaurants around. Their room service menu was nothing to brag about but it got the job done late at night. Clean hotel, clean room, nice people, good location..what more can i say? Stayed there in November 2006 and staying there again next week when we go back. And again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Mushrooms and Cheese”
Reviews.Author: 2-Midlife-travellers
Reviews.Content: This was an unforgettable hotel for several reasons. The hotel is conveniently situated on a small square just off Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal close to Central station and most of the other sights of Amsterdam including Dam Sq., the Anne Frank House and of course, the Red Light District. We arrived at 9 pm and were greeted by very helpful friendly staff. Our room was well appointed and spacious. Although designated "twin" it held 2 queen-sized beds. The bathroom was large and spotless with large fluffy towels. As we had arrived late and were more tired than we'd expected, we decided to make a cuppa before next deciding what to do. I filled the kettle and switched it on and soon it was boiling over. "You've overfilled it", my better half said. I didn't think so but it WAS boiling over. Anyway, she drank her coffee, I my tea and as I got to the bottom I discovered what appeared to be a short fat piece of spaghetti. On closer inspection it turned out to be a magic mushroom (Columbian we later found out). Inside the kettle were about 2 dozen of the things which I guess the previous occupant had been brewing. I took the kettle down to the front desk and the staff were extremely apologetic and helpful (as they should be) and gave me suggestions if there should be any adverse effects and supplied a brand new kettle. I have to say, a little whistfully, there were no 'adverse' effects. Next morning we set out early and when we arrived back in our room around 10 am there was a wonderful letter of apology, deploring their fall in standards, a basket of fruit, a bottle of very good wine and a selection of cheeses. You know, I like Amsterdam, where else can you get magic mushrooms, wine, fruit and cheeses all for free LOL. That was the only slight hitch in the entire stay and to be honest, it makes a good after-dinner story. The hotel was superb, from the room to the bar area with its large open fire. Breakfast (included) was excellent. Next door to the hotel is an excellent retaurant, Humphreys, which I can highly recommend, a 3 course, splendid meal for less than â‚¬20 per person. We eat there frequently when in Amsterdam. I can thoroughly recommend the hotel, though, like most places in Amsterdam, it is now quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PammyandMarky
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Golden Tulip and couldnt fault it. Staff were extremely helpful, they recommended 2 lovely restaurants. Gauchos which is only 5 minutes away was excellent. The nicest steak I've ever had and probably the best service in a long time. The hotel itself was great, perfect location, walking distance to everything, Anne Franks house, Heineken Museum, Rembrant + Van Gogh Museum, Liedsplein, Rembrantplein... The Liedsplein was so nice at night time. The room was lovely, plenty room and the bed was huge! It was like 2 doubles pushed together. We didnt eat there because the breakfast was â‚¬16, a full Irish down the road in Durty Nellys was only â‚¬9, yummy! We loved Amsterdam and whenever we go back we'll stay in the Golden Tulip. Amsterdam is such a lovely city and the people are so nice, much nicer than people from other breaks we've been on. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Central and good”
Reviews.Author: Jurnee
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the train station (loaded down with luggage) I asked the cab driver to take me here but he wouldn't because he claimed "it wasn't worth his while - it's too close". That's true if you know where you're going but it took me 30 minutes to find the hotel. Considering its location between the train station and the red light district, it's one of the nicer places to stay in that area. PROS - There were lots of shops and restaurants in the neighborhood as well as good street car connections right in front of the hotel. The hotel has 2 free Internet terminals, flat screen TV, a big selection of bathroom amenities (shampoos, lotions, etc.), lots of hot water and a decent breakfast. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. CONS: Beds are very narrow and if you get too close to the edge of the mattress you slide right off.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: CroweS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. Superb! Couldn't fault it! Hotel was lovely, huge bed and most imporantly for myself, very clean! It was in the perfect location, central to everything. I certainly will be returning here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff3
Reviews.Content: Repeat visit. Good size room and bathroom. Kept clean. Great location. Not exactly a bargain, but.........

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: braceman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel on our recent trip to Amsterdam. I booked it through booking.com because you couldn't book the room through the hotel's web site. But it worked out OK. I've had problems in the past booking through third parties but this went fine. The hotel was very nice; we especially enjoyed relaxing in the lobby in the evening. They had a bar and two computers with free internet access. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. The mini bar allowed you to place your own drinks in it without thinking you were taking theirs. I hate those new mini bars with electronic sensors. The A/C worked fine and allowed you to leave the fan running all the time. It did make a loud click every time the compressor went on and off but my sound machine camouflaged it and the second night I didn't even notice it. The TV got a nice picture and had BBC. The hotel was close to everything except the museums, but the tram to the museums went right by the hotel. We didn't eat the expensive breakfast but instead walked across the street and bought fruit and pastries. When we got to Amsterdam we bought an IAmsterdam card at the airport, which is worth it. You get a canal tour, entrance to most museums (but not the Anne Frank house), and use of the trams. It comes in 24, 48, and 72 hour versions. My favorite museums were Amstelkring (a church in the top of an old house) and Rijksmuseum. The red light district made me a little nervous because of all the weed and prostitutes, but it is only a small part of a nice city. It reminded me of Bourbon Street in New Orleans. We took the train to Zaanse Schans to see the windmills one day, which was interesting, but we enjoyed the tour to Madurodam in The Hague better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: palmaaddict
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, some three hundred yards from Central Station and within walking distance of all the major attractions. We booked a business room, even though it was our honeymoon. The room was well equipped and spotless, as was the whole hotel. The staff were very welcoming and polite. We arrived well before our check-in time, but they took our bags from us, putting them in a secure room, so that we could go for a wander, without the burden of wheeling luggage round the streets. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone, be it for a business trip, holiday or honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMe123
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to complain about every little thing but I do expect to get what I paid for! This is no way a 4* quality hotel. The location is fantastic, can't fault it, just a short walk from the Damrak. The porter in recepetion is lovely really friendly and helpful. However: Reception staff were very rude, I was told when checking that there had been a mistake and we could have a smoking double room or wait and hour for a non smoking twin room (bearing in mind we arrived at 3pm). We waited, not impressed. The room was shabby, we fantastic :) view of a wall and a first class spot to look into other peoples rooms. Lovely! For some reason they wouldn't take our used towels away. First day we put them in the bath as ususal, still there when we came back, second day we left them by the door again still there. Not sure why!?! Rooms....hmmmmm well I know you can't expect a large room in a city centre hotel but it was tiny!!! Two beds and barely space to put our cases. On check out we were told we had broken a table. (It was broken when we arrived). Being as we were there to sight see and not to get drunk and trash a hotel room I was offended. I think they just tried to get a bit of extra money out of us. Oh well. In all, not that bad, few things that spoilt it, Id stay again if I really had to due to the great location but Id say try and find somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: 1moretime
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights, got special deal 120e a night on the Hotels.nl website 1 week before travel ( worth waiting for or changing already booked hotel, as long as there is no penalties for cancellation). Hotel in fantastic location 5 minutes from all major attractions in a quiet street just behind Damrak. The rooms are large, full bathroom with all facilities you need tea,coffee safe etc. Beds are very soft incase you like a hard bed The hotel staff were excellent and extremly helpful. Cleaning: Although the room/sheets/towels were all clean and ample tissues/tea/coffee etc. Wet foot towel was left in the bathroom from previous guests, also my partner dropped lighter under bed to find, old sweets/paper so clearly the cleaners are rushing to do change over and not checking standards. Also breakfast expensive, can get the same couple of doors away at much better cost so unless included i would not recommend. Also ice machines in corridors, which are great for drinks (if on budget buy your own and use fridge in room, hotel drinks very expensive). PLEASE NOTE: We were not told and there was nothing on website to advise, when arrival at hotel the credit/debit card is scanned to block payment for room which is exceptable, what is not explained is that they also block an extra Â£50 or equivelent in euro,s etc from card for any use of the minbar/snacks/damages etc in room, this is returned to your card 48 hours after check out which is fine as long as you are not travelling on a budget and need that money for your stay. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if i could get a late deal.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mycaseispacked
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, only a short walk from the central station and the Damark. The hotel is clean and tidy. We stayed in the third floor which is in a linked building over an alleyway. The lift takes you to the second floor and then you walk over the alley in a glazed corridor to another lift to take you to the remaining floors of the hotel. A bit querky, but no big deal. We had a large room which was clean and tidy, loads of space to relax - wardrobe (with safe), double bed, desk, arm chair and coffee table. the bathroom was spacious and clean. We ate breakfast in the hotel, despite being on a room only basis, and although it is a lot of additional money (about 15euro per head) the food is good and plentiful! The only issue when we stayed was that we were woken early on two days (sat and mon - sunday was ok though!) by construction work - drilling, banging etc... The receptionist could only apologise as this was in an adjacent building and outside the hotel's control. Our fellow travellers were staying on the second floor, not over the alleyway and in the building above reception, and they didn't hear a thing. Not sure how long the building work is scheduled for, but might be worth asking for a quiet room when you book for the next 12 months or so? The bar area is modern and contemporary with free internet access. Apart from the neighbouring construction noise - which again is not the hotels fault - our stay was good. the hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to almost everything and if not its a stones throw from a tram line which goes further afield. The breakfast was good, but if you can get a bed and breakfast deal then all the better. Overall, a clean and comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Get proper directions if you are driving”
Reviews.Author: spc1
Reviews.Content: Good reception staff, fluent in English. Great location, quiet room. Huge comfortable bed, and all of the other positive comments already posted. The only reason for this message is to warn drivers that they need proper directions to the de Kolk car park. We came from one direction, the only two signs we subsequently saw were for traffic coming the opposite direction. We drove around the block three times and ended up in the Amsterdam Central car park 3-400 yards away near the train station (no great problem). If you come by train then it's not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better!!”
Reviews.Author: mrhoppy22Manchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but is let down by a few things small rooms not enough towels. We booked a queen size and got 2 singles not even pushed together. The breakfast is good but expensive at 20e per person. On the whole the golden tulip is an average hotel in a good location but there are far better hotels in the same price range a bit further out of the centrum the walk would be worth it! The crowne plaza is a bit more expensive but worth the extra money or if you really like the swissotel is the best hotel in Amsterdam for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good quality and well located.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewsNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was only a short walk from the Central Station, but not on the noisy main road. The concierge took care of our luggage until our room was ready as we had arrived early in the day. We had a superior room on the 5th floor, non smoking as requested. The room was immaculate, with everything you expect such as a safe, coffee making facilities and a fridge. The bed was large and very comfortable.The bathroom looked almost new and had a great power shower, If I had to pick a fault I could say that the room was a little smaller than expected, and faced the inside, so I suggest requesting an outward facing room. We did not try the breakfast as â‚¬16.50 each seemed a bit steep, Instead we had a full English and coffee at the nearby Corner cafe, which cost â‚¬19 for two. It was very good, but for that you don't get any coffee refills,orange juice or fruit. The Hotel breakfast might be allright for a treat provided you eat everything including the advertised champagne!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danfleece
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from the central station but in a fairly quiet location just off the main streets. Our room was at the back so was very quiet (you could hardly hear a thing!) and was of standard quality for a city hotel with the usual in room amentities. we had a Standard room with a Kingsize bed, flatscreen TV with BBC1, BBC2 & BBC World to keep up to date (Sports available via pay tv). Bar decent (avoid getting spirits all over Amsterdam as they are very pricey 2 x JD & coke was 17 euro!) - but then there are bars all over the place so no need to buy in the hotel. Didn't try the breakfast as know a few places in town. Staff are helpful with good English. Rooms clean. Fantastic location. For the price I think you would struggle to get better in such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend it more!”
Reviews.Author: lau1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a short break. The hotel is fantastic, the rooms are big, clean, modern and very comfortable. We had a standard double ,which had a king size bed and also had flat screen satellite tv. The bathroom was spotless, with a good hairdyer and lots of complimentary toiletries. We'd never been to Amsterdam before and came from the airport on the train, the hotel is ideally placed just 5 minutes walk from the train station, very easy to find and well lit if you arrive at night as we did. Its in a great location if you want to see a bit of everything in Amsterdam, but its far enough away from all the stag and hen partys when you want to get a good nights sleep! There are great shops, bars and coffee shops all near by and the train and canal stations are a few minutes round the corner. Having read some of the other reviews, someone said the staff were very unfriendly, in our case, we found that to be totally untrue, all the staff we dealt with were helpful, polite and friendly. All in all, the perfect hotel for a short break away.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Zog666
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel several times and we both like it. I have also stayed there alone and felt very secure. It's location is second to none. A short walk from the central station but in a fairly quiet location. When one has had enough of the shopping, hedonism or tourist attractions, this place remains a quiet oasis. Rooms are standard quality for a city hotel with the usual in room amentities. A nice bar but no restaurant - but then with so many non-hotel restaurants within a few 100 metres, why would they bother? Never tried breakfast as there is much cheaper available in town. Staff are helpful. Rooms clean. Fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “i would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Janre
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights in july, we took the train from schipol airport and it was a short walk to the hotel. It was very clean and comfortable. We had the breakfast each morning, they gave us a coupon at the front desk and it was 16.50 each, we thought it was worth it, a very good selection. Amsterdam is a great city, hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gaffa
Reviews.Content: We travelled for a weekend of drinking and smoking and the hotel was excellently positioned, right in the heart of things. The beds were the most comfortable beds in the world! The hotel rooms were just top notch. Right outside the hotel you have loads of little restraunt and bars so you can sit in the little square. Just around the corner you have one of the grasshopper cafe (smoking) establishments. 3 mins from the train station. All good, would definately go back there. The only problem was the maids trying to get in on the morning, longest knock in the world, this can be avoided by putting your do not disturb out. Unlike us i would make sure this is the first thing you do if you dont want to be woke up first thing in the morning!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights for a work trip and found this place very comfortable. The room was small but had all the usual amenities; electronic safe, LCD TV, free wireless internet etc. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is decorated in a modern style, albeit quite small again. Breakfast is good quality but a little expensive at euro20 for a buffet. They also provide free Dutch newspapers and photocopied extracts from many international newspapers you can read at your table. The Humphreys restaurant next door offers good quality food (euro20 for the 3-course day menu) which can be charged back to your room. As other reviews have already stated, this hotel is only a few minutes walk from Centraal Station and just a short walk to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip Hotel Inntel Amsterdam Centre, 2nd visit and still fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ilovejimmychoo
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and once again it was fantastic. Hotel room was very clean, house keeping superb, all staff were very friendly and location as always was fantastic. This really is a great central hotel for shopping and sightseeing and nightlife. Yet it is in a very quiet location so sleep is never disturbed. My advice to anyone thinking of booking this hotel, do it as you wont be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Diana13
Reviews.Content: Incredible location, great hotel, nice rooms, VERY COMFORTABLE beds, can't go wrong with this place. Free internet downstairs in the lobby. Clean, contemporary and just what you need. Walking distance from where you'd like to be a night and from the main train station that takes you to and from the airport. (save money on a cab by walking or taking public transportation which stops right in front of the hotel) We very much enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to anyone coming.

Reviews.Title: “No faults Found”
Reviews.Author: nicki
Reviews.Content: Great Location It is so central to everything yet it is in a peacful area where there is no disturbance at night. Great Room Fantastic beds that are so comfortable, good size room, plenty of hot water, tea & coffee supplied, smells fresh. Food We did not eat in the hotel as there are so many restaurants in Amsterdam Staff They are there if you need them, and are very willing to help. I would stay again if i ever return to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joc54
Reviews.Content: Great location for two ladies on holiday. Clean friendly and a great breakfast. Humphreys next door is great value and good choice

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: eddyo
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at this place and although i had a few concerns about it after reading some poor reviews here and there, in all fairness, there were very few negatives. The Hotel's located in a good spot, set in a quiet square just off Nieuwendijk and Niuwezijds Voorburgwal, 500m or so from Centraal Station. Easy access to most areas via trams or on your toes and there's a bike hire place just a few doors down. Restaurants and bars around the hotel offer relatively cheap eating with Humphrey's having a pretty good, fixed 3 course for euro 20 pp. The Five Bells on the other side of the hotel entrance has a good grill menu and is another choice for a well-priced eating option. We had booked an executive room but we were upgraded on arrival to a business room on the 4th floor ( not sure how much of a difference there is but the receptionist said it was a better room) Check-in was quick and the staff were efficient and nice enough. Our room was in the 2nd building which is connected by a glass walkway and getting there involved a lift ride to the 2nd floor, a wander across to the other lift and up to the 4th floor. Sounds like a trek but it was no bother, the lifts are swift with very little wait time. The room itself was a good size with a king size double bed , flat screen tv, workstation, fridge/mini bar, safe in the closet and an iron with an ironing board hinged onto the back of the closet door. The bathroom was also a good size with a bath at one end, an excellent shower at the other and large vanity unit between. Both rooms were spotless and the daily housekeeping was worthy of praise. On the down side, there was some minor work going on in the hotel but it wasn't obvious and not much of an issue where we were. Guests staying in other rooms closer to the area being worked on may have suffered a bit though as there was some drilling one morning but it didn't last long. Overall, i'd be quite happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Cukie
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was excellent in terms of room and comfort, i must add that the staff was rude and not helpful at all. They never smiled even when the lady at the reception asked us "how was your stay" it felt like she was merely doing her job. Although i would recommend a stay in this hotel, but please expect a cold atmosphere that their rude staff creates.

Reviews.Title: “Terribe experience”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: This place is basically a dump. They make the lobby look swanky to lure you in, but that's where all semblance of decency ends. Let me list the problems: 1. Tiny room 2. Tiny bathroom 3. Noisy location 4. Maids don't clean properly (they didn't vacuum once or change our sheets - it literally took them 5 minutes to clean our room - we had to go back to our room after leaving, and we saw that they already "cleaned" - meaning they only gave us new towels). 5. People smoking pot in rooms, with the smoke coming into our room, on a non-smoking floor 6. Decor is a hodge podge that gave us a headache every time we looked at it

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: blinkin
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 2 day break in Amsterdam. Have stayed in Amsterdam many times before and this hotel was by far the best value for money. The lobby is very welcoming and smart. Staff very efficient and friendly. There is a nice chill out area with a fire and free internet stations. The room was smart, very clean with a queen sized bed. Crisp white linen and comfy pillows. Flat screen tv and mini bar. Bathroom again smart and spotless. Good shower pressure and complimentary soaps. As the hotel is off the road in a pedestrian only area it was very quiet at night which was lovely. The hotel is also situated in a great place. 5 minute walk to central station, and not far to dam square. Highly recommended for a city break

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: HelenPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We had a 'girlie' weekend (myself, my friend, my Mother and her friend, who are both in their 70's) in Amsterdam over the May Bank Holiday weekend and stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is very well situated just 10 minutes walk from Centraal Station and is central to all Amsterdam amenities with tram stops right outside the door. Yes, the rooms are quite small but not overly so.....and I've stayed in smaller! We booked 2 twin rooms with Opodo and asked for non-smoking. When we checked in, we were told that they only had smoking rooms available for that first night however the man on Reception was at pains to tell us that if we were in any way unhappy with our rooms they would/could change them the next day for us. We found, however, that the rooms were fine and not at all smoky, so stayed put. The bathroom was well appointed with a nice shower over the bath (which admittedly, we had to get someone to come up and show us how to convert it from shower head to the hand-held wand!)and there was an LCD TV in the room which we were able to watch BBC1 and BBC2 on. There was also a small fridge/mini-bar. The beds are wonderfully comfortable! I couldn't wait to climb in each night. If I could have fitted a mattress in my suitcase, the hotel might have found itself one missing by the time I went home!! Food......it you want great value, great food and fantastic service, go to Humphreys Restaurant next door. Just 19.95 euros for 3 courses. You'd be hard put to find a meal of this quality and quantity at less than Â£25-Â£30 here in the UK. We ate there 3 nights out of the 4. Very much enjoyed Amsterdam again and would certainly stay at this hotel again. We found the staff to be very obliging and helpful in all our dealings with them.

Reviews.Title: “worst value for money hotel experience i can recall”
Reviews.Author: jdcooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Tulip Centre for three nights in April during the Queen's Day festivities. Perhaps that's why the relationship between our room's price and its quality was so entirely out of whack. I booked via AmEx travel, and this hotel was the only one they could find with rooms. They got us two rooms at 330 euros per night per Standard room. My complaints: - The rooms are small. As in Parisian hotel room small, not like American hotel small. With four people in a room it felt very crowded. - The staff was extremely unpleasant. Our room had trouble with its keycard locking system, which turned into an epic saga of irritation. I tried my card in the lock on the first night. It didn't work, so I went downstairs for a new card figuring my phone had zapped it or something. This key also proved to not work. I asked at the desk for help, noting that there was no audible or visual feedback from the key reader when I tried the key (normally if you get a bad read there's a red light and a beep). The surly staff member at the desk ignored this input and insisted on our going up the elevator and across the hotel so he could try the key. Guess what? It didn't work. He then grouchily left to get a physical device that plugs into the door lock mechanism, and after returning with it, unlocked the room. I asked him to make sure this was sorted out so we didn't have a repeat performance the next time out of the hotel. The next evening when we returned, the lock mechanism had not been fixed, hence my card didn't work and I had to leave my friends standing in the hallway for 15 minutes whilst I went to reception. I ran the staff member who eventually attended to me through the situation. He insisted on coming up to try the key himself despite my protestations that it was a waste of time. When the key indeed failed to work as I knew it would, he then had to find someone to let us in with the unlocking device. Once we finally were inside and relaxing, a member of maintenance staff came and opened our door fully to the hall and sat on the floor poking at the lock mechanism ineffectively until eventually giving up. Fortunately, though, they got the lock fixed during our next trip out of the hotel. Now, I understand that 'stuff' happens and things go wrong. That's fine - something like this can happen at any hotel property. What diferentiates among gradations of the hotel is the grace and and ease of getting the problem fixed. This was unbelievably unpleasant. The staff who helped with this acted as if it was my fault and that I was inconveniencing them. (Multiple staff members). Totally not acceptable. - Rate change switcheroo. I booked thru AmEx for 330e per night. I have a printout from AmEx travel services to this effect. However, I unfortunately didn't have it with me when I checked out. They charged me 360e per night per room, and when I told them the booking was definitely at 330e, they told me to call the manager when I got home to sort it out. This information was also delivered in a surly manner. On the upside, the hotel is in a very convenient location, there is a bike rental shop next door, the rooms were quite quiet, and the sheets were soft. However I do not expect to be treated poorly at a >300e per night hotel, so I will not be gracing this hotel again. This hotel is worth <200e per night. I've had better service many times at low-end hotels around the world. In Amsterdam, I recommend the Banks Mansion instead. It is superb.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Rosslyn
Reviews.Content: I booked this through the hotel website of the Netherlands. Good price compared with other Amsterdam hotels in April: 105 euros per night. The location is excellent, situated slightly off the bustling streets of the Damrak district. It is only 10 minutes walk to the Centraal Station and even closer to other tourist amenities like joining excursions and taking canal boat tours. The hotel offers free internet service in the back of the lobby. A room safe is included in the price, unlike others where it is extra. Each room is individually climate-controlled. The room is somewhat small but adequate. Service from the hotel staff is above average. There is a minibar and a water kettle for you to make hot beverages. I'll definitely come back to stay if I pay similarly good price next time.

Reviews.Title: “Soooooo quiet, central and comfortable - and breakfast - wow!”
Reviews.Author: scrobble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Tulip for one night at the start of April 07 - it was the perfect antidote to a fortnight's travelling and staying in clapped-out old beds and sleeper carriages! The hotel was very easy to find and 5 mins' walk from Central Station. The staff were very friendly, and the room was large, nicely decorated, very clean, with a super comfortable king size bed - mmmm! Considering how central the hotel is, the room was silent at night so we got a great night's sleep. We paid extra for breakfast, but it was worth paying for - you can even squeeze your own oranges for fresh juice, and there was a great selection of foods. When we needed to find a shop in a different part of the city, the staff were very helpful and photocopied the page out of their map book so we could get there. We were also able to leave our bags at reception after we checked out so we could explore the city before heading off. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to other travellers. A big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: OzChick05
Reviews.Content: We spent the Easter weekend (3 nights) staying at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Central. Good points: Great location (central but still quiet and safe) - very quick walk from Central Station and attractions like Dam Square, Red Light District (but a safe distance!), canal boat tours etc. Excellent shower Huge bed Big room (upgraded to Business) Proximity to a huge variety of food - try Toro Dorado for excellent steak and service A tip - make sure you visit the Amstelkring Museum, also known as Our Lord in the Attic - amazing! Not so good points: Decor quite ugly (paint and carpet - not a big deal, but considering it was a 'superior' room, they could have put more effort into it - pretty tacky) Service average - certainly didn't go out of their way to help us Toilet reeked of urine for the entire stay Breakfast ridiculously expensive - but plenty of great little patisseries and cafes nearby Overall, a good place to stay in Amsterdam. I was a little disappointed because it certainly wasn't cheap and I had expected a lot more. It was an average hotel in my book. The location almost makes it worth it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: iloveamsterdammm
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my friend both of 25 years of age. The hotel staff are very welcoming and bend over backwards to help you. Due to the checkout time of 12pm and us arriving at 9am we had to wait 5 hours before our room was available but that was ok as we dumped our luggage and hit the streets. The hotel is quite up-market and posh which was luxurious but over the top for us young lads. When you arrive in the room you are presented with a box of treats (pringles, chocolate bars etc) and a fridge full of cans (soft, alcoholic, even whisky bottles) which we were very happy to see until we discovered the fact that each item was chargeable! We nevertheless didnt touch any item and bought goods at the much cheaper supermarket instead. I was a little annoyed at the final bill which shoes there is a 'City Tax' of around 7-10 euro per night which we have never been charged at any hotel previously that we were aware of. There is a daily maid service who do seem to come quite early which led to us placing the 'do not disturb' sign up which amazingly was ignored by the maid on one occasion, presistently knocking on our door despite us wishing she would walk away. There is a TV in the room with the odd british channel (bbc1, etc) which was nice. There are sex channels but I am not offended at anything like that, it is Amsterdam afterall! but bear this in mind parents :-). Location is right next to the main shopping strip and just a little further is the Dam Square. The Central Station is very close too, within <5mins walk. The Red Light District is a little further but only by a few more minutes walking. I close by saying that I would stay here again but not by choice, its mainly aimed at the older couple, well to do businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from an hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bimbob
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days in Amsterdam. A smooth journey from start to finish. 45minute flight from Birmingham.Straight on a train from the airport (3.60euros from a ticket machine) 10minute walk from train station to hotel.Could not fault this hotel. Situated in the middle of Amsterdam just off a side street in walking distance of all attractions.On arirval we were upgraded to a business room. Kingsize bed,flat screen tv,full bathroom,full stocked fridge and goody box(NOT FREE).Iron and board ,trouser press ,hair drier and tea/coffee making faclities.(Ask for fresh milk at the bar) All staff very helpful.Free internet in the bar. Didnt have breakfast in the hotel - just walked round the corner - plenty of bars and cafes.Shops open at 10am. Fantastic restaurant next door to hotel called Humpreys. 19.95 euros for a 3 course meal. Excellent food. Places you must visit/must do - Anne Frank house.(very moving)Boat trip.(relaxing)Sex museum(a laugh).Red light district(an eye opener)Dam square.De Jaren cafe(sit outside by the side of the canal).D & V department store - food court (fantastic fresh food-cooked while you wait). ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Tulip for a week. The hotel was great. Although the room was small, most of the hotels there have small rooms, it was nice. wireless internet for free in the room. We were able to get directions to different area attractions. Maid service was great. The Hotel staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just right - location, price, comfort”
Reviews.Author: Primrose1801
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam for the first time last week - 6/03/07 and had a great time. The hotel was perfect for our needs. It's an easy walk to the Central Station - 5 mins. We walked almost everywhere from here - Dam Square is 10 min walk, Red Light district is 10 mins, lots of shopping is on the next street over - even the museums are walkable - maybe half an hour stroll at most. Trams stop really nearby. The room was very clean and comfortable - we opted for a deluxe room for the king-sized bed. Breakfast seemed a bit pricey, especially when there are great cafes nearby. Would definitely go back to this hotel if we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: swanny85
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just off Damrak 5-10minute walk from central station, excellent quality hotel. We have stayed here a few times over the past couple of years and it never fails to impress. staff are helpful, rooms arent large, but hey we are in Amsterdam. Room and bathroom always clean with a decent size bath and plenty of hot water. Very overpriced mini bar. Good security, all rooms have a safe. TV has bbc1, bbc world as well as a few other english channels and pay movies. Be warned there are 2 hardcore porn channels!! Overall its a good, comfortable hotel, a touch on the expensive side, we paid 360euros for 2 nights last time we stayed in may 2006. Also note, like most places in Amsterdam they charge an additional 5% room tax on top of what you pay....check its included before you book online. They are also ok with smoking in the rooms......thats the Amsterdam kind of smoking....wink wink, nudge nudge!! We have always had a good nights sleep here, comfy bed and in a car free zone so nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: Margaret99
Reviews.Content: Margaret from York. Stayed there 9th & 10th March 2007 Lovely clean and well located hotel, local to all amenities. 10 minute walk from train station 5 minutes from Dam Square. Quite a peaceful hotel but spoilt Saturday night by a rowdy group singing at 3am in the lift! Would definately reccomend and go back. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little cold”
Reviews.Author: mos13_2000
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam. Famous for drugs, prostitutes and sex shows. So do yourself a favour and book a central hotel in all the action but that makes you feel safe at and comfortable at night. After 24 hours of being offered hardcore drugs by hardcore men this is exactly what the Golden Tulip provided! The hotel was booked online with lastminute and was a great find. If you havent been to Amsterdam before the star ratings are equal in quality to those of the UK. On my last trip with 5 lads, 3 star was fine and basic and clean enough to "crash". This time with the wife and we agreed to drop an extra star on the end and the difference was everything you'd expect. The hotel is centrally placed 2 small "blocks" over the back of the main high street the Damrak. This means it's next door to pubs and restaurants and a small walk from breakfast locations. (This is particularily good to hear as breakfast in the hotel is 20 euros each and a full english can be found only yards away for 6). The Golden Tulip is also only 5 minutes walk from the train station, do not get a cab but if you're really struggling 1.60 euros on a 1,2 or 5 tram is easy as it stops outside the hotel (2nd stop). This line also continues down to other great areas and pubs and to the museum quarter, Heineken experience and the casino area so in itself serves as a day out. The lifts can only be activated by a key card in the hotel and the bar area is very relaxing. They do show football and sports in the hotel but the bar directly next door has a huge screen, food, pool tables and cheaper beer so why hang around? My wife upgraded us to a suite as a birthday suprise and this cost around Â£35 per night. It was well worth the extra as we had a large room with extravigate beems in the old part of the hotel along with a jacuzzi. The only negative on this hotal was the warmth of the particular room I was in. Although understandably a "unique" room the aircon thermostat seemed to recognise the temperature was low but refused to do anything but blow out cool air. The electric heater they had put in the room worked but the high ceilings and single pain glass were just too much for it to make a difference. I dont feel the cold but the wife does and the room really should have been a degree or two higher. Other than that, great time, great hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and brillaint location”
Reviews.Author: SED77
Reviews.Content: After reading review after review about other hotels in the centre of Amsterdam, and most not very good, I was very pleased to come across the Golden Tulip. I'm happy to say that the reviews were right - it is a great hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were lovely and adequate for a two night stay. If anything - go to Amsterdam just for the shower in this hotel - they were fantastic. The breakfast was tasty, though the scrambled eggs were a little strange as it had smoked cheese in it! Our breakfast wasn't included in our room price, which we didn't realise, but they gave us a discount after we explained, which was nice. The hotel is very centrally located and many attractions are just around the corner and only a five minute walk from the central station from the airport. Would definitely go back to this hotel on next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with greath location”
Reviews.Author: af01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for tree days on business. The hotel has a great location in central Amsterdam, within walking distance to almost everything. There is a good breakfast and a nice bar at the hotel. I did though miss a swimmingpool.

Reviews.Title: “we love amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chenbear
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdamâ€¦ we read directions to the Golden Tulip Hotel Inntel Amsterdam Centre from four different people on Trip Advisor, we walked the wrong wayâ€¦ So we have decided to add our directionsâ€¦ How you get to the hotel depends on which end of the train station you come out ofâ€¦ if you come out of one end of the station the Victoria hotel is directly across from you if you walk directly toward itâ€¦ when you are in front of the hotel take a right walk straight down the street and a left at the first corner. If you come out the other end of the station and the Victoria Hotel is diagonally across from you donâ€™t walk towards it (that is what we did, wrong way) walk straight to the nearest corner, when you reach the corner and the Victoria is at the corner on the other end of the street continue walking straight donâ€™t walk toward the Victoria. Walk straight and the hotel will be on the left. The good news is once you know where your at getting back to the station when it is time to leave is a cinch. More good news the hotel was great and near to everythingâ€¦ you walk out of the hotel and you are right where you want to beâ€¦ the room was nice, WiFi worked no problemâ€¦ http://www.9292ov.nl/is a good web-site for directions to any where. Tram seems to be the best way to travelâ€¦ they stop at midnight but the buses where timely. Mostly walking will get you everywhere. Humphries next door is as good as everyone says 3 courses for only 19 euros, excellent food. When leaving on the way to the airport my girlfriend and I were on the train, sitting across from each other with our luggage off to the side. The train pulled into a stop and a guy walked in to our car and started to ask my girlfriend about his ticket, if he was on the right train and what not. She said the train goes to the airport and more than that she doesn't know. So then he started to ask me to which I replied I only know what she has already said. Another guy comes in the entrance behind meâ€¦ my girlfriend starts to scream, I looked up and the guy had grabbed my backpack and jumped off the train I jumped off the train in pursuit when I almost caught up to him he dropped my bag. I picked it up and got back on the trainâ€¦ the two guys were working together it all happened so quickly, it was surreal. I sprained my ankle pretty bad and didn't realize how bad it was until I was on the plane. I was on crutches now I am on a cane... but I am okay... We are from New York City and I have never had this experience before and I spend about three months out of the country a year in Europe and South America but all and all Amsterdam was great and we will return to this lovely cityâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base to explore Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon4189
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near to the train station, it took a few minutues to get our bearings with a map but we soon arrived safely, walking from the station to the hotel. Its easy to get the train from the airport to amsterdam and cheap too. The hotel is very clean and tidy, our room was relaxing and comfortable and good to crash out after a long day sight seeing. There is a tram route nearby to get around the city if your not keen on walking but we didn't use this. We bought a 2 day canal bus pass and used the canal boats to get around, this in my opinion was the best way to get around, not too much walking a good way to see as much of the city during a short city break. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk from the canal where the canal bus tickets are sold and set off from each morning. We did not eat at the hotel, it seemed a little expensive for the breakfast. the hotel was on the doorstep of a number of cafes and restaurants and we had no difficulties finding a good breafast and eveing meal. The hotel has a cosy friendly bar where we enjoyed a drink at the end of the night at before bed. We had a fantastic time and the hotel played a big part of that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: twinklesplodge
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 130 per night including breakfast. It was good value for money. We stayed mid February Location- A great base for shopping, walk to train station, red light district, a bit far from Leidesplein but trams 1, 2 and 5 within 2 minutes of the hotel take you there. Tram 17 takes you to Anne Frank house- definitely worth a visit. A couple of nice bars in the vicinity as well which are inexpensive compared to others. Train from Schipol at 7 euro return leaves you 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I was encouraged to avoid taxis as they are expensive. We had to get one from Leidesplein one night as the trams had stopped and he took us to another golden tulip hotel first. Ensure you have the exact address written down so the taxi driver doesnâ€™t get **confused**. Rooms- Very clean bathrooms spotless with a lovely shower, toiletries and comfortable beds. Double bed is actually 2 singles pushed together- would have preferred an actual double bed Staff- Staff at reception were very pleasant for directions, restaurant recommendations in fact anything we asked they were very helpful. Would I recommend? Yes absolutely and canâ€™t wait to return to Amsterdam. Try Stoop en Stoop in Leidesplein for dinner authentic food and excellent value. I would also recommend Hard Rock cafe for lunch good value and nice atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccommended!”
Reviews.Author: kazz_usher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam 8th Feb-11th Feb and loved it. Fantastic location - easy to find once you know where you are going. I have to admit that I still managed to get lost, even though I had printed off the directions! A friendly local man did help us find it. Be wary of others wanting to "Take you to the hotel" Check in - lovely reception, easy to check in. 50euro deposit when you check in, in case you use the phone/mini bar. I was on the 4th floor. Nice size room, as said before the bed was so COMFY! and big, and the room was very very clean. No complaints what so ever. There is complimentory tea/coffee/whitener in the room. Location - fantastic location, walking distance to all the attractions. My partner and I didnt have to get public transport even once, walked everywhere. I reccommend Humphries next door for dinner, fantastic 3 course menu for only 20euro each, service was great. Check out - Very easy and very quick. There is a charge for the city tax but I think it was only about 15 euro. Overall I would give this hotel 4/5 and would be more than happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireDaisy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend at this hotel. The location is fantastic five minute walk to the train station, two minutes to shops, ten minutes to Dam Square and Red Light District (what an eye opener)! The rooms are clean only complaint very lumpy pillows. Staff are all very friendly as was everybody in Amsterdam. Humphrey's next door serves fantastic food at very reasonable prices. Make sure you go to Anne Frank house very emotional. Oh and don't forget Betty Boop Coffee Shop if you like chocolate cake with a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, recommended”
Reviews.Author: gharpur
Reviews.Content: We booked this through bookings.nl too. It is a 5 min walk from central station, 5 mins walk to central square, and a 10 min to the red light district. This was my 4th time to amsterdam, and the best accomodation I have stayed in. It's just right as it is just outside of all the chaos of the red light, so if you want a good nights sleep in a nice quiet area, with the madness only a 10 min walk away, this place is ideal to stay in. The main shopping streets are 2 mins away. There is a "coffee" shop across from it. A resonably price restaurant next door. Also, there is free internet in the lobby. The rooms were clean and spacious and the staff very helpful. This is a great place to stay for the money you pay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ElCoburno
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Location is perfect. Right in the centre of everything, within walking distance of all attractions yet a haven to return to each night! Hotel is quiet as it is just off the main road. Ther best coffeeshop in town is just across the road, great start point for the day. Bathroom was lovely, pay TV gives you all channels even though it says it will only show whats on that channel. Comfy bed, nice sheets and towels etc. Staff are helpful. Wireless internet is pretty bad you can rarely get a signal! But there are computer in most coffee shops and betty boop coffeeshop across the road will let you use theirs (usually for free!!) I wolod love to return to this hotel and would recommend it highly to anyone thinking of staying here. Advice... book through bookings.nl as it is much cheaper than anywhere else... for this hotel anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of City Tax”
Reviews.Author: LesleyPerthScotland
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a long weekend in Amsterdam, staying at the Golden Tulip, we booked through Last Minute.com, and had the option to upgrade to a superior room, which we did, to say the bed is enormous is an understatment, which did seem to make the room a little small, but taking into account there was a work station for laptop etc, i guess its of average size. The Hotel is very clean, staff very friendly, although i wasnt amused at being woken at 9.30am on a Sunday by the maid banging on the door, and calling " House keeping", after a rather late night! Its in an ideal spot, not far from central station, dont do what we did, and get a taxi from the airport-50.00 euros lighter, get the Train 3.60 euros, goes right to Central station and your a short walk away. We didnt take the breakfast, which was'nt included, but there are plenty of places to eat. One thing to be aware of though, we were asked for a 50.00 Euro deposit, incase we used the mini bar or snack's,these are laid out in a very inviting basket in your room, so beware, but when we checked out, of our 50.00 Euros we only got back 33.51 Euros, the rest having been taken for City tax!!! Apart from that, Amsterdam, is very lively, and i would recomend The Golden Tulip

Reviews.Title: “No hassle, clean and tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: benders-7
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise trip for my wife and I to stay in an Executive room in March last year for our first trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is superbly located close to the station with all the main attractions in walking distance. Amsterdam is a great city to just stroll around, even if it was absolutely freezing when we were there! We arrived much earlier than the stated check in time, but our room was free and we were able to check in without any problems. Room was fine, good size for a city centre hotel, and clean and tidy. Very quiet being at the back of the hotel and with the hotel being on a pedestrianised square. No view to speak of though, but not an issue for us. Staff were friendly and helpful, pointing us in the right directions and also suggesting that we use the tourist information by the station to pre-purchase tickets for the art galleries etc, as this cuts down the queuing. We didn't eat in the hotel as breakfast wasn't included, but there are plenty of eating places nearby. Bar was OK for pre and post evening drinks. No problems when checking out and we were able to leave our bags as our flight didn't leave until the evening. We paid 300 EUR for our weekend stay, which was a little expensive, but did provide us with a clean and tidy hotel in a great position and I don't mind paying a little extra to get this peace of mind and no hassles for a short weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: cpietz2
Reviews.Content: I just got back from our stay at the Golden Tulip - Centre 2 days ago. I was there for the New Year and stayed for 5 days. This is one of the greatest hotels I've ever stayed at. It is VERY clean, very modern, the staff is always helpful and best of all, it is walking distance to everything you will want to see. The rates were also very fair. The only glitch is that our flight arrived into Amsterdam at 9am and we couldn't check into our room until 3pm even though we requested an early check-in (which isn't guarenteed if you book through hotels.com). But they have a lovely sitting area to hang out with free internet to pass the time. The rooms were definetly a decent size, don't pay attention to anyone that says otherwise. Bathrooms were very spacious and clean as well. Oh, and the shower is "magical." Stay at this hotel! Don't think twice! You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: germanfan
Reviews.Content: We planned a visit to Amsterdam between Christmas and New Years and selected a Golden Tulip property based on 1) past positive impressions with the Golden Tulip Chain, 2) the favorable impressions left by other "Tripadvisors". The positives: 1) Hotel is centrally located, near the main train stations, most major sightseeing attractions and convienent tram stops 2) Fair value for Amsterdam. We paid â‚¬ 110 + 5 â‚¬ city tax for a basic room with a queen sized bed 3) Room was modern, clean and quiet as we expected. 4) Internet access was free and convienent The negatives: 1) Breakfast was not included with the rate and cost â‚¬18 per person. I asked for 2 fried eggs instead of the cold powdery scrambled eggs, where upon the head waiter responded "only if the chef was in a good mood" I never did see my eggs (I guess the chef was not in a good mood) The breakfast offered I wide selection, but was not worth â‚¬18. On subsequent mornings we ate breakfast at coffee shops or other restaurant near by. 2) Many small problems with housekeeping. No towels, no supplies, the housekeeping staff knocking on the door at 8:30 am despite a do not distrub sign (on 3 different times, the maid woke us up which was irritating because being on vacation we were hoping to sleep in a bit) In all fairness, the problems were rectified after speaking with the management, but these sort of housekeeping issues should not exist with a hotel of this caliber. Conclusion, unfortunately I do not agree with the high ratings at this hotel and would likely not stay here again. I am quite picky about hotels because I travel frequently (with over 80 hotel over night stays per year) and expect a higher level of service at such hotels. Amsterdam was a city worth visiting -- especially the wonderful Art museums and the Anne Frank house.

Reviews.Title: “Right By Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: Randilyn26
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a standard hotel that is very quiet and within 5 minutes from both the train station and Dam Square, this is a good choice. The rooms are clean and furnished simply. If you have young kids beware of the porn on the TV! Raunchier than anything I've seen before. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices. Front desk was very pleasant. Despite website claims to the contrary, no airline points given for discounted rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: DaphneBroon
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days in this hotel and had an excellent time. The hotel is very impressive. Staff are friendly and helpful. The room was a perfect size, the bed was huge. There is a mini bar in the room, although this is obviously expensive. Tea and coffee in room but buy your own milk and keep it in the fridge. The hotel bar also has free internet access. The awful carpet on the website has been replaced by a lovely modern wooden floor, also the dining room is clean and modern. We had breakfast two mornings and could not fault it. The hotel is central (a five minute walk from the Central Station), and everything is within walking distance. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern, friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tigger82
Reviews.Content: Very clean, centrally located hotel. 5minutes from central station. We booked a standard double room which felt very spacious, not huge but for the same price I've stayed in box rooms in London! The bathroom was spotless and the shower was great. The staff were very friendly, we had no reason to call reception, but always greated us when we passed. The TV had BBC channels to make us feel at home. My only negative is that that there was no milk with the coffee making facilities, but friends who had stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam had warned me that this was standard so we bought milk and kept it in the mini bar so not really an issue. Breakfast wasn't included in our rate so I can't comment on the food but the breakfast room looked very inviting. I canâ€™t understand any of the negative comments, its not a 5 star hotel but for the Â£83 a night we paid it was a great hotel and a lot nicer than most places Iâ€™ve stayed in Britain for similar prices. If I found a similar price I would definitely stay here again, a very clean, modern, friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but terrible carpets!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Carr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Tulip for 2 nights on a leisure break. We chose the hotel purely for its location. The location is great, the hotel is right in the city centre and it's very easy to walk around and about. It's only about 5 minutes walk to the Central train station and connection to the airport is easy, cheap and very frequent. I like taxis but I can definitely recommend taking the train! The hotel is ok, the decor has seen better days but all was ok. Our room was very small but it had all the essentials. The duvet/blanket was a bit tatty along with the carpet choice (both in our room and in the foyer!) were the only minus points. You don't get a lot for your money but if you are not planning to stay in your room too much, the hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location! EVER”
Reviews.Author: Saltyshopper
Reviews.Content: I am reading the other reviews and wondering if we all stayed at the same place. For starters, let me say the place is perfectly located!! Perfectly-you are near everything you want to be near-including the train station! I couldn't believe our location. The place is fine and the location makes it worth staying. But the rooms are small-very small-my husband and I had to turn sideways to pass each other in certain part of the room. It is definately clean-very clean. The breakfast is fine, but I thought expensive for what it was (although I found amsterdam rather costly in general) As for the staff (and this is the part I where I wonder if I stayed in a different hotel then the other reviewers)-they were rather unfriendly and never helpful! I love this site and check it any time I stay at a hotel so I wanted to return the favor. All in all the location can not be beat and it was a very decent hotel, no major complaints, nothing gross or anything like that-just small and unfriendly staff. I would probably not stay here again, but not because I hated it just because I feel like for what I paid, I would have liked to have not been treated like a bother!

Reviews.Title: “Escellant location”
Reviews.Author: jjoe
Reviews.Content: Very good room, great location, staff were very friendly. I have being to Amsterdam six times and this is by far the best hotel I have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: nsff
Reviews.Content: Nice location, near train station. QUIET. clean. Not too small. Helpful staff. Only bad part was additional tax at the end, whereas I had paid all taxes via hotels.com, so beware.

Reviews.Title: “very good option”
Reviews.Author: SEAGULLSUPPORTER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it a vg place to base yourself. Easy walking distance of Centraal Station so journey from Schipool was good. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Was quiet because it is just off a main street. An unpretentious hotel with staff that were helpul. I will certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MWF00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, only 5 minutes walk from the station. The room was extremely spacious, modern, clean and fully equipped. We asked for a non-smoking room in a quiet part of the hotel which they accomodated. Check-in was smooth and efficient and all members of staff we came across were extremely friendly. Breakfast was included in the room rate - a good variety of breads, pastries, cold meats & cheese. The cooked section did not look as appetising but this was not such a big deal. Unfortunately, my husband left his mobile phone in the room and the hotel were not able to find it. Overall, a good hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All round - Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: pamela3rd
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this Hotel was absolutely brilliant. We had booked a double room (bed & breakfast). The room actually had 2 double beds in it. The breakfast was great. Buffet style and you could have as much as you wanted to eat. Great location with lots of friendly little pubs nearby. Near to everything you need to see in Amsterdam; I would definitely stay here again. Staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Also had free wireless internet facility. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pjsltk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Tulip in Amsterdam on October 7, 8, 9. It was a great experience. It was a five minute walk from Central Station, and we could walk to many attractions (Dam Square, Anne Frank House, Red Light District). It sits on a pedestrian only street so is very quiet. The restaurant next door (Humphryâ€™s) was very good, and there were many others close by. A grocery store across from Dam Square was very convenient too. The breakfast was included with our room, and had a good selection. The room itself was comfortable, not too small, and beds were great. The bar off the lobby was nice, and the staff were very helpful. I would highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: EnthusiasmCurbed
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Golden Tulip for a long weekend. If you are looking for a modern hotel with decent rooms within walking distance of everywhere ( & friendly staff ) it is ideal. If you are flying to Amsterdam you can catch a train from the station located in the airport to central Amsterdam for approx 3.60 Euros each way (you get charged extra if you use the ticket office rather than the machines)â€¦ and takes 15-20 minutes. Then the hotel is literally 10 minutes walk from the station. We followed another reviewers directions (amended below) and found it quite easily. In Summary â€¦. If you leave Central Station the side of the trams you can see over the bridge a big hotel called Victoria Hotel. We went over the bridge so the hotel was in front of us and then went right (so the hotel was on our left) and carried on walking until we got to a left turn (you cant miss it)â€¦. Turn left down this road and the hotel is down the 4th (ish) road on the left (its easy to see from the road you are on). Regarding restaurants yes there are lots a steak houses, and we tried one about 3-4 doors away from the hotel, as per other reviewers the specials on the boards outside are a lot cheaper then the menus you are offered. The meal was nice enough but nothing special. The next night walked miles looking for a better restaurant, but ended up at Humphries next door to the hotel. Very nice food & surroundings at a set price of 20 Euros for 3 courses. Highly recommended â€“ far nicer food than the steak & much much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here at the moment!”
Reviews.Author: Mitsy2007
Reviews.Content: Staying at the hotel at the moment and using the FREE internet service to write this - boring I know but we;ve got a few minutes to waste and seeing as though I check this site for EVERY hotel I stay in, I thought I'd return the favour for all you reading this. Hotel is very central and brill - very clean and staff are excellent. Food everywhere great apart from chip shop called Manequin Piss (after the sculpure in Brussels!) - horrible chips!! Yet eÃ³ne seems to eat them! Go to brill steakhouse opposite and lovely cafe;s everywhere. Have a fab trip as Amsterdam is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JennyR123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tulip Inn Centre in March 2005 and it was probably the best hotel I have been to in Amsterdam!! The location is brilliant, it was so close to the shops and nightlife although there was no noise at all at night. Our room was really nice and they are very clean - room service everyday. I would definatley recommend staying here - it wont disapoint!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
