Reviews.Author: Oldbison
Reviews.Content: I agree with the comments of the recent reviews. I booked with the links from the Tripadvisor site which compare offers from different booking sites. For the same dates, the cheapest was Venere at 115 Euro, and the most expensive was over 200 Euro. As an alternative to the rather expensive hotel breakfast the cafe on the corner offers a limited choice, but about 100 metres south down Niewezijds Voorburgwal there is a little place where they bake and sell a much wider variety of croissants, cakes and pastries and have fresh-squeezed orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: anyoldname
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night break in Amsterdam staying at the Golden Tulip Centre. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the staff are happy to help if there are any problems. Our room had been cancelled instead of confirmed due to a technical hitch from our booking agents, Debby the receptionist said they had a room we could have for 4 nights and not to worry about anything as she would sort out the problem with our booking agents in the morning, which she did. As on other reviews I would agree, the rooms are not large but very nice and the bed is fantastic after a day on your feet. Do be careful the water is very very hot so check temp before washing or showering. They charge city tax you can check how much on the television (view bill) but you do get a safe in your room. All in all this hotel has very good customer awarness without being over attentive. Food and drink prices varies a lot, my one tip is ask before you buy the bars around the squares charge hotel prices, try one of the small bars the locals use these are reasonably priced and good beer. The restaurant next door to the hotel is called Humphrey's we had a 3 course menue (6 choices for each course) and a bottle of red wine oh and a beer the bill came to 59.50 euros very good value and the food was great, the restaurant is very large but looks quit small from the outside so if it looks full go in and ask lots of tabels at the rear. Some of the local restaraunts offer special prices outside but not on the menue inside again you will need to ask about the specials on offer or you will pay more. The Wild Man pub does food on Mon,Wed and Fri this is a real ale pub (larger) very friendly and a good atmosephere, you need to book a table as it has limited seating, the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCritter
Reviews.Content: This was our one 4 star hotel on our trip, and it was worth the little extras. The staff was friendly and professional. Our room was airy, clean, and modern. Though small by USA standards, it was typical for Europe. The bed was a king, large and comfy. Bathroom though small, very clean and well equipped. Satelite TV, in room safe and ironing board. Breakfast was varied and a nice buffet. A pleasant touch, in keeping with the Dutch obession with newspapers, each morning a "news sheet" was available published in a variety of languages for as many countries. So you could have your morning coffee and catch up on the news back home at the breakfast table. Free internet computer stations in the lobby, and free wireless throughout the hotel. (very convienent, if you have a laptop with you) The hotel is located in a very nice little quiet square right in the thick of the tourist area. Which was very nice indeed, you could sit peacefully outdoors and enjoy a beer at one of cafes right outside the hotel. Or enjoy a quiet coffee and a smoke (WINK WINK) at th Betty Boop Coffee Shop. Then, walk down the block and be swallowed up in the throng of divine decadence that is tourist Amsterdam. Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dbowen
Reviews.Content: have just returned from 2 nights in this hotel, first class hotel, fantastic location, 5 mins walk fm dam square, the railway station, ann frank house etc....3.60 euros each way for the train fm schipol airport, train every 10 minutes, spotlessly clean,15 minute journey, much cheaper than taxi. We did have breakfast in the hotel but for us brits its not much of a full english, ie; well done bacon, scrambled egg and tinned sausages. most places do full english/irish breakfasts within 2 mins walk for approx 8-10euros. Loads of restaurants and bars on the doorstep, would definately recommend an argentinian steak restaurant (they appear to be everywhere) the fillet was far better than british fillet, 'melt in the mouth'! Prices for beer and food is near enough same as Britain just be prepared to do a lot of walking, and well worth it, fab sights around every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Oh Dear, the Pornography!”
Reviews.Author: Fern3
Reviews.Content: As a mother of a young child, it was a constant battle to shield her from the hard-core pornography on the television. I know that Amsterdam is famous for it, but hotels are more than capable of blocking these pay-tv channels. Except that when we were staying there, nobody knew how to do it until the morning we checked out. To the Manager of the hotel, please teach your staff (including the night staff) how to block the pay-tv channels. And how about blocking them without us having to ask? If there is a child booked into a room, just block it as standard. It quite spoiled our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: fleur2
Reviews.Content: Nice stay. Hotel is really well situated, five minutes walk from the station and two minutes walk from trams going almost anywhere you might want to go in Amsterdam. We paid 99 euros per night (Â£65) for a superior double room from laterooms.com, which had, according to Laterooms, been reduced from Â£210. The room was just fine, but not large or particularly luxurious. At Â£65 we thought it was a bargain, and it was spotlessly clean; but I think I would have been a little disappointed had we paid the full price! I've just looked at Laterooms and the same room for tonight/tomorrow would be Â£180, although it does drop way down in the week. We didn't have breakfast included, it would have been 18 euros each so we ate at croissanteries instead. Nice staff were a bonus. Restaurants and bars out the front but we couldn't hear anything in the room, which was beautifully quiet.

Reviews.Title: “great location, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: ovelho
Reviews.Content: What we first thought looked like a good location turned out to be a GREAT location---close and quick to anything we wanted to see. The AC in the room was a blessing in the hot weather and much appreciated. We paid for an upgraded room, but I have no idea what that room had that others didn't. I dont' think that was worth anything (I'm not sure it was actually an upgrade room). Other than the AC, the room was small, basic, clean, and had a nice tub in the bath. Staff were very good. Breakfast was NOT included with our internet rate, and they wanted 18 Euros each for breakfast (that would be $46 for two people each day). We found a nice little pastry shop a couple of blocks away where we had coffee and pastries for about $12 for both each morning. The food from neighboring Humphries was very good for dinner and only moderately expensive (the best to expect in Amsterdam!)

Reviews.Title: “a smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sineadoc
Reviews.Content: i would recommend this hotel to any person visiting amsterdam it's location is fab, the hotel is spotless and so quiet, the staff couldn't be better , an absolute jem of a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Cabybake
Reviews.Content: The location and modern amenities of this hotel makes it a great choice. The room was air-conditioned which is important in the middle of summer. The hotel staff was very nice. The room was a little on the small side, but it was quiet and clean. We wee very happy staying here and would recommend it to everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Brill realy great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdickinson
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel 19th july to the 22nd brilliant hotel, lovely staff, lovely rooms, and lovely location what more could you have asked for

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jonnydp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great loaction, it's close to the central areas of Amsterdam and makes the rest of the city easily accessible too. We stayed in a superior room which was nice if lacking a little storage space but was fine for the 3 nights we were there. Our room window didn't exactly have a view as it looked out over the crental courtyard/breakfast room area of the hotel but it was very quiet. The aircon was a blessing as it was very hot during the time we were there. The bed was large and comfortable and the staff were all very helpful. This being Holland seemingly everyone speaks English perfectly. It's only 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station and was very easy to find,within a few hours finding the hotel from anywhere becomes simple. Leaving the hotel you turn right for shops (30 seconds), Dam Square (3 minutes), Red Light areas (5 minutes) etc and left takes you over towards Jordaan area and the Anne Frank museum. This was my third time in Amsterdam and we did something we'd never tried before through fears for our safety - hire a bike. I have to say that that it was brilliant, I'd go as far as recommending that you hire a bike for the duration of your stay as we got to see areas of the city that we've never been to and would be unlikely be able to cover on foot. It's actually less stressful dealing with the traffic on a bike than on foot, and give you the chance to take in the scenery. We didn't eat at the hotel, there are so many places nearbythe hardest thing is choosing where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!! Big quiet rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: mooresf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent!! Walking distance from the central train station and close to everything. Very quiet and clean and free internet. The staff was extremely friendly. I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: ams
Reviews.Content: I suppose having read so many glowing reviews of this hotel, I was expecting something amazing. Instead, we got a perfectly decent stay but nothing to rave about. Certainly convenience is a major advantage to this property: located in a side alley between two of the city's main shopping streets just a few minutes' walk from Central Station, its location was good. Just along the alley is a cheap, quick noodle bar - great for a filling quick meal if you're fed up with chips with mayonnaise... We asked for a quiet room and were given one overlooking the rooftops at the back of the property, thus avoiding any potential noise drifting over from the numerous bars in the vicinity. The room itself was perfectly OK - just standard chain hotel stuff, though. A well kitted out (again, very small for those more familiar with US hotels) bathroom with good quality fittings complimented our clean, pleasant room. A small TV on a somewhat wonky wall mounting was adequate for us but guests used to large/flat screen efforts in similarly ranked hotels might not be impressed. The mattresses felt like foam and didn't offer a great deal in terms of support. However, for our one night stay it was fine. Our 'twin' room was in fact set up initially as a king, but with two beds pushed together it was simple enough to pull them apart. However, space was not at a premium and so we kept ours close. A rather obvious dried white stain on the generally filthy bedspread was relatively quickly replaced by housekeeping staff. However, we were unimpressed that it was on the bed in such a state to begin with. In all, should you get a good rate on Expedia or similar, I'd recommend this property for its sheer conveneince/location. If money is no object, I'd suggest you go elsewhere as you're not going to get anyhting above the average if your stay is anythig like ours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel in May 06. Although we didn't stay inside much as we wanted to explore the city of Amsterdam in the 3 days we had there. Upon entry to leaving the staff were absolutely outstanding and very, very helpful. This is the first hotel I have ever been to where the cleaning lady knocks on the door in the morning and asks if everything is ok and to contact her at the end of the corridor if there is anything we needed. Superb service. The bell boys were very accomadating on the day we were leaving allowing us to put our bags in a store for 4 hours before our flight. The room itself was a good size. It had a lovely bathroom with power shower. There was a safe for valuables, mini-bar, etc. Very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not wish to stay in a 2* hotel, but be perpared to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, lovely staff & brilliant sized room with amazing comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, We have just come back from the Dam. We went for a 3 nighter over the Easter Holiday, Tulip Hotel is a brilliant location as your right outside the tram stops which you can get to anywhere around the centre of the Dam or you can walk as your so close to everything, if your into the coffeeshops Betty Boo is across the road or around the corner you have Grasshopper, De Kulk & La Canna, also if your into snack takeaway food try the chinese Wok to Walk was brilliant, they cook the food fresh right in front of you all for Â£5. The staff at the Tulip were really nice and extremely helpful. The bedrooms are really clean, large with a queen sized bed, such a comfortable matress (foam which snugges around your body), bathrooms are nice and clean the best bit is the bath/shower, the water is just so hot just what you need after walking around all day long. (Tip for sore feet.. put your feet in the bath at the end of the day, put in boiling hot water leave feet in their for 10 minutes). This will get help sooth and heal blisters etc. Nice and quite at nightimes, no noises from the hotel or outside. The breakfast was included in our package, it was OK, choice of continential, fruits, yogurt, Hot boiled eggs, various breads for toast, fruit juices, tea, coffee, Hot Scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, beans. Well what can we say, the Golden Tulip Hotel is a really perfect hotel, better than the Swissotel in Dam Square where we stayed last year which was awful especially at twice the price of the Golden Tulip.!!! We went to Madam Tussads in Dam Square paid Â£30 GP. for two adults, what a load of rubbish save your money and go and do something else. Just another tip, the Trams stop at midnight, however the buses take over and they don't stop unti 6am then the trams take over again, you will never be stranded. (Trams have two entrance doors and two exit doors make sure you try to go to the right doors, we had great fun working this out!!! NOT!! LOL) Main shopping street if just off Dam Square, really cheap and so trendy, we brought loads of tops, funky jeans etc. For a dinner something different around the corner from the Tulip Hotel is KOBE sushi restaurant, they cook the food on your table, a bit expensive but what a lovely night and the waiters are really nice, open until 11pm. Can't wait to stay again at the Golden Tulip Hotel. If your a lover of flavoured teas try the lemon or strawberry flavours they are great. Hope our review has helped your decisions, have a wonderful time in the Dam. Kindest Heather & Anna XX

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year @ the Golden Tulip”
Reviews.Author: deepimpactuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two years - okay, over New Year 2006. Found it very nice and comfortable - the bed's are fantastic. Didn't really use the facilities as was only here for 2 nights, but found the hotel to be in a very central location - the Centraal station is just 300 metres away, and there are also restaurants & bars in the surrounding area. If you want somewhere really close to the centre of Amsterdam, this isn't for you. It's about 50 minutes away from the centre by car. Overall, very nice & pleasant place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very satisfied with The Golden Tulip Centre. The hotel was very close to Central Station and in a quiet courtyard. A shuttle stopped very close to the hotel. The room was very nice, especially the bathroom, altho on the small side. If you want a relatively reasonably priced 4-star hotel in a great location, The Golden Tulip is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “So Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Shekki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam-Centre just the other night. I was so pleased. I am a female who was staying with friends at a hostel for the first part of the week. They left early and I stayed for one night alone at the Golden Tulip. I arrived early and was able to check in at 10am. The room was spotless. I didn't need to wear sandals inside the room or shower! I was a little concerned about being alone in this area, but there were always so many people about I felt safe. I went out after dark and had dinner and then went to Cafe de Kuil a nearby coffeeshop and had a beer. No problem. The room was very quiet also. I got my rate through the internet for 125 USD. I usually stay somewhere cheap in Amsterdam, like a hostel, but this is soo much better! The staff was friendly and it is literally a 5 minute walk form the station.

Reviews.Title: “Fab-U-Lous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on second trip to the Dam, what a little treasure! The location is just excellent everything you need and more is on the doorstep. Places to eat, shop, smoke etc ect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but, and its a big but! You have to try and get the best price I paid Â£140 for 3 nights (including flights etc.)Which I thought was fab but since I have not been able to get a good deal. The prices are going up and up because of such location. The rooms are clean and comfy too so a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: kyrikos
Reviews.Content: I tried really hard to find a low budget hotel in Amsterdam and a good location. That was a really good hotel in the centre near the main market. Rooms were nice, so was the service. and the overall activities were really good. There are much better hotels in Amsterdam, but this is a good location, great rooms and very clean atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Karen48
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We had booked an executive room but on arrival we found it to be very small and not what I would expect from a 4* hotel. We upgraded to a business room which was a little bigger but still didnt provide anywhere for me to do my hair etc - a dressing table would have been good! The breakfast I found expensive for what was available. I found the hotel to be clean and tidy, though the sheets didn't fit on the queen size bed and the towels at times were not best ever, but they were changed daily. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Best of all was the location, it was excellent. Its is only a 10 minute walk to the centraal station and the canal bus. It was within walking distance to most attractions if you like a walk, if not the transport system is excellent and the trams stop almost outside the front door. I would return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “If you can secure a good rate go for it”
Reviews.Author: AlanLee
Reviews.Content: Above average for the price paid 110.00 euro per night this excluded breakfast, booked via hotels web site. 110.00 euro is a much reduced rate as the Dam is not particularly busy this time of year, it doesnâ€™t get busy until Easter when the rates go up dramatically. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. Rooms are comfortable although a little on the small side. The only difference between a "deluxe" and "superior" room is that the "superior" has one large bed, the "deluxe" rooms have two twin beds pushed together, other than that the room is exactly the same. Even at the reduced rate there is a difference of 30.00 euro for a "superior". I can understand why a couple would want one bed but donâ€™t pay 30.00 euro + thinking that you will have a nicer room because you wonâ€™t. I would be more than happy to stay again at the reduced rate but the higher rates charged during peak times are expensive. The rooms are not â€œdeluxeâ€� or â€œsuperiorâ€�, however, they are comfortable and clean and you are less likely to get the rowdy crowd staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Golden Tulip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in The Golden Tulip Inntel - Amsterdam Centre last week. We found the staff to be friendly and the hotel in general was clean. Our room was cleaned every morning which was great as some hotels i have stayed in elsewhere would not have been cleaned daily!! The only thing was that the room was surprisingly small! It looked alot bigger on the virtual tour on the hotel's website. The only major letdowns: no dinner in the hotel & breakfast was a whopping â‚¬18.00!!! Apart from that we had a great time in Amsterdam and we will certainly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: PooleSunshine
Reviews.Content: A lively group of 6 of my family went to Amsterdam for the first time and stayed at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam-Centre. We got a really good deal via ---- and paid 234 Euros for 2 nights for a deuluxe double room including breakfast (per couple). The hotel was beautiful with everything very new looking and to a high standard. They also has all their Xmas decorations up and it made it look even more special. The rooms just as nice however they seemed a little small perhaps due to the size of the super king size bed which was a very nice touch. The location of the hotel was perfect for us new comers as we wanted to be within easy reach of all the main attractions. Breakfast was nice and a wide variety including a good attempt at cooked breakfast as well as cereal, fruit, crossants all that continental stuff. They did have a nice bar downstairs but they didn't keep it open as much as they should (ie their opening times) but they were happy to open it for us. Staff were ever so friendly and really made us feel very welcome in such a posh looking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location for transport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous when we walked in, the lobby looked lovely and the drinks there were really not that expensive (there was mulled wine for only 2 euros, but that was the cheapest [the rest were beween 3.50-6.50). It's very close to the station (about 5 mins) from Amsterdam Centraal. Once you leave the station (on the side where to get the trams), just walk straight down (Niewezijds Voorburgwal) and it is on your left hand side. It's it's got another name, so just in case you think you've got the wrong one, you haven't. There is a square of trees and nearby a Betty Boop shaped sign. As for someone mentioning it's in a dodgy area, Amsterdam is one of the safest places in the world, I really doubt you'd have to worry. Anyway, the staff were very polite. However, I wouldn't say that the rooms were amazing for a 4 star. I would say it would be a 3 1/2, nice, but I've been in classier ones. Also, when they say sattelite, some is pay TV (for the movie channels and a couple of dodgy, dirty ones [you have been warned]), but there are a few (4 or 5 English channels [2 including BBC1 and BBC2]). There is no milk for tea's (although there is the powdered stuff for the coffee) and by the way the double rooms have a double bed (not two pushed together). I'm letting you know this because the first night they put us in the wrong room from the one we had paid for, but were very apologetic about the whole thing and let us have a much nicer one. The room was very clean though and the overall experience was nice, so I would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: darrylpmatthews
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just round the corner from the Central Train station (5-10min walk), and is close to everything that Amsterdam has to offer. Check-in was quick, and the rooms were clean, and adequate for your needs. let's face it, you don't go to Amsterdam to sit in your room do you?! Bed was comfortable and the room was of a good size (we had an executive room). Never had breakfast in the hotel but the breakfast room always seemed busy when passing. The hotel does not have a restaurant of it's own - BUT, next door is a fantastic restaurant called "Humphreys". Give it a try, the food was fantastic and for 20 euro's you got a 3 course meal, VERY GOOD VALUE! All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Golden Tulip - excellent location, staff friendly and helpful - We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: woodhurst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 19th + 20th February and have stayed here before. Its just so convenient for the Central Station, dont get a taxi its just 5 minutes walk. The reception were very friendly "Have you stayed here before?" "Yes" I said" "Then all I need is a signature" came the reply. The room was excellent. You only appreciate how the location is so good that when out shopping, and you have a few bags the hotel is 3 minutes from the shops and its easy to go back and drop them off. One problem. On day 1 a mouse ran into the dining room and back out much to the amusement of the staff. Dont panic though, I contacted management who wee at pains to assure me that this was due to a delivery of food on the ground floor. It goes to the 1st floor by service lift. Amsterdam has a terrible mouse problem and althoughg they check the load, one got in. To be fair the managememnt refunded breakfast costs but the eating area is spotless, I really would not worry. Highly recommended, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about location”
Reviews.Author: AustinStack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Feb 10-13 and found it to be very satisfactory. It was 5 mins from train station, however get directions beforehand as Amsterdam is a maze! Its beside a tram stop (use the 1,2,5 for Leidesplein), and the Canal Boats are between it and the train station. It's also beside Dam Square and the shoppping areas. I booked a 'Deluxe Room' for â‚¬450, 3 nights, and on arrival was told we had been upgraded to an Executive. But don't be fooled, the room was still quite small. In addition, although we got a 'special offer' discount for breakfast, this was 12.50 per person extra, which we normally ensure is included in hotel prices. Lobby bar was nice, quiet and cosy, and the breakfast buffet was hot, varied and tasty. I'd stay there again, but wont be fooled by the descriptions of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Golden Tulip Hotel Inntel Amsterdam Centre for 3 nights. Got an excellent deal for hotel only with Thomson Citybreaks, paid Â£208 for the 3 nights which included breakfast and taxes (it was on a 3 nights for the price of 2 offer for the dates we chose). We cannot fault this hotel. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted twin beds or a double and a smoking or non smoking room. We chose double non smoking and when we were given our room number we were told we had been given an upgrade, free of charge. The room was lovely. It was modern, nicely furnished and spotlessly clean and the bed was at least king size, if not superking and really comfortable. In fact I think it's the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. The bathroom was equally impressive with nice toiletries! Also there is a safe in the wardrobe which is free of charge so you don't have to carry all your valuables with you while you're sightseeing. The breakfast is good with all the usual continental choices plus eggs bacon sausages etc.Lovely coffee! As for the staff, they were all friendly and helpful without exception. (In fact everywhere we went we found the people to be really nice.) The location is good too. Would we stay there again? Definitely! and we would recommend it to friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A1 Location, good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: big_punter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just after Christmas for a few nights, last year (2004), and enjoyed the stay. Clean, large rooms with all mod cons, roomy bathroom, everything you need. BBC1&2 from memory as well. Staff were friendly, the only complaint I had was the cost of the breakfast was insane - something like EUR12-14 for what was essentially toast & scrambled eggs or cereal. Great location, only a short walk from the station, and on a quiet side street just off the main road with trams to the places towards the south of the city (museums etc.). I would recommend this hotel readily.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wkd time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for my bf's bday 2/12/05 to 4/12/05. Hotel very posh lovely room and lovely entrance and also the hotel bar was very nice with open fire burning away. Bed was massive. Very pleased would recommend as its near everything and would defo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “overated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great location. Just a few minutes walk from the station. Rooms were lovely and big, shower and bath as well. A huge bed, which we discovered were actualy 2 single beds pushed together. I discovered this during the night when i woke up and found my leg was missing but had actualy fallen down between the beds! Overall the hotel was spotlessly clean, however, after the first night i discovered the blanket on the bed was covered in brown stains from top to bottom. The housekeeper who was very friendly and helpful, changed it straightaway. I mentioned it to reception and said I was not very happy about it. They informed me they would look into it but it was never mentioned again! whilst checking out I was even asked to pay 4 euros for the bottle of water i had consumed from the minibar!!!! Reception staff were helpful however the staff at breakfast were very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dungareemarine
Reviews.Content: The location is good for shopping and plenty of public transportation for museum visits. A variety of eating places surround the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a full buffet for both European and American style. I stayed a week and had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with on and off WiFi service.Expedia/Hotel didn't tell us breakfast wasn't included and we were presented with a bill for 70 Euros when we left! Would stay there again but would go out for breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, comfy and modern!”
Reviews.Author: minniecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and had a lovely time exploring Amsterdam, and then retreating to our room. We booked a superior room on one of the Dutch booking websites to get the best price, and were not disappointed. The staff are polite and welcoming, with very good service. The bar/lounge area is lovely - an open fire is situated in the middle, which adds a traditional feel to this otherwise modern hotel. There are also two computers for free internet access. The location is great - quiet in the evenings, so no trouble sleeping, but just a short walk from Dam square. There is a main tram stop on the main road just a short walk from the hotel, and although the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from central station, you won't hear any trains. The only thing you won't get with this hotel is a view, as it isn't by a canal, or on Dam square itself, but it didn't bother us. The room wasn't huge, but certainly clean and comfortable, offering everything we needed - hangers, tea tray, TV with English channels and films (and porn if you want it)! (This is Amsterdam, after all - if you have kids, don't let them turn on the tv unsupervised!) The bathroom was clean, and the decor was in good condition. The only thing which disappointed us was the breakfast. They will offer you a discount voucher for breakfast when you check in, so that you pay 12.50 euros, but it's not worth it. Luckily, we hadn't booked it in advance, so we popped in one morning just to try it and see if it's worth the price, but it isn't! It's a shame, as it is the only fault of the hotel, and the breakfast room looks lovely from the outside, but it's not a problem, as there are loads of restaurants and tea rooms within a two minute walk, offering a much cheaper, English breakfast. I would stay at this hotel again, but eat out for breakfast. We did see other hotels around the canals, probably with better views, but they didn't look as nice to be honest. When you are looking for the hotel, be aware that it says 'Golden Tulip Inntel' on the front, and not 'Golden Tulip Amsterdam Centre' as you might expect. I've given this hotel 4 rather than 5 simply because of the lack of breakfast and view. Extra note: If you go to Amsterdam, visit the Ann Frank house museum - it was very moving and worth the visit, even though it is not included in the 'Amsterdam Card'.

Reviews.Title: “inntel is great”
Reviews.Author: hoppefan
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed at the inntel from 23 till 26 sept 05.we found the staff and facilities great and are giving the hotel a "excellent" rating.. Andrea and Warner Kolb,

Reviews.Title: “Check Price for Breakfast at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocknkz
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of dropping in for the breakfast buffet. It cost me 55 euro when I checked out. The food was good, but not THAT good.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place..”
Reviews.Author: IUBBFAN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at this hotel on Sept 14th. The hotel is very nice and modern, it is located on a really nice little square with tables to sit at restaraunts etc. The rooms were nicely equipped with modern furniture and appliances. Overall I liked this hotel and would consider returning on a future visit. Our room was 99 Euros, whick was a pretty good deal in my view. Only a 5 minute walk from central station and close to other sights in central amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “It was just right!”
Reviews.Author: jdbhouston
Reviews.Content: Located between Centraal Station and Dam Square, this was a terrific location. Staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived early Friday morning from a transatlantic flight, and they were very accomodating in getting us a room as soon as possible. They were great in recommending dining options and helping us navigate the tram system. There were three downsides: First, you have to put your room keycard in a special slot in the room to turn on the lights/airconditioning, so when we left, the AC went off and the room was uncomfortable when we returned...They did give us an extra key, but housekeeping apparently took it when they finished each day. Second, the bathtub/shower had this strange half-length window/door instead of a shower curtain or full closure, so I always felt I needed to huddle near the shower head so as not to spray water out...maybe I was using it wrong? Finally, the housekeeping staff doesn't seem to think the "Do not disturb" sign applies to them...if we weren't out of the room in time, the phone was ringing and there was knocking on the door! Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: scb85
Reviews.Content: Stayed on recommendation of easytobook, which gave a very good rate. Hotel staff were helpful and the free internet in the lobby was great. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Location was walking distance from Central station and a quick tram ride to everywhere in the city. Amsterdam is a walking city and this hotel was just far enough from the main street for some peace and quiet. The neighborhoods closer to the museum district, however, are nicer, but it only took about 10-15 minutes to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mamagata
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inntel for eight nights in May of this year. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. Although we arrived before the posted check-in time, they gave us a room and even up-graded us! When our first room turned out to be noisy after the adjacent outdoor cafe opened, they gave us an even larger, quiet room in the back. The location was wonderful - about a 5 minute walk to the Centraal Station along the main street adjacent to the hotel and just steps to a tram stop. Also on that main street are some great restaurants - Gaucho's (Argentinian steak), Ankara (Turkish), and the very crowded Oud Holland. Our only complaint was the absence of dresser drawers that we Americans are used to. In addition to a closet, there were a few shelves & cubbies in which to store clothing. Although we spent eight nights, we could have used one more because there is so much to see and do in and around Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “what a find”
Reviews.Author: jets4hire
Reviews.Content: we have visited this lovely country on every trip thru europe and have paid much more for much less at competing hotels. the rooms are well appointed, tv has lots of english speaking channels and the bathrooms are quite modern and large enough for two people to use at the same time. the common areas are modern and well furnished with elevators controlled by room keys for security. all the major attractions are easy to reach from this hotel and the central train station is a short walk. a stay at a similar hotel of this quality will cost you 2 to 4 times the money. the staff is excellent ,everyone speaks english right down to the maids. what the hotel does need is a good power washing to get that exterior lobby back to its original luster step outside the hotel door and your in a open air plaza with boutque shops, pubs, restaurants, table and chairs(when weather permits)for dining and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable value but not near the action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden tulip Inn for 2 nights 14-15 April 05. Mostly agree with the other reviews in that the hotel was nice enough but it was a little odd having a glass see-thru wall around the bath room. We would have preferred being closer to the action around Lieden and the Reichs. Though buses run frequently there is no place to eat near by other than the hotel which is good but a bit pricy. Mass transportation in the city is very efficient so staying away from the central station is ok as long as there is life near by.

Reviews.Title: “Location/Location”
Reviews.Author: smkr75
Reviews.Content: I just finished 3 nights at the Golden Tulip Inntel. I stayed in one of their Executive Rooms which appeared a bit more spacious than some of the other rooms. It had a Queen size bed, "exective chair", data ports on the phones, spacious bathroom with both tub and shower and a decent sized closet for hanging things. No view but quiet even with the window open. I had breakfast one day and it pretty typical for hotel breakfasts but expensive (17.5 Euros) considering all the other options available for the same or less. The hotel's location is between the Central Station and Dam Square so you are right in the middle of things. I was able to get a good price thru the Golden Tulip website. Shop around for best prices. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of typical American chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ABEFlyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights after getting great price on another website. Great location for tourist. Very nice and clean although housekeeping is very persistent if not up and out by nine in the morning. Reminded me of typical American chain hotel. Staff were great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay in AMS”
Reviews.Author: ElGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GT Inntel the for New Years 2004. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, hotel felt safe and secure, and the room was very nice. The location is fantastic providing an easy walk to almost anywhere and the tram passes by very close for those further destinations. Our stay was very expensive but enjoyable. Finding the hotel at first was a bit difficult because of the street names. Highly recommend and will probably stay here again when/if we return to AMS.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: shell76
Reviews.Content: I stopped in this hotel for 2 nights in Feb 2005 and found it to be very clean, comfortable and in an excellent location. We booked via the hotels own website and a double room cost us Â£70 a night which was much cheaper than a lot of the dodgier looking hotels that we looked at. The mini bar and tea and coffee making facilities in the room are a bonus and the staff are pleasant and helpful. Its a 5 minute walk to the station and to the Grasshopper which was an added bonus as it saved us from taxi fare's and getting lost in the maze of streets that make up Amsterdam. I would definately recommend this hotel and will be stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service great location”
Reviews.Author: Rodcar
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night break at this hotel & it was great. The location is spot on for all the sights & everyones tastes. We found the staff friendly & extremely helpful. I would definately go back to the G.Tulip. It is also worthwhile shopping around to find a deal that includes breakfast as it superb, with a buffet on offer that ranges from full english to continental.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but expensive breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Stephenr10
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Amsterdam, and our lovely stay was made even better by the fact that we picked a really nice hotel. The location of the hotel is ideal, the rooms were clean and the staff were pleasant. Breakfast is a hefty 17.5 euros per person per night. Breakfast is GOOD and is a buffet offering such delights as cereal, cold meats, croissants, natural yogurt and your traditional English fry up fare. So if you love your breakfasts to be BIG go for the breakfast option; if however you prefer just to have a light start to the morning you are much better off not paying for breakfast and going else where. On the subject of food, make sure you spend one evening in the restaurant next door (Humphreys). At 19 Euros for a (delicious) 3 course meal this restaurant is excellent value. Would definitely go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Inntel Hotels Amsterdam Centre
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijdskolk 19, Amsterdam 1012 PV, The Netherlands
